proverbs: Ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ ogun la mọ̀, ẹnìkan kìí mọ ìparí rẹ̀
meaning: Always seek peace; no one ever knows the full ramifications of a quarrel at the beginning

proverbs: Òkun kìí hó ruru ká wàá ruru
meaning: Be patient; complex issues need to be patiently handled

proverbs: Màjà màsá làá mọ akínkanjú, èyí tó mọ̀ọ́ jà tí ò mọ̀ọ́ sá, irú wọn níí bógun lọ
meaning: Who fights and run away at the point of death, lives to fight some other day

proverbs: Kékeré la ti ń pẹ̀kan ìrókò, torí tí ó bá dàgbà tán ẹbọ níí gbà
meaning: An evil habit is easily subdued in the beginning but when it becomes incurable it gains strength

proverbs: Àìmọ̀kan àìmọ̀kan ní èkúté ṣe ń pe ológbò níjà
meaning: Never taunt an adversary you cannot handle

proverbs: Ọ̀rọ̀ pẹ̀lẹ́ ní yọ obì lápò
meaning: Soft words win hard hearts

proverbs: Ìdọ̀bálẹ̀ kìí ṣe ìwà
meaning: One prostrating is not tantamount to good manners.

proverbs: Máfara kànmí kìí lọ sọ́jà lo ra nǹkan
meaning: Who does not want to relate and be touched must resist going to the market-place.

proverbs: Ohun tó wù ọ́ ò wùmí, l’ọmọ ìyá méjì ṣe ń jẹun lọ́tọ́ọ̀tọ̀
meaning: All men do not admire and love the same objects, hence the reason for children of the same mother to eat with different plates.

proverbs: A gbọ́ ẹjọ́ ẹnìkan dá, àgbà òṣìkà ni
meaning: A wise mediator seeks balance, fairness and equity in resolving disputes

proverbs: Oko kìí jẹ́ ti baba t’ọmọ kómá ní ààlà
meaning: It emphasizes the importance of boundaries and clear distinctions, especially in matters of ownership or responsibility

proverbs: Mọ̀wà fún oníwà níí jẹ́ ọ̀rẹ́ jọ̀rẹ́
meaning: To know people according to their beliefs and character is the means to enhance friendship

proverbs: Àì fàgbà fẹ́nìkan ni ò jẹ́ ayé ó rójú
meaning: Lack of respect for the elders is the root of the crisis in the world.

proverbs: Kò sí ìgbà tí a dáṣọ tí a kò rí ilẹ̀ fi wọ́
meaning: Contentment and patient is crucial

proverbs: Ojú kì í pọnni ká fàkísà bora.
meaning: Despite adverse circumstances, one should strive to maintain one’s dignity

proverbs: San là ń rìn; ajé ní múni pá kọ̀rọ̀.
meaning: When one is in debt, one’s freedom of movement is compromised.

proverbs: Aṣọ ńlá kọ́ ni èèyàn ńlá, Ìrínisí ni ìsọnilọ́jọ̀
meaning: Appearance can be deceptive

proverbs: A kì í ṣe fáàárí itọ́ dídà sọ́mọ a-kú wárápá.
meaning: Never make fun of afflicted people by mimicking their affliction

proverbs: Àgbà òṣìkà ń gbin ìyà sílẹ̀ de ọmọ-ọ rẹ̀.
meaning: One’s character often affects the fortunes of one’s children

proverbs: Ará ìwájú tó jìn sí kòtò èrò ẹ̀yìn ló kán lọ́gbọ́n.
meaning: A leader's mistake serves as a lesson in wisdom for the followers.

proverbs: Ẹní rúbọ òrìṣà-á gbọ́dọ̀ rú ti èèyàn kí ẹbọ-ọ́ tó gbà.
meaning: One can please the gods and yet run afoul of humans

proverbs: Iná èsìsì kì í jóni lẹ́ẹ̀mejì.
meaning: If you have a bad experience doing something the first time, you'll be more cautious and worried about doing it a second time

proverbs: Iṣú ta iṣu ò ta, ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan là ń wúṣu lébè.
meaning: There is no task so small or insignificant that it does not deserve care and attention.

proverbs: Ohun tó jọ ohun la fi ń wé ohun; èpo ẹ̀pà ló jọ ìtẹ́ ẹ̀lírí.
meaning: One should observe propriety in dealing with people respectable people.

proverbs: Orí tí yóò jẹ igún kì í gbọ́; bí wọ́n fun ládìẹ kò níí gbà.
meaning: The person destined to suffer will manage to succumb to the suffering even in spite of efforts by others to save him/her.

proverbs: Arúgbó ṣoge rí, àkísà-á lògbà rí.
meaning: Those who are favored should remember that times and circumstances do change

proverbs: Gbogbo ajá ní ń jẹ imí: èyí tó bá jẹ tiẹ̀ bẹ́nu laráyé ń pè ní dìgbòlugi.
meaning: No one is without blemish, but one must keep one’s flaws within reasonable bounds.

proverbs: Labalábá kì í bá wọn nájà ẹlẹ́gùn-ún; aṣọ-ọ ẹ̀ á fàya.
meaning: One should know one’s limitations and act accordingly

proverbs: Ogun àgbọ́tẹ́lẹ̀ kì í pa arọ, ìyẹn fárọ tó bá gbọ́n.
meaning: One must take advantage of foreknowledge to protect oneself.

proverbs: Ohun tí ajá rí tó fi ń gbó ò tó èyí tí àgùntán fi ń ṣèran wò.
meaning: Some people make mountains out of other people’s molehills.

proverbs: Ẹyẹlé kì í bónílé jẹ, kó bónílé mu, kó dọjọ́ ikú kó yẹrí.
meaning: If one shares the good times with a person, one should be prepared to share the bad times also.

proverbs: Ọjọ́ àkàrà ìyá bá kùtà là ń mọ ọmọ tó lè jẹ̀kọ.
meaning: Difficult situations often reveal your true allies.

proverbs: Bí òkété bá dàgbà tán ọmú ọmọ rẹ̀ ní mu
meaning: Once a squirrel gets old, it sucks its child’s breasts.

proverbs: Ọjọ́ a bá kọ́lẹ làá kọ́nú rírọ̀.
meaning: One a decision is made, one must embrace its consequences

proverbs: Bí ológìnní bá lọ sájò tó bọ̀, inú èkúté a bàjẹ́.
meaning: The oppressed always bemoan their oppressor’s good fortune.

proverbs: Bí eégún ò bá ṣe ohun tó tóbi, atọ́kùn-un rẹ̀ kì í tú u wò.
meaning: Only extraordinary actions call for extraordinary reactions.

proverbs: Bí ayé bá já, kò ṣéé so.
meaning: A lost life is irretrievable

proverbs: Ayé ò ríni nígbà tí a sun ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ jẹ; ìgbà tí a fi ẹ̀gúsí sebẹ̀ tó pọ́n bí edé layé ríni.
meaning: People have time only for those whose stars are ascending

proverbs: Ayé ò fẹ́ni fọ́rọ̀, àfi orí ẹni.
meaning: Only one’s guardian spirit, not other people, wishes one to prosper.

proverbs: Àjùmọ̀bí ò kan tàánú, ẹni ọlọ́run rán síni ní ṣeni lóore
meaning: Arm of flesh often fails: place your hope in no one; look unto God as your ultimate source.

proverbs: Àì-kúkú-joyè, ó sàn ju, ‘‘Ẹnu mi ò ká ìlú’’ lọ.
meaning: A person who does not assume a responsibility is better off than a person who takes it on and fails to fulfill it.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá jẹun sẹ́yìn àwo, ààrà ò lè bo ibi táa ti jẹun.
meaning: There is no smoke without a fire, there is no problem without a cause or a root, in order to get rid of the problem eliminate the source of the problem

proverbs: Ọ̀dájú ló bówó, ìtìjú ló bí gbèsè
meaning: Nothing succeeds without audaciousness. If you must succeed in life you would have to wear your garment of audacity.

proverbs: Ọ̀nà làá ṣì mọ̀nà bí a ò bá ṣubú, a kì í mọ ẹrù ẹníí dì
meaning: Errors and failures are opportunities to learn

proverbs: Ogún ẹni kì í pọ̀ títí ká pin fáráadúgbọ̀.
meaning: One must learn how to manage one’s resources wisely

proverbs: Ìpàkọ́ onípàkọ́ là ń rí; eniẹlẹ́ni ní ń rí tẹni.
meaning: One usually pays closer attention to other people’s faults than to one’s own, of which others are quite aware.

proverbs: Ọ̀gọ́ tà, ọ̀gọ́ ò tà, owó aláàárù á pé
meaning: Whether a civil servant performs his/her duties or not, salary will be paid at the end of the month.

proverbs: O ò bá so iyùn kó o so sège mọ́rùn pẹ̀lú, bí ata wẹrẹ báyìí ni óò rí lójù a búni.
meaning: Regardless of your popularity, your haters will still see you as worthless.

proverbs: Àìrìn jìnà la ò bá wọn rábuké ọ̀kẹ́rẹ́, afọ́jú ẹyẹ́ ń bẹ lókò kánrin kése.
meaning: Do not prove that you know it all. Be open minded and teachable

proverbs: Ohun tí láwóróko ṣe tó gbowó, ohun náà ni láwóródo ṣe tó fi gba ìfọ́tí olóòyí.
meaning: The human journey is quite different and unique in their own ways. What works for others might not work for you.

proverbs: A kì í yàgò fún ẹlẹ́ṣin àná.
meaning: Past glory avails little in the present.

proverbs: A kì í yàgò fún ‘‘Mo gun ẹṣin rí o!’’
meaning: People should not expect to live on past glory.

proverbs: A léṣu sílẹ̀ páńdọ̀rọ̀-ọ́ já lù ú; èlé ni bénì?
meaning: The fruit might look something like a yam, but it does not belong with yams.

proverbs: À ń báni mú adìẹ à ń forúnkún bó; bówó bá ba òkókó, a ò ní fún aládìẹ?
meaning: One should not be overzealous in helping others, especially when no benefit will accrue to one from the effort.

proverbs: À ń bẹ̀rù alájá, ajá ṣebí òun là ń bẹ̀rù.
meaning: A person who has a powerful patron mistakenly believes that the respect he enjoys from others is due to his or her own qualities, whereas it is reflected from the patron.

proverbs: À ń gé e lọ́wọ́, ó ń bọ òrùka.
meaning: The person has been judged undeserving of a hand; it is an affront, therefore, for him or her to adorn the fingers—an indication of heedlessness.

proverbs: A ní ká wá ẹni tó lẹ́hìn ká fọmọ fún, abuké ní òun rèé; ti gànnàkù ẹ̀hìn-in rẹ̀ là ń wí?
meaning: Since the expression that translates as ‘‘prominent back’’ is an idiom meaning a proud pedigree. the humpback makes a rather embarrassing mistake.

proverbs: A ní Tanlúkú ò mọ̀-ọ́ jó, Tàǹlukú wá gbè é lẹ́sẹ̀.
meaning: A person who is as helpless as the person in trouble should not offer to rescue him/her.

proverbs: À ń já ìbàǹtẹ́ ẹ̀ lẹ́hìn, ó ń já tará iwájú.
meaning: Attacks on him do not stop him from belaboring his enemies.

proverbs: À ń sọ̀rọ̀ olè, aboyún ń dáhùn; odiidi èèyàn ló gbé pamọ́.
meaning: Her condition makes her guilty of concealment.

proverbs: À ń sunkún Awúgbó, Awúgbó ò sunkún ara-a ẹ̀.
meaning: The person the proverb is aimed at is too daft to realize his or her sorry plight.

proverbs: À ń wá ẹni tí a ó fọmọ fún, olòṣì ń yọjú.
meaning: People should know their place and not overrate themselves.

proverbs: À ń wọ́nà àti fi aṣiwèrè sílẹ̀, ó ní bí a bá dé òkè odò ká dúró de òun.
meaning: If people are seeking ways of getting rid of a person, that person should not lay down his conditions for remaining with them

proverbs: A ò lóbìnrin à ń dá oóyọ́ sí; bí a bá dá oóyọ́ sí ewúrẹ́ ni yó jẹ .
meaning: The vegetable is used in stews, and stews are for wives to cook.

proverbs: A ò mọ ohun tí Dárò-ó ní kó tó wí pé olè-é kó òun.
meaning: The poor person conveniently blames his poverty on thieves.

proverbs: A ò mọ ohun tí eléwé-e gbégbé ń tà kó tó sọ pé ọjà ò tà.
meaning: The seller of goods nobody wants blames her fortune on the slow market.

proverbs: A pè ọ́ lọ́mọ erín-màgbọn ò ń yọ̀; ìwọ pàápàá ló mì í?
meaning: The description honors the father, not the person being addressed

proverbs: A rí èyí rí ni tonílé; a ò rí èyí rí ni tàlejò; bónílé bá ní ká jẹ tán, àlejò a ní ká jẹ kù.
meaning: A host might minimize his hospitality, but the guest should praise it; if the host is lavish, the guest should not be greedy.

proverbs: A rígi lóko ká tó fi ọ̀mọ̀ gbẹ́ ìlù.
meaning: One should never presume to be the only possible answer to every challenge.

proverbs: A sìnkú tán, alugbá ò lọ; ó fẹ́ẹ́ ṣúpó ni?
meaning: One should always know when to take one’s leave.

proverbs: Aaka ò gbé ọ̀dàn; igbó ní ń gbé.
meaning: Certain things are proper; certain things are not.

proverbs: Àáyá yó níjọ́ kan, ó ní ká ká òun léhín ọ̀kánkán.
meaning: Excessive happiness made the animal careless.

proverbs: Aáyán ati eèràá ṣígun, wọ́ ní àwọn ń lọ mú adìẹ; àlọ la rí, a ò rábọ̀.
Aáyán fẹ́ gẹṣin; adìẹ ni ò gbà fún un.
meaning: A cockroach that stirs in the presence of a chicken is as good as dead.

proverbs: Aáyán fẹ́ jó; adìẹ ni ò jẹ́ .
meaning: The chickens will eagerly peck it to death.

proverbs: Aáyán kì í yán ẹsẹ̀ erin; èèyàn kì í yán ẹsẹ̀ irò.
meaning: One should not take on adversaries one cannot match.

proverbs: Àbá ni ikán ń dá; ikán ò lè mu òkúta.
meaning: Though termites may make their tunnels on a rock, the rock will be safe.

proverbs: A-báni-gbé kì í yáná; a-bọ̀rìṣà kì í sun òtútù; ẹyin gẹ́gẹ́ kì í gbé àwùjọ; ilé kannáà ni wọ́n kọ́ fún àwọn mẹ́tẹ̀ẹ̀ta.
meaning: Know yourself and your place.

proverbs: A-bánijẹun-bí-aláìmọra, ó bu òkèlè bí ẹ̀gbọ́n ìyá ẹ̀.
meaning: When eating in company, one should be restrained. A man eating with the child of his younger sister need show no such restraint.

proverbs: A-bèèrè kì í ṣìnà.
meaning: One should admit one’s weaknesses.

proverbs: À-bí-ì-kọ́; à-kọ́-ì-gbà; òde ló ti ń kọ́gbọ́n wálé.
meaning: Look well to your child’s upbringing.

proverbs: A-binú-fùfù ní ń wá oúnjẹ fún a-binú wẹ́rẹ́ -wẹ́rẹ́ .
meaning: Whatever good fortune might have been meant for the volatile person will wind up in the lot of the mild-mannered person.

proverbs: Aboyún kì í jó bẹ̀mbẹ́ : a-bodò-ikùn kẹ̀rẹ̀bẹ̀tẹ̀.
meaning: One should match one’s actions to one’s circumstances.

proverbs: Àbọ̀ ejò kì í gbé isà.
meaning: One should act according to one’s circumstances.

proverbs: Abùlàǹgà kì í ṣasán: bíyàá ò lọ́rọ̀, baba a lówó lọ́wọ́.
meaning: There is, or should be, some basis for one’s strutting.

proverbs: Abùléra ọ̀fọ́n-ọ̀n: ó ní ọjọ́ tí ológbò-ó ti bí òun ò ìtí-ì dá a ní báríkà.
meaning: Never forget your vulnerabilities and limitations.

proverbs: Àbúrò kì í pa ẹ̀gbọ́n nítàn.
meaning: One should not exceed one’s station.

proverbs: Àbúrò rẹ ń dáṣọ fún ọ, o ní o ò lo elékuru; ta ní ń lo alákàrà?
meaning: One should act in accordance to one’s station in life.

proverbs: A-dá-má-lè-ṣe àdàbà tí ń dún bẹ̀m̀bẹ̀.
meaning: Bombast often masks fickleness.

proverbs: Adẹ́tẹ̀ ní òun ò lè fún wàrà, ṣùgbọ́n òun lè yí i dànù.
meaning: Even feckless people can cause some damage.

proverbs: Adẹ́tẹ̀- rí wèrè, ó kán lùgbẹ́ .
meaning: A person who should be ostracized ostracizes others.

proverbs: Adẹ́tẹ̀ sọ̀rọ̀ méjì, ó fìkan purọ́; ó ní nígbà tí òun lu ọmọ òun lábàrá, òun já a léèékánná pàtì.
meaning: One fools only oneself when one claims to have done the impossible.

proverbs: Adìẹ funfun ò mọ ara ẹ̀ lágbà.
meaning: One should act one’s age always.

proverbs: Adìẹ ò bí yọyọ kú yọ̀.
meaning: Children should not be the death of their parents.

proverbs: Adìẹ tó ṣu tí kò tọ̀, ara-a rẹ̀ ló kù sí.
meaning: Self-deprivation hurts the person concerned, not anyone else.

proverbs: Adígbọ́nránkú ń fikú ṣeré.
meaning: If one persists in flirting with disaster, disaster is likely to befall one.

proverbs: A-dìtan-mọ́ èsúó; ó ní èkùlù ló bí ìyá òun.
meaning: Never make preposterous claims of kinship.

proverbs: Adití ò gbọ́, ‘‘Yàgò!’’
meaning: Cautionary words are lost on reckless people.

proverbs: À-fà-tiiri ni tìyàwó; bí a bá fà á tí kò tiiri, ó ní ohun tó ń ṣe é.
meaning: However eager the bride, she must appear coy and shy; one should behave with decorum appropriate to one’s position.

proverbs: Àfi ohun tí a kì í tà lọ́jà lẹrú kì í jẹ.
meaning: A slave has no choice.

proverbs: Afínjú ní ń jẹ iwọ; ọ̀mọ̀ràn ní ń jẹ obì; màrí-màjẹ ní ń jẹ awùsá.
meaning: People are what they eat; each to his or her own taste.

proverbs: Afínjú wọ ọjà ó rìn gbẹnd kẹ; ọ̀bún wọ ọjà ó rìn ṣùọ̀ṣùọ̀; ọ̀bùn ní ó ru ẹrù afínjú relé.
meaning: Good breeding confers great advantages.

proverbs: Afínjúu Ààre; ó fi àkísà dí orùbà; ó ń wá ẹniire-é bá sú epo.
meaning: Never compromise on cleanliness and good character.

proverbs: Afínjú-u póńpólà, ogé kun osùn láìwẹ̀.
meaning: Cleanliness should be more than a matter of appearance.

proverbs: Àfòpiná tó f paná-a súyà; ẹrán pọ̀ sí i.
meaning: A person who foolishly attempts dangerous tasks courts destruction. This is a variant of the following entry.

proverbs: Àfòpiná tó ní òun ó pa fìtílà, ara ẹ ni yó pa.
meaning: It is unwise to take on an adversary one knows can destroy one.

proverbs: Afọ́jú tó dijú, tó ní òun sùn, ìgbàtí kò sùn ta ló rí?
meaning: The deceiver deceives himself or herself.

proverbs: A-fọ́nú-fọra ní ń fi òṣì jó bàtá.
meaning: Know your place and live according to your circumstances.

proverbs: Àgó tó gbó ṣáṣá, ẹ̀bìtí pa á; aḿbọ̀sì olóósè a-bara-kùọ̀kùọ̀.
meaning: If the green wood is consumed, the dry wood has no prayer.

proverbs: Àgùnbánirọ̀ ní ń fojúdini.
meaning: Even in a company, each person should know his or her relative station.

proverbs: Àgbà ajá kì í bàwọ̀j́ .
meaning: Decorum goes with age.

proverbs: Àgbà ìmàle kì í káṣọ kọ́rùn.
meaning: One should behave as is proper for one’s position.

proverbs: Àgbà kán ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀ lÓgùn; Yemaja ló gbé e lọ.
meaning: Thoughtless emulation of others could be disastrous.

proverbs: Àgbà kì í fàárọ̀ họ ìdí kó má kan funfun.
meaning: Improper behavior brings disgrace.

proverbs: Àgbà kì í ṣerée kí-ló-bá-yìí-wá?
meaning: An Elders should show decorum.

proverbs: Àgbà kì í ṣorò bí èwe.
meaning: The elder’s performance should be commensurate with his station and status.

proverbs: Àgbà kì í wà lọ́jà kórí ọmọ titun wọ́.
meaning: Elders must not permit untoward happenings in their presence.

proverbs: Àgbá òfìfo ní ń pariwo; àpò tó kún fówó kì í dún.
meaning: Persons of little worth make the most noise.

proverbs: Àgbà tí kò lẹ́sẹ̀ nílẹ̀ a lọ́gbọ́n nínú.
meaning: One should know one’s limitations and how to compensate for them.

proverbs: Àgbà tí kò mọ ìwọ̀n ara-a rẹ̀ lodò ń gbé lọ́.
meaning: Elders who cannot swim will be cautious near rivers.

proverbs: Àgbà tí kò nítìjú, ojú kan ni ìbá ní; ojú kan náà a wà lọ́gangan iwájú-u rẹ̀.
meaning: Shamelessness does not become an elder.

proverbs: Àgbà tí yó tẹ̀ẹ́ , bó fárí tán, a ní ó ku járá ẹnu.
meaning: One should know how far one may go before one suffers disgrace.

proverbs: Àgbà tó bú ọmọdé fi èébú-u rẹ̀ tọrọ.
meaning: Only those who show respect for others may expect respect in return. Compare the preceding and following entries.

proverbs: Àgbà tó fi ara-a rẹ̀ féwe lèwe ń bú.
meaning: If one wants to be respected, one should respect oneself.

proverbs: Àgbà tó mọ ìtìjú kì í folè ṣeré.
meaning: Anything that smacks of stealing will disgrace an elder.

proverbs: Àgbà tó torí ogójì wọ ìyẹ̀wù: igbawó ò tó ohun à-mú-ṣèyẹ.
meaning: One must act as one’s station demands.

proverbs: Àgbààgbà ìlú ò lè péjọ kí wọn ó jẹ ìfun òkété, àfi iyán àná.
meaning: People should behave in ways that befit their station.

proverbs: À-gbàbọ̀-ọ ṣòkòtò, bí kò fúnni lẹ́sẹ̀ a ṣoni; rẹ́múrẹ́mú ni ohun ẹni ń bani mu.
meaning: Borrowed articles are never like one’s own.

proverbs: Àgbà-ìyà tí ń mùkọ ọ̀níní: ó ní nítorí omi gbígbóná orí-i rẹ̀ ni.
meaning: One should act according to the demands of one’s status.

proverbs: Àgbàlagbà akàn tó kó sí garawa; yègèdè, ojú tì í.
meaning: One should avoid potentially disgraceful actions.

proverbs: Àgbàlagbà kì í ṣe lágbalàgba. An elder should not behave in an unbecoming manner.
meaning: One should behave according to one’s status.

proverbs: Àgbàlagbà kì í wẹwọ́ tán kó ní òun ó jẹ si.
meaning: An elder should know his mind.

proverbs: Àgbàlagbà kì í yọ ayọ̀-ọ kí-ló-báyìí-wá?
meaning: Moderation and decorum in everything.

proverbs: Àgbàlagbà tí ò kí Ààrẹ ń fi okùn sin ara-a rẹ̀.
meaning: One must avoid actions that will place one at grave risk.

proverbs: Àgbàlagbà tó ń gun ọ̀pẹ, bó bá já lulẹ̀ ó dọ̀run.
meaning: An elder should know better than to climb palm trees; one should not court danger.

proverbs: Àgbàlagbà tó wẹ̀wù àṣejù, ẹ̀tẹ́ ni yó fi rí.
meaning: Immoderation brings disgrace.

proverbs: Àgbàrá ba ọ̀nà j , ó rò pé òun tún ọ̀nà ṣe.
meaning: Ignorance or incompetence in tackling a task often leads to unintended results.

proverbs: Agbára wo ló wà lọ́wọ́ igbá tó fẹ́ẹ́ fi gbọ́n omi òkun?
meaning: People should not overreach.

proverbs: Àgbéré àwòdì ní ń ní òun ó jẹ ìgbín.
meaning: Know your limits.

proverbs: Àgbéré laáyán gbé tó ní òun ó jòó láàárín adìẹ.
meaning: The chickens will eagerly peck it to death.

proverbs: Àgbéré lẹyẹ ń gbé; kò lè mu omi inú àgbọn.
meaning: One should know one’s limits.

proverbs: Àgbéré-e ṣìgìdì tó ní ká gbé òun sójò: bí apá ti ń ya nitan ń ya; kidiri orí ò lè dá dúró.
meaning: One should know one’s limitations.

proverbs: Ahọ́n ni ìpínnlẹ̀ ẹnu.
meaning: There is a limit to everything.

proverbs: Àì-jọnilójú lọ́sàn-án ní ń múni jarunpá luni lóru.
meaning: Familiarity breeds contempt.

proverbs: Àì-kúkú-joyè, ó sàn ju, ‘‘Ẹnu mi ò ká ìlú’’ lọ.
meaning: A person who does not assume a responsibility is better off than a person who takes it on and fails to fulfill it.

proverbs: Àì-lápá làdá ò mú; bí a bá lápá, ọmọ owú tó-ó gégi.
meaning: One should not blame one’s deficiencies on one’s tools.

proverbs: Àì-lè-jà ni à ń sọ pé, ‘‘Ojúde baba-à mi ò dé ìhín.’’
meaning: A coward will find any excuse to avoid a just fight.

proverbs: Àì-mọ̀-kan, àì-mọ̀-kàn ní mú èkúté-ilé pe ológbò níjà.
meaning: Never taunt an adversary you cannot handle.

proverbs: Àìsí èèyàn lóko là ń bá ajá sọ̀rọ̀.
meaning: But for unfortunate circumstances, one would not deign to associate with certain people.

proverbs: Àìsí-ńlé ẹkùn, ajá ń gbó.
meaning: When the master is away, the minion will strut.

proverbs: Àìsí-ńlé ológbò, ilé dilé èkúté.
meaning: People will take advantage of any relaxation of supervision. See the previous entry.

proverbs: Àìso àbà ló m yẹ wá jẹ̀gbá; ẹyẹ kì í jẹ̀gbá.
meaning: But for unavoidable misfortune, one would not have been reduced to the demeaning circumstance in which one finds oneself.

proverbs: Ajá kì í gbó níbojì ẹkùn.
meaning: One must defer to one’s superiors.

proverbs: Ajá kì í rorò kó ṣọ́ ojúlé méjì.
meaning: One cannot serve two masters simultaneously.

proverbs: Ajá mọ ìgbẹ́ ; ẹlẹ́dẹ̀ mọ àfọ̀; tòlótòló mọ ẹni tí yó yìnbọn ìdí sí.
meaning: People should know who are their peers and who are not.

proverbs: Ajá ò gbọdọ̀ dé mọ́ṣáláṣí ìkókò ṣàlùwàlá.
meaning: One should not exceed one’s station.

proverbs: Ajá rí epo kò lá; ìyá-a rẹ̀ẹ́ ṣu ihá bí?
meaning: One should not be unreasonably squeamish.

proverbs: Ajá tó ń lépa ẹkùn, ìyọnu ló ń wá.
meaning: One should not overreach oneself.

proverbs: Ajá tún padà sí èébì-i rẹ̀.
meaning: To accept what one has once rejected is to lose face.

proverbs: Àjàjà ṣoge àparò, abàyà kelú.
meaning: The nouveau riche always goes to extremes in consumption.

proverbs: Àjànàkú ò tu lójú alájá; o-nígba-ajá ò gbọdọ̀ tọ́pa erin. T
meaning: Even two hundred dogs are no match for an elephant.

proverbs: Ìjàpá ní kò sí ohun tó dà bí ohun tí a mọ̀ọ́ṣe; ó ní bí òun bá ju ẹyìn sẹ́nu, òun a tu èkùrọ́ sílẹ̀.
meaning: Nothing succeeds like expertise.

proverbs: Ìjàpá ní òun tí ìbá só ló sùn yí, bẹ́ẹ̀ni ẹní bá sùn kì í só.
meaning: Some defenses are so transparent as to be frivolous.

proverbs: Ìjàpá ń lọ sájò, wọ́n ní ìgbà wo ni yó dèé, ó ní ó dìgbàtí òún bá tẹ́ .
meaning: Certain people will not change course until they are disgraced.

proverbs: Àjátì àwọ̀n ní ń kọ́ òrofó lọ́gbọ́n.
meaning: Careless, imprudent persons have their nemesis waiting for them.

proverbs: À-jẹ-ì-kúrò ní ń pa ẹmọ́n; à-jẹ-ì-kúrò ní ń pa àfè; à-jẹ-ì-kúrò ní ń pa máláàjú.
meaning: Lack of moderation leads to death.

proverbs: À-jẹ-pọ̀ ni tàdán.
meaning: This observation on a being with no self restraint could also be a wish that a person not benefit from something he or she has appropriated.

proverbs: À-jẹ-tán, à-jẹ-ì-mọra, ká fi ọwọ́ mẹ́wẹ̀ẹ̀wá jẹun ò yẹ ọmọ èèyàn.
meaning: People should not be slaves to food.

proverbs: À-jókòó-àì-dìde, à-sọ̀rọ̀-àì-gbèsì, ká sinni títí ká má padà sílé: àì-sunwọ̀n ní ń gbẹ̀hìn-in rẹ̀.
meaning: Excess and self-forgetfulness in anything bring unpleasant results.

proverbs: Àkàtàm̀pò ò tó ìjà-á jà; ta ní tó mú igi wá kò ó lójú?
meaning: A stick is no match for a bow.

proverbs: Àkíìjẹ́ mú òrìṣà níyì.
meaning: Distancing oneself from ordinary people lends one prestige.

proverbs: Àkísà-á mọ ìwọ̀n ara-a rẹ̀, ó gbé párá jẹ́ .
meaning: A person of low standing should not call attention to himself or herself.

proverbs: Àkókó inú igbó ní àwọ́n lè gbẹ́ odó; ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ lódòó ní àwọ́n lè lọ́ ìlẹ̀kẹ̀; awúrebé ní àwọ́n lè hun aṣọ.
meaning: Misplaced self-confidence leads the creatures into empty boasts

proverbs: Akórira ò ní nǹkan; ọ̀dùn ò sunwọ̀n fún ṣòkòtò.
meaning: Excessive squeamishness renders one helpless and destitute.

proverbs: Akú, n kò ní omitooro-o rẹ̀ ẹ́ lá; àìkú, nkò níí pè é rán níṣẹ́ .
meaning: One need pay no mind to a person who can in no way affect one’s fortune

proverbs: Àkùkọ adìẹ fi dídájí ṣàgbà; ó fi ṣíṣu-sílẹ̀ ṣèwe.
meaning: Nobody is free of some blemish.

proverbs: Aláàńtètè: ó jí ní kùtùkùtù ó ní òun ó dàá yànpọ̀n-yànpọ̀n sílẹ̀.
meaning: The puny person’s boasts are always empty.

proverbs: Aládàá ló làṣẹ àro.
meaning: One yields authority to one’s host, or the owner of the property.

proverbs: Aláìnítìjú lọ kú sílé àna-a rẹ̀.
meaning: One should never demean oneself with unbecoming actions.

proverbs: Alákòró kì í sá fógun.
meaning: A warrior does not run from battle.

proverbs: Aláǹgbá kì í lérí àti pa ejò.
meaning: People should not propose what they cannot accomplish.

proverbs: Aláṣejù ajá ní ń lépa ẹkùn.
meaning: One should not challenge people one cannot match.

proverbs: Aláṣejù, baba ojo.
meaning: Immoderation is a cloak for cowardice.

proverbs: Aláṣejù ní ń gbẹ́bọ kọjá ìdí èṣù; a-gbé-sàráà-kọjá-a-mọ́ṣáláṣí.
meaning: It is a grievous fault not to observe discreet limits.

proverbs: Aláṣejù, pẹ̀rẹ̀ ní ń tẹ́; àṣéjù, baba àṣetẹ́ .
meaning: Immoderation brings disgrace.

proverbs: Aláṣejù tí ń pọkọ ní baba.
meaning: The wife who calls her husband ‘‘father’’ carries respect beyond reasonable limits; one should not be overzealous observing proprieties.

proverbs: Aláṣọ àlà kì í jókòó sísọ̀ elépo.
meaning: One should not expose oneself to abuse or danger.

proverbs: Aláṣọ-kan kì í ná ànárẹ.
meaning: A person with meager resources should husband them judiciously.

proverbs: Aláṣọ-kan kì í ṣeré òjò.
meaning: A person with meager resources should husband them judiciously.

proverbs: Alátiṣe ní mọ àtiṣe ara-a rẹ̀.
meaning: One should not second-guess others or try to make their decisions for them.

proverbs: Àlejò kì í lọ kó mú onílé dání.
meaning: Each person must confront his or her destiny alone.

proverbs: Àlejò kì í pìtàn ìlú fónílé.
meaning: Never presume to know more than the custodian of knowledge.

proverbs: Àlémú ò yẹ àgbà; àgbà kì í ṣe ohun àlémú.
meaning: Elders should always behave in ways that would cause them no disgrace.

proverbs: A-lu-dùndún kì í dárin.
meaning: A subordinate does not set policy.

proverbs: Àmọ̀tẹ́kùn-ún fara jọ ẹkùn, kò lè ṣe bí ẹkùn.
meaning: Looking a part does not indicate an ability to play the part.

proverbs: Amùrín ò sunwọ̀n, ó yí sáró.
meaning: A person who has enough flaws should not seek ways to add to them.

proverbs: Ànán-mánàán ẹtú jìnfìn; oní-mónìí ẹtú jìnfìn; ẹran mìíràn ò sí nígbó l hìn ẹtu?
meaning: If the same person repeatedly finds himself or herself in difficulties others are able to avoid, one should look to the person’s character for the explanation.

proverbs: Apá èkúté-ilé ò ká awùsá; kìkìi yíyíkiri ló mọ.
meaning: Some people are beyond any schemes by their enemies.

proverbs: Àpárá ń lá, ìjà ní ń dà.
meaning: Jokes should have limits.

proverbs: Àpárá ń lá ni iná ń dá; iná ò lè rí omi gbéṣe.
meaning: Certain people are beyond the reach of their adversaries.

proverbs: Àpárá ń lá nikán ń dá; ikán ò lè mu òkúta.
meaning: Certain people do not know their place

proverbs: Àpọ́nlé ni ‘‘Fọ́maànù’’; ẹnìkan ò lè ṣe èèyàn mẹ́rin.
meaning: People whose positions earn them respect should not forget themselves, or people would forget their positions.

proverbs: Àpọ́nlé ni ‘‘Iyá-a Káà’’; ìyá kan ò sí ní káà tí kò lórúkọ.
meaning: People in a position of respect should not forget that respect can be withdrawn.

proverbs: Ará okó ní òun gbọ́ fínrín fínrín; ta ló sọ fun bí kò ṣe ará ile?
meaning: People should not presume to instruct those who know better than they.

proverbs: Ara-àìbalẹ̀, olórí àrùn.
meaning: No disease is greater than hyperactivity.

proverbs: Àrífín ilé ò j ká jẹ òròmọ adìẹ.
meaning: A person who would retain esteem among his or her peers must not act beneath himself or herself.

proverbs: À-rí-ì-gbọdọ̀-wí: baálé ilé ṣu sápẹ.
meaning: When an illustrious person does the unmentionable, no one dares speak.

proverbs: Àrí-ì-gbọdọ̀-wí, baálé ilé yọkun lémú.
meaning: When a venerable person acts like a fool, few dare tell him so.

proverbs: Arọ̀lẹ̀kẹ̀ ò rọ bàtà; gbẹ́dó-gbẹ́dó ò rọ ojúgun.
meaning: People should stick to what they are qualified to do.

proverbs: Àṣá kì í rà kádìẹ gbé kòkòrò dání.
meaning: When a great danger threatens, one does not wait for small favors.

proverbs: A-ṣe-bọ̀rọ̀kìnní-má-kìíyè-sábíyá, gbogbo abíyá dọ́ṣẹ.
meaning: Attention to detail is integral to good character or breeding.

proverbs: Àṣejù baba àṣetẹ́ ; ẹ̀tẹ́ ní ń gbẹ̀hìn àṣejù; àgbàlagbà tó wẹ̀wù àṣejù ẹ̀tẹ́ ni yó fi rí.
meaning: Immoderation leads to disgrace.

proverbs: À-sẹ́ -kú làgbàlagbà ń sẹ́ ọ̀ràn.
meaning: One must never admit to doing something unworthy of one’s position.

proverbs: Àṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀yọ màrìwò, ó ní òun ó kan ọ̀run; àwọn aṣáájúu rẹ̀-ẹ́ ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀ rí?
meaning: Ambition should be tempered with realism.

proverbs: Aṣiwèrè èèyàn ní ń sọ pé irú òun ò sí; irú rẹ̀ pọ̀ ó ju ẹgbàágbèje lọ.
meaning: There is no one the likes of whom the world has never seen.

proverbs: Aṣọ à-fọ̀-fún ò jẹ́ ká mọ olówó.
meaning: A poor person who looks to his or her appearance appears rich

proverbs: Aṣọ tó kuni kù ní ń jẹ́ gọgọwú.
meaning: One makes the most of what one has.

proverbs: A-ṣúra-mú ò tẹ́ bọ̀rọ̀.
meaning: People take one as one presents oneself.

proverbs: À-tẹ́ -ẹ̀-ká ni iyì ọlọ́lá; sálúbàtà ni iyì ọlọ̀tọ̀; bá a bá gbéra lágbèéjù ọba ni wọ́n ń fini íṣe.
meaning: People take one as one presents oneself.

proverbs: À-wín-ná-wó ò yẹni; à-gbà-bọ̀-ọ ṣòkòtò ò yẹ ọmọ èèyàn; bí kò fúnni lẹ́sẹ̀ a dòrògí; ohun ẹni ní ń yẹni.
meaning: One should not live beyond one’s means.

proverbs: Àwòrò tí a ò bá lù kì í luni.
meaning: A person who wants to be respected must respect others

proverbs: A-wọ̀lú-má-tẹ̀ẹ́ , ìwọ̀n ara-a rẹ̀ ló mọ̀.
meaning: Self-knowledge guarantees one’s reputation.

proverbs: Àwúrèbeé ní òun lè yẹ̀nà; ta ní jẹ́ tọ ọ̀nà àwúrèbe?
meaning: One should not offer one’s services where one’s abilities are inadequate.

proverbs: Ayọ̀ àyọ̀jù làkèré fi ń ṣẹ́ nítan.
meaning: Immoderate happiness breeds unhappiness.

proverbs: Àyọ̀-yó ni bàtá à-jó-fẹ-ehín.
meaning: Happiness should know moderation.

proverbs: Babaaláwo kì í bèrè ẹbọ àná.
meaning: One should not demean oneself by demanding piddling favors.

proverbs: Bẹbẹlúbẹ ò ì tíì débẹ̀, ibẹ̀ ló ń bọ̀.
meaning: There is no keeping a nosy person out of others’ affairs.

proverbs: Bí a bá dàgbà à yé ogun-ún jà.
meaning: An elder should leave off things that are a mark of youth.

proverbs: Bí a bá fi inú wénú, iwọ là ń jẹ.
meaning: Comparing fortunes with others is likely to leave a bitter taste in one’s mouth.

proverbs: Bí a bá ń bá ọmọdé jẹun lóko, gànmù-ganmu imú ẹni ní ń wò.
meaning: Too much familiarity with youth breeds contempt.

proverbs: Bí a bá ń gúnyán, kòmẹsẹ̀ á yọ.
meaning: The well-bred visitor should make an exit when the hosts turn to intimate affairs.

proverbs: Bí a bá ti lè ṣe là ń wí; a kì í yan àna ẹni lódì.
meaning: One should not let an inability to fulfill a formal obligation prevent one from fulfilling essential obligations.

proverbs: Bí a bá ti mọ là ń dé; a láì lẹ́ṣin kì í dé wọ̀nwọ̀n.
meaning: One should act according to one’s worth.

proverbs: Bí a bá ti mọ là ń kú; olongo kì í kú tìyàntìyàn.
meaning: One acts according to one’s worth.

proverbs: Bí a bá tọ̀ sílé, onípò a mọ ipò.
meaning: In the event of a crime, the guilty should not attempt to shift the blame to other.

proverbs: Bí a bá wí pé ó dọwọ́-ọ babaláwo, babaláwo a ló dọwọ́ Ifá; bí a bá ní ó dọwọ́ àgbà ìṣègùn, àgbà ìṣègùn a ló dọwọ́ Ọ̀sanyìn; bí a bá ní ó dọwọ́ ààfáà tó gbójú, a ní ó dọwọ́ Ọlọ́run ọ̀gá ògo.
meaning: All achievements are creditable to the powers that make them possible, not to the agents.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá dáṣọ lé aṣọ, a kì í pe ọ̀kan lákìísà.
meaning: One may not disdain an old tool until one is able to replace it.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá lè dá Tápà, Tápà kì í dáni.
meaning: If one fails, one should at least avoid disgrace.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá lọ sóko irọ́, a kì í pa á mọ́ni.
meaning: If one does not lay oneself open to lies, one is not lied about.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá ṣèké, a kì í fi ẹ̀tẹ́ kú.
meaning: One’s honesty is one’s vindication.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá tí ì jókòó, a kì í nasẹ̀.
meaning: Until one has thoroughly secured one’s position, relaxation is premature.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá tí ì lè kọ́lé àgọ́ là ń pa.
meaning: One should neither overreach oneself nor refrain from striving.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá tó baba ọmọọ́ ṣe, a kì í pe alákàrà.
meaning: If one has no means of offering hospitality, one should not invite visitors.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá tó ìyà-á ká tí à ń kọ̀ ọ́, àjẹkún ìyà là ń jẹ.
meaning: Whoever cannot defend himself or herself must learn forbearance.

proverbs: Bí a ó ti tó kì í jẹ́ ká hùwà búburú; bí a ó ti mọ kì í jẹ́ ká hùwà rere.
meaning: A person’s achievements are enhanced or limited by the person’s character.

proverbs: Bí àgbà kò bá ṣe ohun ẹ̀rù, ọmọdé kì í sá.
meaning: Youth responds to age according to how age acts.

proverbs: Bí ajá rójú ẹkùn, a pa rọ́rọ́.
meaning: In the presence of one’s betters, one keeps one’s place.

proverbs: Bí àjànàkú ò bá rí ohun gbémì, kì í ṣe inú gbẹndu sọ́dẹ.
meaning: Unless a person has some resource to rely on, he or she does not tempt fate.

proverbs: Bí ayá bá mojú ọkọ, alárìnnà a yẹsẹ̀.
meaning: Once one’s task is done, one removes oneself.

proverbs: Bí ayé bá ń yẹni, ìwà ìbàj là ń hù.
meaning: Prosperity breeds temptations to misbehave.

proverbs: Bí baálẹ̀-ẹ́ bá ń tàkìtì, òrógi là ń bá ẹmẹsẹ̀.
meaning: The great may indulge themselves, but the lowly must keep their heads.

proverbs: Bí eegbọ́n bá so mọ́ ajá lẹ́nu, akátá là ń ní kó já a?
meaning: A person of great substance is not asked to minister to a person of no substance.

proverbs: Bí eegbọ́n bá so ayínrín nímú, adìẹ kọ́ ni yó ja.
meaning: The prey is not sent to minister to a predator.

proverbs: Bí èèyán bá ní kò sí irú òun, àwọn ọlọgbọ́n a máa wòye.
meaning: A person who thinks he or she is peerless fools no one but himself or herself.

proverbs: Bí ẹkùn ò bá fẹ̀, èse là ń pè é.
meaning: A person who acts beneath his station loses some respect.

proverbs: Bí ẹlẹ́bọ ò bá pe ẹni, àṣefín ò yẹni.
meaning: It is bad form to intrude into other people’s affairs.

proverbs: Bí ìlàrí bá fẹ́ẹ̀ tẹ́, a ní kí lọba ó ṣe?
meaning: If one does not show respect for one’s patron, one courts disgrace.

proverbs: Bí iná bá dun ọbẹ̀, a dá ọ̀rọ̀ sọ.
meaning: If the excitement is strong enough, coyness disappears.

proverbs: Bí kò sí àkópọ̀, kí lewúrẹ́ wá dé ìsọ̀ adìẹ?
meaning: Necessity brings together people who would otherwise have nothing to do one with another

proverbs: Bí kò sí tọ̀bùn èèyàn, ta ni ìbá jí lówùúrọ̀ tí kò bọ́jú ṣáṣá?
meaning: Antisocial people betray themselves by their habits.

proverbs: Bí mo bá torí oko kú n ó rò fáhéré; bí mo bá torí ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ kú n ó rò fódò; bí mo bá torí alábàjà òkìkí kú, ng ó rò fórí-ì mi.
meaning: Were I to die for a woman, the forces ordering my fortune would know why.

proverbs: Bí ó di ọdún m ta tí ẹkùn-ún ti ń ṣe òjòjò, olugbe la ó ha rán lọ bẹ̀ wò? I
meaning: Even though one may be down on one’s luck, there are yet certain propositions one would consider insulting.

proverbs: Bí òfé ti ń fò la ti ń mọ̀ ọ́ lákọ ẹyẹ.
meaning: One shows one’s quality through one’s accomplishments.

proverbs: Bí ojú bá rí, ẹnu a dákẹ́ .
meaning: The mouth does not reveal everything the eyes see.

proverbs: Bí ojú kò bá rí, ẹnu kì í sọ nǹkan.
meaning: The mouth can tell only what the eye sees.

proverbs: Bí ojú kò bá ti olè, a ti ará ilé ẹ̀.
meaning: A person’s disgrace must concern his relatives.

proverbs: Bí ojú onílé bá mọ tíntín, tí ojú àlejòó tó gbòǹgbò, onílé ní ń ṣe ọkọ àlejò.
meaning: The host is lord over the guest.

proverbs: Bí òkú fẹ̀, bí kò fẹ̀, ká bi ọmọ olókùú léèrè.
meaning: Only those most intimately concerned know the close truths of an affair and should be asked about them.

proverbs: Bí olóde ò kú, òdee rẹ̀ kì í hu gbẹ́gi.
meaning: If one does not die, one is able to look after one’s affairs.

proverbs: Bí olóúnjẹ bá rojú à fi àìjẹ tẹ́ ẹ.
meaning: The best way to treat a miser is to refuse anything from him.

proverbs: Bí ọdún bá dún, bọnnọnbọ́nnọ́n a pàwọ́ dà.
meaning: When the seasons change, one changes one’s habits.

proverbs: Bí ọjàá bá tú tán, a ku olórí-i pàtẹpàtẹ, a ku àgbààgbà sà-ǹkò sà-ǹkò lọ́jà; bÍfá bá pẹ̀dí tán, ìwọ̀-ǹwọ̀ a dìde.
meaning: When a matter is done, those involved should disperse.

proverbs: Bí ọjọ́ ewúrẹ́ bá pé, a ní kò sí ohun tí alápatàá lè fi òun ṣe.
meaning: A person who does not recognize and heed danger courts death.

proverbs: Bí ọ̀lẹ́ ò lè jà, a lè kú tùẹ̀.
meaning: A person who cannot defend his rights should yield to death.

proverbs: Bí Ọlọ́run ò ṣe ẹni ní baba,àfiìyànjú ṣe bí àgbà.
meaning: Even if one has no influence, one strives to act responsibly.

proverbs: Bí ọmọdé bá fẹ́ ṣìṣe àgbà, ọjọ́ orí rẹ̀ ò níí jẹ́ .
meaning: A youth does not have what it takes to be an elder.

proverbs: Bí ọmọdé bá gun òkè àgbà, ó ń láti gbọ́n.
meaning: Wisdom goes with age.

proverbs: Bí ọmọdé bá ń ṣe ọmọdé, àgbà a máa ṣe àgbà.
meaning: One should not permit other people’s misbehavior to deflect one from the proper course.

proverbs: Bí ọmọdé ń lérí bébé, tí kò ní baba, ti baba là ń ṣe.
meaning: One should not deal too harshly with a child who has no one to direct him or her.

proverbs: Bí Ọya ń kọ lọ́run, bí Ṣàngó ń jó láyé, kò níí burú fún baba kó ní ó dọwọ́ ọmọ òun lọ́run.
meaning: Even in suffering, one should never disgrace oneself.

proverbs: Dídák lerín dákẹ́ ; àjànàkú ló lọ̀dàn.
meaning: The mighty need not proclaim their importance.

proverbs: Dìgbòlugi-dìgbòlùùyàn ò jẹ́ ká mọ ajá tòótọ́.
meaning: He who acts like a dog makes himself the equal of a dog.

proverbs: Eegun àjànàkú: ó há ìkokò lẹ́nu.
meaning: A person has overreached himself or herself and is paying the price of folly.

proverbs: Eégún ju eégún; òrìṣá ju òrìṣà; Pààká lé oníṣàngó wọ̀gb .
meaning: Every company has its hierarchy; each person should know his or her place.

proverbs: Eégún ò na obìnrin lágọ̀; obìnrín tú kíjìpá ìdí-i rẹ̀, ó fi na eégún.
meaning: A person is fortunate to have been overlooked by trouble, but he or she goes to deliberately provoke it.

proverbs: Eégún p lóde, ó fètè òkè dáhùn; wọ́n ní, ‘‘Baba kú àbọ̀,’’ ó ní, ‘‘Hì ì ì.’’
meaning: A person who has disgraced himself speaks softly.

proverbs: Eégún wọlé, ó ní òun ò rí Ejonto; Ejontó ní, ‘‘Àkísà ni, àbí kíní wọlé?’’
meaning: A person who disregards one earns one’s disregard.

proverbs: Eegbọ́n so mọ́ àyìnrín lẹ́nu, a ní kí adìẹ wá yán an jẹ; adìẹ mọ̀ pé òun náà oúnjẹ àyìnrín.
meaning: One wastes one’s time inviting others to endanger themselves.

proverbs: Èèyàn bí ọ̀bọ lọ̀bọ ń ya láṣọ.
meaning: Those who consort with undesirables are likely to have their reputation soiled.

proverbs: Èèyàn ò ríbi sùn, ajá ń hanrun.
meaning: A lowly person lays claim to what his or her betters lack.

proverbs: Èèyàn tí ò nítìjú ojú kan ni ìbá ní, a gbórín a tó tẹṣin.
meaning: Human endowments are wasted on graceless people.

proverbs: Ejò kì í ti ojú Ààrẹ gun ọgbà lọ.
meaning: One does not permit disaster on one’s watch; one must live up to the expectations of one’s position

proverbs: Èmí dákọ okòó, ìwọ́ dákọ okòó, ò ń pèmí ní mùkọ-mùkọ.
meaning: One should not criticize others for flaws that are also one’s lot.

proverbs: Èmi ìwọ̀fà, ìwọ ìwọ̀fà, o ní babá ní ká gbowó wá; o dá tìrẹ sílẹ̀ ná?
meaning: Whoever will correct others should first take care of his or her own failings.

proverbs: Epo ni mo rù; oníyangí má ba tèmi jẹ́ .
meaning: I am cautiously going about my own business; let no one bring trouble my way.

proverbs: Erin kì í fọn kọ́mọ-ọ rẹ̀ ó fọn.
meaning: Lowly people should not emulate illustrious ones.

proverbs: Èrò ọ̀nà ni yó ròhìn ọkà tó gbó.
meaning: A noteworthy accomplishment need not advertise itself.

proverbs: Èsúrú ṣe fújà ó t lọ́wọ́ oníyán; aláǹgbá ṣe fújà ó tẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ògiri; Ọlámọnrín àjàpá ṣe fújà ó tẹ́ lọ́wọ́-ọ mi.
meaning: A person who does not know his or her place soon suffers disgrace.

proverbs: Etí lobìnrín fi ń gbọ́ ohùn orò.
meaning: One must not intrude into affairs that do not concern one; undesirable people should be kept in the dark about important or delicate matters.

proverbs: Èwo ló tó ẹ̀kọ-ọ gbà nínú ewé ìrúgbàá?
meaning: Certain feats are beyond certain people; people should not presume to do things beyond their capabilities.

proverbs: Èwo ni ti Síkírá nílùú Ìwó.
meaning: One should not intrude into matters that do not concern one.

proverbs: Ewújù tí yóò tú ọ̀pẹ: gbogbo ehín ẹ̀ ni yóò kán tán.
meaning: One should not attempt a task for which one is not qualified.

proverbs: Ewúrẹ́ kì í bíni ká lọ sísọ̀ àgùntàn lọ jẹ̀.
meaning: One should keep to one’s proper company.

proverbs: Ewúrẹ́ ò wí pé òun ò ṣọmọ àgùntàn; àgùntàn ló wí pé òun ò ṣọmọ ewúrẹ́ .
meaning: The goat would like to associate with the sheep, but the sheep would not associate with the goat; ‘‘superior’’ people reject association with ‘‘inferior’’ people, not the other way around.

proverbs: "Ẹ fà á wọlé" ló yẹ ẹlẹ́ṣin.
meaning: To be able to afford a horse but not a groom is something of a disgrace

proverbs: Ẹ j ká mí, ẹ j ká simi; èèyàn ní ń fìdí èèyàn jókòó; èèyàn ìbá ṣe bí Ọlọ́run kò níí jẹ́ ká mí.
meaning: People are wont to be too full of their authority; it is a good thing they have less power over others than God does

proverbs: ‘‘Ẹ kú-ulé’’ ò yẹ ará ilé; ‘‘Ẹ kú atìbà’’ ò yẹni tí ń tàjò bọ̀; ẹni tí ò kí ẹni, ‘‘Kú atìbà’’-á pàdánù ‘‘Ẹ kú-ulé.’’
meaning: Whoever does not extend courtesies cannot expect to receive courtesies.

proverbs: Ẹ̀bìtì ẹnu ò tàsé.
meaning: The mouth easily accomplishes even impossible feats.

proverbs: Ẹgbẹ́ ẹni là ń gúnyán ewùrà dè.
meaning: One may take liberties only with one’s peers.

proverbs: Ẹ̀gbẹ̀rì ò mọ̀ pé arẹwà kì í gbé ẹ̀kú; gbogbo ehín kin-kìn-kin láb aṣọ.
meaning: It is a foolish person who conceals his or her endowments.

proverbs: Ẹ̀gbọ́n ṣíwájú ó so aṣọ kọ́; àbúrò-ó kẹ́hìn ó wẹ̀wù; bí a ò mọ̀lẹ, ọ̀lẹ ò mọ ara-a rẹ̀?
meaning: The shiftless person cannot hide his shiftlessness either from himself or from others.

proverbs: Ẹlẹ́dẹ̀ ń pàfọ̀ ó rò pé òun ń ṣoge.
meaning: People who lack good judgment are never aware of their own misbehavior.

proverbs: Ẹlẹ́dẹ̀ ò mẹ̀yẹ.
meaning: Some people do not know fitting behavior.

proverbs: Ẹlẹ́ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́ ń lọ ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́ , o ní ‘‘Ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀ta ni àbí ẹ̀ẹ́dẹ́gbẹ̀fà̀?’’; èwo lo gbé níbẹ̀?
meaning: A person who is too inquisitive about other people’s affairs raises suspicions about his or her motives.

proverbs: Ẹlẹ́ẹ́fà kì í lọ ẹẹ́fà-a rẹ̀ ká sọ pé o di ìjẹfà tí a ti jẹun.
meaning: If one can offer no help to a person in trouble, one should not complicate the person’s plight.

proverbs: Ẹni à bá fi sóko kó dàparò, ó ní òun ẹni ilé.
meaning: An unwanted person believes himself to be indispensable.

proverbs: Ẹni à bá tà ká fowó-o rẹ̀ ra àdá: ó ní ìyà àdá ń jẹ òun.
meaning: A person who is only most grudgingly tolerated in a company complains about his lack of privileges.

proverbs: Ẹni à bá tà ká fowó-o rẹ̀ ra àtùpà: ó ní òun à-jí-tanná-wò-lóru.
meaning: A person most unwanted in a company regards himself or herself as the soul of the party.

proverbs: Ẹni à bá tà ká fowó-o rẹ̀ ra èbù: ó ní èlé òun kó ọ̀ọ́dúnrún.
meaning: A person considered worthless and expendable makes claims to equal rights.

proverbs: Ẹni à ń gbé gẹ̀gẹ̀ ni yó ba ara-a rẹ̀ jẹ́ .
meaning: People who are placed on pedestals have ample opportunities to topple themselves.

proverbs: Ẹní bá dẹ ojú-u rẹ̀ sílẹ̀ á rímú-u rẹ̀.
meaning: Whoever comports himself or herself indecorously will be disgraced.

proverbs: Ẹní dádé ti kúrò lọ́mọdé.
meaning: A high office carries high responsibilities with it.

proverbs: Ẹni tí a bá ń dáṣọ fún kì í ka èèwọ̀.
meaning: Those who depend on the charity of others must be satisfied with whatever they can get.

proverbs: Ẹni tí a fẹ́ yàtọ̀ sí ẹni tó ní kò sí irú òun.
meaning: One’s worth is more a matter of what other people think than what one thinks of oneself.

proverbs: Ẹni tí a gbé gun ẹlẹ́dẹ̀, ìwọ̀n ni kó yọ̀ mọ; ẹni tó gẹṣin, ilẹ̀ ló ń bọ̀.
meaning: One should not let good fortune go to one’s head; circumstances do change.

proverbs: Ẹni tí a lè gbé kì í dawọ́.
meaning: There is no point in resisting the irresistible.

proverbs: Ẹni tí à ń wò láwò-sunkún ń wo ara-a rẹ̀ láwò-rẹ́rìnín.
meaning: The miserable person has no notion of his own miserableness.

proverbs: Ẹni tí a ò fẹ́, àlọ́ ò kàn án.
meaning: A person not wanted in a group should not press his or her rights.

proverbs: Ẹni tí a ò fẹ́ nílùú kì í jó lójú agbo.
meaning: A person not wanted in a group should keep a low profile.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ìbá hùwà ipá ò hùwà ipá; ẹni tí ìbá hùwà ẹ̀lẹ̀ ò hu ẹ̀lẹ̀; ọ̀kùn tó nígba ọwọ́, tó nígba ẹsẹ̀ ń hùwà pẹ̀lẹ́ .
meaning: Even though one has a great deal of weight, one should still tread lightly.

proverbs: Ẹni tí kò lè gbé eèrà, tí ń kùsà sí erin, títẹ́ ní ń tẹ́ .
meaning: One should know one’s capabilities and limit oneself to what one can accomplish.

proverbs: Ẹni tí kò rí ayé rí ní ń sọ pé kò s ni tó gbọ́n bí òun.
meaning: No wise person claims he or she is the best.

proverbs: Ẹni tí kò tó gèlètè kì í mí fìn-ìn.
meaning: One should match one’s strutting to one’s accomplishment.

proverbs: Ẹni tó tan ara-a rẹ̀ lòrìṣà òkè ń tàn: àpọń tí ò láya nílé, tó ní kí òrìṣà ó bùn un lọ́mọ.
meaning: It is self-deceit to expect the gods to do everything for one who has not lifted a finger on his or her own behalf.

proverbs: Ẹni tó tijú tì í fún ara-a rẹ̀.
meaning: Good character benefits the owner more than others.

proverbs: Ẹnìkan kì í jẹ́ ‘‘Àwá dé.’’
meaning: However mighty, a person is still only one person.

proverbs: Ẹran kí la ò jẹ rí? Ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ báni lábàtà ó ba búrúbúrú.
meaning: A person for whom one has no use wastes his or her time if he or she goes to great lengths to hide from one.

proverbs: Èrúkó ń ṣe bí ọkọ́.
meaning: A certain person is putting on airs to which he or she is not entitled.

proverbs: Ẹ̀ṣọ́ kì í gba ọfà lẹ́hìn; iwájú gangan ní ń fi-í gba ọgbẹ́.
meaning: One must act in a manner that befits one’s station.

proverbs: Ẹ̀wọ̀n tó tó ọ̀pẹ ò tó-ó dá erin dúró; ìtàkùn tó ní kí erin má ròkè ọ̀dàn, tòun terin ní ń lọ.
meaning: Whoever attempts to stop an irresistible force will be swept along by it.

proverbs: Ẹ̀yá ló bí mi, ẹkùn ló wò mí dàgbà, ológìnní gbà mí tọ́; bí kò s ran lọ́bẹ̀ n kò jẹ.
meaning: I will not act in a way inconsistent with my upbringing.

proverbs: Ẹyẹ akòko-ó ní òun le gbẹ́ odó; ta ní jẹ́ fi odó akòko gúnyán jẹ?
meaning: The puny person’s best efforts cannot amount to much.

proverbs: Ẹyẹ ò lè rí omi inú àgbọn bù mu.
meaning: One should not attempt the impossible.

proverbs: Ẹyẹ tó fi ara wé igún, ẹ̀hìn àdìrò ní ń sùn.
meaning: People who have everything to lose should not emulate those who have nothing to lose.

proverbs: Fáàárí ọ̀bọ ò ju inú ìgbẹ́ lọ.
meaning: One may be esteemed in one’s own locality and be quite unknown in another.

proverbs: Fálànà gbọ́ tìrẹ, tara ẹni là ń gbọ́.
meaning: People should keep their noses out of other people’s business.

proverbs: Gànràn-gànràn ò yẹ ẹni a bí ire.
meaning: One should behave in a manner that reflects well on one’s family.

proverbs: ‘‘Gbà jẹ’’ ò yẹ àgbà.
meaning: It better becomes an elder to give than to go begging.

proverbs: ‘‘Gbà mí, gbà mí!’’ ò yẹ àgbà; àgbà kì í ṣe ohun àlémú.
meaning: One should behave in a manner that befits one’s station.

proverbs: ‘‘Gbà mí, gbà mí!’’ ò yẹ eégún; ‘‘ẹran ń lémi bọ̀’’ ò yẹ ọdẹ.
meaning: ‘‘An animal is chasing me!’’ does not befit a hunter.

proverbs: ‘‘Gba wèrè,n kò gba wèrè’’ lọjà-á fi ń hó.
meaning: One may have no means of avoiding insult from others, but it is always in one’s power to reject insults.

proverbs: Gbogbo èèyàn ní ń sunkún-un Bánjọ; ṣùgbọ́n Bánjọ ò sunkún ara rẹ̀.
meaning: Some people remain blissfully unaware of their own misfortune, even though the misfortune is obvious to others.

proverbs: Gbogbo ẹgb ń jẹ Máyẹ̀lóyè, ò ń jẹ Sáré-pẹgbẹ́ .
meaning: The addressee is backsliding among his or her peers but believes he or she is doing rather well.

proverbs: Gbogbo ọ̀rọ̀ ní ń ṣojú èké.
meaning: There is nothing the busybody will admit he or she does not know about.

proverbs: Gbọ̀n-ọ́n-gbọ̀n-ọ́n kan ò sí, àfi ẹni tó bá ń ti ara rẹ̀.
meaning: Some people make more trouble for themselves than others can ever make for them.

proverbs: Ìbàjẹ́ ọjọ́ kan ò tán bọ̀rọ̀.
meaning: Reputations are easy to destroy but most difficult to repair.

proverbs: Ibi tí a bá pè lórí, a kì í fi tẹlẹ̀.
meaning: Never misuse or abuse your prized possessions or attributes.

proverbs: Ibi tí a fi ara sí lara ń gbé.
meaning: One should confine oneself and one’s activities to the appropriate spheres.

proverbs: Ibi tí a fi iyọ̀ sí ló ń ṣomi sí.
meaning: One should confine one’s activities to the proper arena.

proverbs: Ibi tí a pè lórí ní ń hurun.
meaning: One should act in accordance to one’s station.

proverbs: Ibi tí a ti mú ọ̀lẹ ò kúnná; ibi tí a ti mú alágbáraá tó oko-ó ro.
meaning: A worthy person, even if eventually vanquished, will leave signs of powerful resistance behind.

proverbs: Ibi tí a ti ń pìtàn ká tó jogún, ká mọ̀ pé ogún ibẹ̀ ò kanni.
meaning: One need not go to great lengths to establish one’s claim if it is legitimate.

proverbs: Ibi tí ayé bá ẹni ni a ti ń jẹ ẹ́.
meaning: One lives according to the conditions one finds oneself in.

proverbs: Ìbọ́n dídá olówó ló ní kíwọ̀fà rín rín rín kó sọ àdá nù.
meaning: If the person in charge behaves irresponsibly, then those over whom that person has charge have an excuse for irresponsible behavior also.

proverbs: Idà ahun la fi ń pa ahun.
meaning: Each person carries his or her own bane.

proverbs: Idà ń wó ilé ara rẹ̀ ó ní òun ń ba àkọ̀ jẹ́ .
meaning: Said of a person whose actions will eventually recoil on him or her, even though the person thinks that he or she is hurting others.

proverbs: Ìdí méjèèjìí tó olúwa-a rẹ̀-ẹ́ jókòó.
meaning: One should be satisfied with one’s own resources.

proverbs: Igúnnugún bà lé òrùlé; ojú tó ilé ó tó oko.
meaning: Said of a busybody whose eyes get into everything.

proverbs: Ìgbà tí ṣìgìdìí bá fẹ́ ṣe eré ẹ̀tẹ́ a ní kí wọ́n gbé òun sójò.
meaning: A person who so forgets himself or herself as to overreach will wind up in disgrace.

proverbs: Ìgbà wo ni Mákùú ò níí kú? Mákùú ò mọ awo ó bú ọpa; Mákùú ò mọ ìwẹ̀ ó  ń bọ́ sódò.
meaning: A person who will not cooperate in safeguarding himself or herself frustrates the efforts of others.

proverbs: Ihò wo lèkúté ń gbé tó ní iṣ ilé ń díwọ́?
meaning: One should not oversell oneself

proverbs: Ìjàkùmọ̀ kì í rin ọ̀sán; ẹni a bí ire kì í rin òru.
meaning: People who care about their reputation should stay away from questionable actions.

proverbs: Ìjàlọ ò lè gbé òkúta.
meaning: One should not attempt a task that is beyond one’s capability.

proverbs: Ìjokòó ẹni ní ń múni da ewé ẹ̀kọ nù.
meaning: People treat one the way one presents oneself.

proverbs: Ìjọba ń pè ọ́ o ní ò ń mu gààrí lọ́wọ́; ta ní ni ọ́, ta ní ni omi tí o fi ń mu gààrí?
meaning: When the law summons, one has no option but to heed the summons.

proverbs: Ilé kì í jó kí baálé ilé tàkakà.
meaning: One must not ignore matters of grave concern to oneself.

proverbs: Ilé kì í jó kí oorun kun ojú.
meaning: One must not ignore grave matters.

proverbs: Ilé ni mo wà kì í jẹ̀bi ẹjọ́.
meaning: One does not get into trouble by minding one’s own business.

proverbs: Ìlù kan ò tó Ègùn jó; bí a bá lù fún un a máa lu àyà.
meaning: Said of a person who is never satisfied with whatever others do for him/her but must always make some adjustment.

proverbs: Iná ń jó ògiri ò sá, ó wá ń gbá gẹẹrẹ gẹẹrẹ sómi.
meaning: A person who is powerless against others should not make threatening moves.

proverbs: Inú burúkú làgbà ń ní, àgbà kì í ní ojú burúkú.
meaning: One should not permit the way one really feels to push one into unseemly behavior.

proverbs: Ipa ọgbẹ́ ní ń sàn; ipa ohùn kì í sàn.
meaning: Injury inflicted through speech is impossible to heal.

proverbs: Ìpàkọ́ onípàkọ́ là ń rí; eniẹlẹ́ni ní ń rí tẹni.
meaning: One usually pays closer attention to other people’s faults than to one’s own, of which others are quite aware.

proverbs: Ìpéǹpéjú ò ní enini; àgbàlagbà irùngbọ̀n ò ṣe òlòó.
meaning: Some habits are fitting for one’s station; others are not.

proverbs: Ìrẹ́jẹ ò sí nínúu fọ́tò; bí o bá ṣe jókòó ni o ó bàá ara-à rẹ.
meaning: One’s public perception depends ultimately on one’s self-presentation.

proverbs: Irú aṣọ ò tán nínu àṣà.
meaning: No one has a monopoly on certain qualities.

proverbs: Irú erin ò tán ní Àlọ́.
meaning: Nobody is one of a kind.

proverbs: Ìrùkẹ̀rẹ̀ kì í yan Ifá lódì; oge, dúró o kí mi.
meaning: One should not neglect to say hello to other people.

proverbs: Ìsáǹsá ò yọ ẹ̀gún; ìsáǹsá kì í káwo ọbẹ̀.
meaning: A person who has committed a crime does not wait around to be caught.

proverbs: Ìṣẹ́ ò ti ibìkan mú ẹni; ìyà ò tibìkan jẹ èèyàn; bí o bá rìnrìn òṣì, bí o bá ojú ìṣẹ́ wọ̀lú, igbá-kígbá ni wọn ó fi bu omi fún ẹ mu.
meaning: People treat one the way one presents oneself.

proverbs: Ìtàkùn tó tó ọ̀pẹ kò tó pé kérin má lọ; ìtàkùn tó pé kérin má lọ Àlọ́, tòun terin ní ń lọ.
meaning: A powerless person will not stop a mighty person from doing what he wants; one who attempts it invites suffering for himself.

proverbs: Ìwà ní ń jọ oníwà lójú.
meaning: One naturally approves of one’s own character.

proverbs: Ìwọ̀fà ní ń mú ìwọ̀fà jó.
meaning: People should know who share their station and confine their dealings to them.

proverbs: Ìwọ̀n eku nìwọ̀ ìtẹ́ ; olongo kì í gbé tìmù-tìmù.
meaning: One should cut one’s garment according to one’s size.

proverbs: Ìwọ̀sí ní ń ba ilé àgbà jẹ́ .
meaning: An elder who fails to maintain harmony among the members of his household will see it destroyed.

proverbs: Ìyàwó tó na ọmọ ọbàkan, ọ̀rọ̀ ló fẹ́ gbọ́.
meaning: One should not engage in inappropriate actions.

proverbs: Jẹ́jẹ́ leégún àgbà ń jó.
meaning: Grown-up people should behave in a decorous manner.

proverbs: Jòkùmọ̀-ọ́ ṣe bí ẹ̀lú, aró la bẹ̀ lọ́wẹ̀.
meaning: One should know and employ the appropriate materials for one’s tasks.

proverbs: Ká ríni lóde ò dàbí-i ká báni délé.
meaning: To really know a person, one must see the person where he or she lives.

proverbs: Ká ríni sọ̀rọ̀ fúnni ò dàbí-i ká sọ̀rọ̀ fúnni ká gbà.
meaning: Nobody can help anyone who will not help himself or herself.

proverbs: Ká wí fún ẹni ká gbọ́; ká sọ̀rọ̀ fúnni ká gbà; ká bèrè ọnà lọ́wọ́ èrò tó kù lẹ́hìn káyé baà lè yẹni.
meaning: It is wise to heed advice, and it is wise to seek direction from those who have greater experience.

proverbs: Ká wí fúnni ká gbọ́; ká sọ̀rọ̀ fúnni ká gbà; à-wí-ìgbọ́, à-gbọ́-ìgbà ní ń fi igbá àdánù bu omi mu.
meaning: Refusal to heed advice leads to deprivation.

proverbs: Ká wí ká gbà ló yẹ ọmọ èèyàn.
meaning: One should heed advice.

proverbs: Ká wí ogún, ká wí ọgbọ̀n, n ò fẹ́ , n ò gbà’’ laṣiwèré fi ń pẹ̀kun ọ̀ràn.
meaning: The incorrigible person will never listen to reason.

proverbs: Kàkà ká dọ̀bálẹ́ fún Gàm̀bàrí, ká rọ́jú ká kú.
meaning: An expression of Yoruba superciliousness toward the Hausa

proverbs: Kàkà kí àgbò ké, àgbò a kú.
meaning: A grown man must know how to hide his pain.

proverbs: Kàkà kí bàbá ran ọmọ ní àdá bọ oko, oníkálukú a gbé tiẹ̀.
meaning: People may withhold their respect from one, but one should not abet their insolence.

proverbs: Kàkà kí iga akàn ó padà sẹhìn, a kán.
meaning: Death is to be preferred to retreat.

proverbs: Kàkà kí kìnìún ṣe akápò ẹkùn, ọlọ́dẹ a mú ọdẹ ẹ̀ ṣe.
meaning: One would rather leave a company than remain in it and be subordinate to those one considers inferior.

proverbs: Kékeré lọ̀pọ̀lọ́ fi ga ju ilẹ̀ lọ.
meaning: Said of people who behave as though they are superior to others though have little reason to believe so.

proverbs: Kí ẹrú mọ ara ẹ̀ lẹ́rú; kí ìwọ̀fà mọ ara ẹ̀ níwọ̀fà; kí ọmọlúwàbí mọ ara ẹ̀ lẹ́rú Ọlọ́run ọba.
meaning: Everybody should know himself or herself and his or her station in the scheme of things.

proverbs: Kì í dọwọ́-ọ baba kó ló di ọwọ́ ọmọ.
meaning: An elder must do his or her duty and not shove it on the youth.

proverbs: Kí ni àǹfàníi kẹ̀tẹ̀kẹ̀tẹ̀ lára kẹ́tẹ́kẹ́tẹ́ à-gùn-fẹsẹ̀-wọ́lẹ̀?
meaning: It is pointless to make too much of a virtually worthless thing.

proverbs: Kí ni apárí ń wá ní ìsọ̀ onígbàjámọ̀?
meaning: One should stay out of places where one has no business.

proverbs: Kí ni Dáàró ní kó tó sọ pé olè-é kó òun?
meaning: Said of a person who could do nothing in the best of circumstances but blames his or her lack of success on certain eventualities.

proverbs: Kí ni eléwé-e-gbégbé ń tà tí ó ń sọ pé ọjà ò tà?
meaning: Said of people who have fundamental problems but complain only of the symptoms.

proverbs: Kí ni ìbá mú igún dé ọ̀dọ̀-ọ onídìrí?
meaning: One should stay away from places where one has no business.

proverbs: Kí ni ó yá àpọ́n lórí tó fiṣu síná tó ń súfèé pé ‘‘bí a ti ń ṣe ni inú ń bí wọn’’?
meaning: Said of people who are arrogant even though they have no basis for pride.

proverbs: Kí ni onígbá ń ṣe tí aláwo ò lè ṣe?
meaning: Whatever one can accomplish, those better placed or better endowed can accomplish also.

proverbs: Kí ni orí ń ṣe tí èjìká ò lè ṣe? Èjìká ru ẹrù ó gba ọ̀ọ́dúnrún; orí ta tiẹ̀ ní ogúnlúgba.
meaning: One should not be foolish enough to think that the person who has more power and standing than oneself cannot accomplish what one has accomplished.

proverbs: Kí ni wọ́n ti ń ṣe Àmọ́dù nÍlọrin? Ewúrẹ́ ń jẹ́ bẹ́è.
meaning: Said to express the overabundance of some commodity being discussed.

proverbs: Kíjìpá laṣọ ọ̀lẹ; òfì laṣọ àgbà; àgbà tí ò ní tòfì a rójú ra kíjìpá.
meaning: If one cannot have the perfect thing, one should strive to have at least something.

proverbs: Kò rà, kò lówó lọ́wọ́, ó ń wú tutu níwájú onítumpulu.
meaning: Said of people reluctant to accept the fact that they cannot have what they wish.

proverbs: Kò sí ẹni tó dùn mọ́ àfi orí ẹni.
meaning: Few people genuinely wish that one should succeed.

proverbs: Kò sí mi lájọ àjọ ò kún: ara ẹ̀ ló tàn jẹ.
meaning: Whoever thinks he or she is indispensable is self-deceived.

proverbs: Kò sí ohun tí Ṣàngó lè ṣe kó jà lẹ́ẹ̀rùn.
meaning: One cannot transcend one’s nature.

proverbs: Kò-sí-nílé kì í jagun ẹnu tì.
meaning: Said of a person who vows that had he been around when something happened, he would have performed wonders.

proverbs: Kó-tán-kó-tán lajá ń lá omi.
meaning: Said of people who attack good things with excessive greed.

proverbs: Labalábá fi ara ẹ̀ wẹ́yẹ, kò lè ṣe ìṣe ẹyẹ.
meaning: Attempts to emulate those better endowed and qualified than oneself always prove futile.

proverbs: Lábúlábú fara wé aró, kò lè ṣe bí aró; pòpòǹdó fara wé àgbàdo.
meaning: One should know better than to attempt to overreach one’s capabilities.

proverbs: Lágbájá ìbá wà a di ìjímèrè; ẹni tó bá níwájú di oloyo?
meaning: One should not make excessive claims when there is no basis for them.

proverbs: Láká-ǹláká ò ṣéé fi làjà; ọmọ eégún ò ṣéé gbé ṣeré.
meaning: One should know one’s limits and also what one would be ill advised to attempt.

proverbs: Lásán kọ́ là ń dé ẹtù; ó ní ẹni tórí ẹ̀ ń bá ẹtù mu.
meaning: Not every person is made for greatness.

proverbs: Lékèélékèé ò yé ẹyin dúdú; funfun ni wọ́n ń yé ẹyin wọn.
meaning: Ony certain types of behavior are suitable for people in certain positions.

proverbs: Má tẹ̀é lọ́wọ́ oníle, má tẹ̀ẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àlejò; lọ́wọ́ ara ẹni la ti ń tẹ́ .
meaning: A person too careful about his or her reputation will end up losing regard for himself or herself. Some situations call for doing away with decorum.

proverbs: Màlúù ò lè lérí níwájú ẹṣin.
meaning: One should acknowledge and defer to those better able than oneself.

proverbs: Mànàmáná ò ṣéé sun iṣu.
meaning: Many instances of boasting lack the substance to back them.

proverbs: ‘‘M̀bá wà lỌ́yọ̀ọ́ mà ti so ẹṣin’’; àgùntàn-an rẹ̀ á níye nílẹ̀yí.
meaning: What a person has accomplished in his or her present circumstances is a good indication of what the person has the potential to do in more favorable circumstances.

proverbs: Mélòó lÈjìgbò tí ọ̀kan ẹ̀ ń jẹ́ Ayé-gbogbo?
meaning: One should be modest in one’s claims.

proverbs: Mo dàgbà mo dàgó, aré ọmọdé ò tán lójúù mi.
meaning: There is something of the youth that lingers even in age.

proverbs: Mo dàgbà tán èwé wù mí.
meaning: One does not appreciate one’s youth until one has lost it.

proverbs: ‘‘Mo dára, mo dára,’’ àìdára ní ń pẹ̀kun ẹ̀.
meaning: Whoever is infatuated with his or her attractiveness will end up being despised by all.

proverbs: ‘‘Mo gbọ́n tán, mo mọ̀ràn tán’’ kì í jẹ́ kí agbọ́n lóró bí oyin.
meaning: Whoever will not listen to instruction will learn nothing.

proverbs: ‘‘Mo mỌ̀bàrà mo mỌ̀fún’’ ti kì í j kí àwòko kọ́ ọ̀pẹ́ẹ̀rẹ́ nÍfá.
meaning: Disdain for advice or instruction leaves a person in ignorance.

proverbs: ‘‘Mo mọ̀-ọ́ gùn’’ lẹṣin ń dà.
meaning: Assuming that one knows it all causes one grief.

proverbs: ‘‘Mo mọ̀-ọ́ gún, mo mọ̀-ọ́ tẹ̀’’ niyán ewùrà-á fi ń lẹ́mọ.
meaning: Knowing it all can be disastrous.

proverbs: ‘‘Mo mọ̀-ọ́ tán’’ lOrò-ó fi ń gbé ọkùnrin.
meaning: Knowing it all leads to disaster.

proverbs: ‘‘Mo mọ̀wọ̀n ara-à mi’’ kì í ṣẹ̀rẹ̀kẹ́ èébú.
meaning: A person who wishes to maintain his or her dignity must not by his or her actions invite insults.

proverbs: ‘‘Mo yó’’ ń jẹ́ ‘‘mo yó,’’ ‘‘mo kọ̀’’ ń jẹ́ ‘‘mo kọ̀’’; jẹun  ǹ ṣó, àgbà ọ̀kánjúwà ni. ‘
meaning: One should not accept every invitation to the table.

proverbs: N ó gba owó-ò mi lára ṣòkòtò yìí’’; ìdí làgbàlagbà ń ṣí sílẹ̀.
meaning: One should not insist on squeezing every last ounce of use out of a perishable article.

proverbs: Níbo lo forúkọ sí tí ò ń jẹ́ Làm̀bòròkí?
meaning: Where did you leave good manners and pick up unbecoming and unacceptable behavior?

proverbs: Nígbà tí à ń to ọkà a ò to ti ẹmọ́ si.
meaning: People should keep their hands off other people’s property unless they have been asked to help themselves.

proverbs: Nígbà tí o mọ̀-ọ́ gùn, ẹṣin ẹ- ṣe ṣ orókún?
meaning: An expert does not produce flawed goods.

proverbs: Nígbà wo làpò ẹkùn-ún di ìkálá fọ́mọdé?
meaning: People should not presume to lay claim to things or functions that are far beyond their station.

proverbs: Ńláńlá lọmọ abuké ń dá: ó ní ‘‘Ìyá, ìyá, òun ó pọ̀n.
meaning: A dependent who demands of one what one cannot provide is intent on showing one up.

proverbs: Ó bọ́ lọ́wọ́ iyọ̀ ó dòbu.
meaning: A person who has been written off loses all regard.

proverbs: Ó bọ́ lọ́wọ́ oṣù ó dàràn-mọ́jú.
meaning: A person who overstays his or her welcome ceases to be valued.

proverbs: O dájú dánu, o ò mọ ẹ̀sán mẹ́sàn-án.
meaning: Too much mouth often indicates too little substance.

proverbs: Ó di àwùjọ ṣòkòtò kí ládugbó tó mọ ara rẹ̀ Lábèṣè.
meaning: Some people will not learn the truth about themselves until they are openly disgraced.

proverbs: Ó di ọjọ́ alẹ́ kábuké tó mọ̀ pé iké kì í ṣọmọ.
meaning: People seldom learn wisdom until it is too late.

proverbs: O kò mọ ẹ̀wà lóńjẹ à-jẹ-sùn.
meaning: Addressed to a person who is not mindful of the repercussions of his or her behavior.

proverbs: Ò ń jàgbọ̀nrín èṣín lọ́bẹ̀, o ní o ti tó tán.
meaning: A hard-up person who claims to be prosperous deceives himself or herself.

proverbs: O ru ládugbó ò ń rera; kí ni ká sọ f ni tó ru Òrìṣà-a Yemọja?
meaning: Never assume to be more important than you are, especially when there are really more important people around.

proverbs: Ó tọ́ kí eégún léni lóko àgbàdo, èwo ni ti Pákọ̀kọ̀ láàrin ìlú?
meaning: A person who is in no position to exercise authority over another should not presume to do so.

proverbs: Ó yẹ ẹni gbogbo kó dínwó aró, kò yẹ atọ̀ọ́lé.
meaning: The person in desperate need of a thing cannot afford to be finicky.

proverbs: Ó yẹ ẹni gbogbo kó sọ pé iṣu ò jiná, kò yẹ alubàtá.
meaning: People should not be too quick to complain about conditions they helped to engineer.

proverbs: Ó yẹ ẹni gbogbo kó sọ pé ‘‘Ọlọ́run aṣèkan-má-kù,’’ kò yẹ akúkó.
meaning: People should not act as though they are unaware of their flaws.

proverbs: Odò kékeré lalákàn-án ti lè fọ́ epo; bó bá di àgàdàm̀gbá tán, odò a gbé alákàn lọ.
meaning: When times are easy, there is little one cannot attempt.

proverbs: Òfin ni yó sọ ara ẹ̀; ìyàwó tí ńna ọmọ ìyálé.
meaning: Whoever transgresses should expect more or less automatic repercussions.

proverbs: Ogun tí olójúméjìí rí sá ni olójúkan-án ní òún ń lọ jà.
meaning: A comment on overreaching people who attempt feats that have defeated their betters.

proverbs: Ohun méjì ló yẹ Ẹ̀ṣọ́: Ẹ̀ṣọ́ jà, ó lé ogun; Ẹ̀ṣọ́ jà ó kú sógun.
meaning: One should not act in a way that is not proper or becoming.

proverbs: Ohun tí à ń tà là ń jẹ; kì í ṣe ọ̀rọ̀ oníkẹrosíìnì.
meaning: One should be mindful of the peculiarities of one’s situation.

proverbs: Ohun tí eèrá bá lè gbé ní ń pè ní ìgànnìkó.
meaning: One should match one’s desires to what one can afford.

proverbs: Ohun tí ìrẹ̀-ẹ́ ṣe tó fi kán lápá, aláàńtèté ní kí wọ́n jẹ́ kí òun ó ṣe è.
meaning: Some fools never learn from others’ mistakes.

proverbs: Ohun tí kò tó okòó kì í jẹ àgbà níyà.
meaning: One should not be defeated by insignificant problems.

proverbs: Ohun tí wèré fi ń se ara ẹ̀, ó pọ̀ ju ohun tó fi ń ṣe ọmọ ẹlòmíràn lọ.
meaning: Said when a person intending to injure others in fact does himself or herself greater injury.

proverbs: Ohun tó ṣeé faga là ń faga sí; èwo ni, ‘‘Ìwòyí àná mo ti na ànaà mi fága-fàga’’?
meaning: One should not cheerfully and boastfully embrace disgrace.

proverbs: Ohun tó yẹni ló yẹni; okùn ọrùn ò yẹ adìẹ.
meaning: One should always confine one’s actions to those that are proper and becoming.

proverbs: Ojú àlejò la ti ń jẹ gbèsè; ẹ̀hìn-in ẹ̀ là ń san án.
meaning: One does not estimate how much hospitality is costing until one’s visitor has departed.

proverbs: Ojú baba ara: a-wọ́n-bí-ojú; a-ṣòró-dà-bí-àgbà.
meaning: What is most precious is most difficult to achieve.

proverbs: Ojú iná kọ́ lewùrà ń hurun.
meaning: One dares not strut when one’s bane is around.

proverbs: Ojú kì í pọ́n baálé ilé kó fọwọ́ gbálẹ̀ ilé ẹ̀.
meaning: However desperate one might be, there are certain things one must not stoop to do.

proverbs: Ojú kì í pọ́n babaláwo kó bèrè ẹbọ àná.
meaning: One should not permit hardship to lead one to demeaning behavior.

proverbs: Ojú kì í pọ́n ẹdun kó dẹni ilẹ̀; ìṣẹ́ kì í ṣẹ́ igún kó di ojúgbà adìẹ.
meaning: No matter what one’s misfortune, one should maintain one’s dignity.

proverbs: Ojú kì í pọ́n òkú ọ̀run kó ní kí ará ayé gba òun.
meaning: However bad one’s circumstances might be, one should use good sense in determining where to turn for help.

proverbs: Ojú kì í pọ́nni ká fàbúrò ẹni ṣaya.
meaning: Desperation should not preempt propriety.

proverbs: Ojú kì í pọnni ká fàkísà bora.
meaning: Despite adverse circumstances, one should strive to maintain one’s dignity.

proverbs: Ojú kì í pọ́nni ká pọ́n léhín.
meaning: Adverse circumstances should not keep one from attending to essential matters.

proverbs: Ojú ò rọ́lá rí: ó bímọ ẹ̀ ó sọ ọ́ ní Ọláníyọnu.
meaning: The nouveaux riches will always call attention to themselves with their ostentatious consumption.

proverbs: Ojú ò ti oníṣègùn, ó ní àna òun ń kú lọ.
meaning: If one cannot do what is expected, one should at least not broadcast one’s shame.

proverbs: Ojú ti agbọ́n; agbọ́n láfà kò léro.
meaning: There is a limit to how much one can emulate others.

proverbs: Òkété pẹ̀lú ọmọ rẹ̀ di ọgbọọgba sínú ihò; nígbà tí ìyá ń fehín pàkùrọ́, ọmọ náà ń fehín pa pẹ̀lú.
meaning: Too much familiarity makes comrades of people who are quite distant from each other in standing.

proverbs: Òkùnkùn ò mẹni ọ̀wọ̀; ó dÍfá fún ‘‘Ìwọ́ tá nìyẹn’’?
meaning: People who wander about in darkness cannot expect to be treated with deference.

proverbs: Olóbìnrin kan kì í pagbo ìja.
meaning: A person who does not have enough helping hands should not embark on ventures that are too ambitious.

proverbs: Olójúkan kì í tàkìtì òró.
meaning: One should limit one’s ambition to one’s capability.

proverbs: Olómele kì í sọ pé igi yó dàá lóde lọ́la.
meaning: If one has no say, one should avoid making projections or promises.

proverbs: Olówó jẹun jẹ́jẹ́ ; òtòṣì jẹun tìpà-tìjàn; òtòṣì tí ń bá ọlọ́rọ̀ rìn, akọ ojú ló ń yá.
meaning: One should keep to comrades whose station is similar to one’s own.

proverbs: Olówó ní ń bá ọlọ́rọ̀ rìn; ẹgbẹ́ ní ń bá ẹgbẹ́ ṣeré.
meaning: One should associate with one’s equals.

proverbs: Olówó ní ń jẹ iyán ẹgbàá.
meaning: One’s level of consumption reflects the depth of one’s pocket.

proverbs: Olóyè kékeré kì í ṣe fáàárí níwájú ọba.
meaning: One should know one’s station and act accordingly.

proverbs: Òní, ẹtú jìnfìn, ọ̀la, ẹtú jìnfìn; ẹtu nìkan lẹran tó wà nígbó?
meaning: If a person is the only one misfortune always visits, there is probably something the person is doing to invite it.

proverbs: Oníbàjẹ́ ò mọra; oníbàjẹ́ ń lọ sóko olè ó mú obìnrin lọ; ọkọ́ kó akọṣu, ìyàwó kó ewùrà.
meaning: A man who involves his family in his questionable ventures has sunk to the lowest depths.

proverbs: Oníbàtá kì í wọ mọ́ṣáláṣí kó ní ‘‘Lèmámù ń kọ́?’’
meaning: One should know just where one is welcome and how to behave there.

proverbs: Onífunra àlejò tí ń tètè ṣe onílé pẹ̀lẹ́ .
meaning: One should not assume other people’s functions

proverbs: Onígẹ̀gẹ́ fìlẹ̀kẹ̀ dọ́pọ̀; onílẹ̀kẹ̀ ìbá gbowó, kò rọ́rùn fìlẹ̀kẹ̀ so.
meaning: One can always find a ruse to get one out of embarrassing situations.

proverbs: Onílé ń jẹ èso gbìngbindò; àlejò-ó ní kí wọn ṣe òun lọ́wọ́ kan ẹ̀wà.
meaning: When one’s benefactor is experiencing hardship, one should be realistic in one’s requests of him.

proverbs: OníṢàngó tó jó tí kò gbọn yẹ̀rì: àbùkù-u Ṣàngó kọ́; àbùkù ara ẹ̀ ni.
meaning: A person who does not live up to his potential disgraces only himself.

proverbs: OníṢàngó tó jó tí kò tàpá, àbùkù ara rẹ̀.
meaning: A person who skimps on what is expected of him disgraces himself.

proverbs: On-íṣẹ̀ẹ́pẹ́ -igí bímọ ó sọ ọ́ ní Ayọ̀-ọ́- kúnlé; ayọ̀ wo ló wà lára ìṣẹ́pẹ́ igi?
meaning: One should not make too much of nothing.

proverbs: Oǹpè ní ń fa ọlá; òjípè kì í fa ọlá.
meaning: One should know one’s place, especially in the company of more illustrious people.

proverbs: Oòrùn, kó tìẹ wọ̀ ká má bàá Ọlọ́jọ́ wí.
meaning: Subordinates should not behave in a manner that would bring their superior to disrepute.

proverbs: Orí àgbà-á níyì, ó sàn ju orí àgbà-á fọ̀ lọ.
meaning: An elder who enjoys respect is better off than one who is insulted by others.

proverbs: Orí awọ là ń bágbà.
meaning: One should always live up to what others expect.

proverbs: Orí-i kí ní ń yá àpọ́n tó ń súfèé? Nítorí pé yó gùn-ún-yán fúnra ẹ̀ yó nìkan jẹ́?
meaning: A bachelor with no one to share his life and his meals has nothing to be cheerful about.

proverbs: Orogún ìyá ẹ- dáṣọ fún ọ o ní kò balẹ̀; mélòó nìyá ẹ-ẹ́ dá fún ọ tó fi kú?
meaning: People dependent on charity should be grateful rather than difficult to please.

proverbs: ‘‘Òru ò molówó’’ nIfá tí à ń dá fún ‘‘Ìwọ ta nìyẹn?’’
meaning: Nighttime wanderers should be prepared for indignities.

proverbs: Òtòlò-ó jẹ, òtòlò-ó mu, òtòlò-ó fẹsẹ̀ wé ẹsẹ̀ erin.
meaning: Satiation leads to excess.

proverbs: Oúnjẹ ọmọ kékeré a máa wọ àgbà nínú; òrùka ọmọ kékeré ni kì í wọ ágbá lọ́wọ́.
meaning: An elder may take advantage of the youth in certain respects, but in some others an elder must respect his status.

proverbs: Owó ẹ̀yẹ ò sú ẹni-í san; tọ̀ràn ni ò súnwọ̀n.
meaning: The troubles one goes into for honorable purposes are really a pleasure; not so the trouble to extricate oneself from problems.

proverbs: Ọbẹ̀ kì í gbé inú àgbà mì.
meaning: An elder should know how to keep confidences

proverbs: Ọ̀bún ríkú ọkọ tìrànmọ́; ó ní ọjọ́ tí ọkọ òún ti kú òun ò fi omi kan ara.
meaning: Shiftless people will latch on to any excuse to shirk duties.

proverbs: Ọ̀gà-ń-gà lọmọ-ò mi ń jẹ́ , ẹ má pe ọmọ-ọ̀ mi ní Ògò-ǹ-gò mọ́! Èwo lorúkọ rere níbẹ̀?
meaning: (A choice between two bad things is no choice at all

proverbs: Ọ̀gẹ̀gẹ́ ò lẹ́ wà; lásán ló fara wéṣu.
meaning: No imitation can be as good as the real thing.

proverbs: Ọjọ́ àgbà-á kú sàn ju ọjọ́ àgbà-á tẹ́ .
meaning: Death is preferable to disgrace.

proverbs: Ọjọ́ kan là ń bàjẹ́ , ọjọ́ gbogbo lara ń tini.
meaning: The thoughtless act of a moment mars one’s reputation for a long time.

proverbs: Ọjọ́ kan ṣoṣo là ń tẹ́ ; ojoojúmọ́ lojú ń tini.
meaning: Fleeting indiscretions have lasting effects.

proverbs: Ọjọ́ tí alákàn-án ti ńṣepo, kò kún orùbà.
meaning: Said of people who have labored long but have nothing to show for all their effort.

proverbs: ‘‘Ọjọ́ tí mo ti ń bọ̀ n kò rírú ẹ̀ rí’’: olúwa rẹ̀ mọ ìwọ̀n ara rẹ̀ ni.
meaning: If one knows one’s place, one will be spared humiliation.

proverbs: Ọ̀kánjúwà àgbà ní ń sọ ara rẹ̀ dèwe.
meaning: An elder who cannot control his appetite asks to be treated like a child.

proverbs: Ọ̀kánjúwà alágbaà ní ń garùn wo eégún.
meaning: It is unseemly to be too greedy, especially when everything is at one’s disposal anyway.

proverbs: Ọkùnrin kì í ké, akọ igi kì í ṣoje.
meaning: Fortitude is the mark of a man.

proverbs: Ọlọ́gbọ́n kan ò ta kókó omi sáṣọ; ọ̀mọ̀ràn kan ò mọ oye erùpẹ̀ ilẹ̀.
meaning: There are certain feats that are beyond even the most accomplished of men.

proverbs: Ọlọ́gbọ́n ò tẹ ara rẹ̀ nÍfá; ọ̀mọ̀ràn ò fi ara rẹ̀ joyè; abẹ tó mú ò lè gbẹ́ èkù ara rẹ̀.
meaning: The strongest and wisest of men still would need the service of other people at some time.

proverbs: Ọmọ àì-jọbẹ̀-rí tí ń ja epo sáyà.
meaning: Upstarts will betray themselves by their misuse of their new-found fortune.

proverbs: Ọmọ onílẹ̀ á tẹ̀ ẹ́ jẹ́jẹ́ .
meaning: Responsible people do not always do as they can, but behave as is proper.

proverbs: Ọmọ ọba nà Ìṣokùn ńfi ehín gé ejò, ọmọ ọba kan-án ní òun kì í jẹ ; ìlú wo lọmọ ọba náà-á ti wá?
meaning: If your betters are reduced to an expedient, you would be foolish to say it is beneath you.

proverbs: Ọmọdé dáwọ́tilẹ̀, ó ní òun tó ọ̀bọ; bó tó ọ̀bọ, ó tó gẹ̀gẹ̀ àyà-a rẹ̀?
meaning: Equality is more than mere physical resemblance.

proverbs: Ọmọdé ní ẹẹ́ta lọ́wọ́, ó ní kí Èṣù wá ká ṣeré owó; ẹ ta-á ha tó Èṣùú sú epo lá?
meaning: People who come into some money for the first time are wont to overestimate their sudden worth.

proverbs: Ọ̀mùtí gbàgbé ìṣẹ́ ; alákọrí gbàgbé ọ̀la.
meaning: Irresponsible people often indulge themselves instead of taking care of their pressing problems.

proverbs: Ọ̀nà ọ̀fun ò gba egungun ẹja.
meaning: Everybody and everything have some limitation

proverbs: Ọ̀ràn ò dun ọmọ ẹṣin; a mú ìyá rẹ̀ so, ó ń jẹ oko kiri.
meaning: Said of people who show no concern for the afflictions of those close to them.

proverbs: Ọ̀rọ̀ bọ̀tí-bọ̀tí ò yẹ àgbàlagbà.
meaning: Responsible adults should be very careful about what they say.

proverbs: Ọ̀rọ̀ ò dùn l nu ìyá olè.
meaning: There is little a miscreant can say that will impress people.

proverbs: Ọ̀rọ̀ wo ló wà l nu alaṣọ pípọ́n?
meaning: People with blemishes should keep a low profile.

proverbs: Ọ̀sán pọn o ò ṣán ẹ̀kọ; oòrún kan àtàrí o ò jẹ àmàlà; àlejò-ó wá bà ọ ní ìyẹ̀tàrí oòrùn o ò rí nǹkan fún un; o ní ‘‘Ǹjẹ́ n kò níí tẹ́ lọ́wọ́ rẹ̀ báyìí’’? O ò tíì tẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ara rẹ, ká tó ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ wá wípé o ó tẹ́ lọ́wọ́ ẹlòmíràn tàbí o ò níí tẹ́?
meaning: What one thinks of oneself is every bit as important as what others think of one.

proverbs: Ọ̀ṣìn ò lè mú àwòdì òkè; Bámidélé lọ̀ṣín lè mú.
meaning: Said of people who will confront only weaklings rather than people who match them in strength

proverbs: Ọ̀ṣọ́ ọlọ́ṣọ̀ọ́ ò yẹni; ṣòkòtò àgbàbọ̀ ò yẹ ọmọ èèyàn.
meaning: One should not be a habitual borrower.

proverbs: Ọwọ́ àìdilẹ̀ ní ń yọ koríko lójú àna rẹ̀.
meaning: People who are unemployed can expect to be asked to perform all sorts of belittling tasks.

proverbs: Ọ̀wọ́n là ń ra ògo, ọ̀pọ̀ là ń ra ọ̀bùn, iyekíye là ń ra ìmẹ́lẹ́ .
meaning: Nothing is more difficult to come by than honor.

proverbs: Ọ̀yájú-u baálé ní ń pàdé ìbòsí lọ́nà.
meaning: A patriarch who misbehaves earns disgrace.

proverbs: Pamí-n-kú obìnrín ṣorí bẹmbẹ sọ́kọ.
meaning: Obstinacy only invites harsh punishment.

proverbs: Pátápátá alágbẹ̀dẹ ò ju ilé àrọ lọ.
meaning: There is a limit to a person’s bragging.

proverbs: Pẹ̀lẹ́ larẹwà ń rìn; jẹ́jẹ́ lọmọ ọlọ́jà ń yan.
meaning: Gently and carefully are the best ways to take life.

proverbs: Pẹ̀lẹ́ -pẹ̀lẹ́ nijó àgbà; ara gbogbo ló di àkísà tán.
meaning: Elderly people should not overexert themselves.

proverbs: Pẹ̀tẹ̀pẹ́tẹ̀ Ìjèṣà, ó ta sẹ́ni lára kò wọ́n.
meaning: Disgrace is not easily washed away.

proverbs: San là ń rìn; ajé ní múni pá kọ̀rọ̀.
meaning: When one is in debt, one’s freedom of movement is compromised.

proverbs: Sesere ń dá gọ́ọ́bú; oníkamẹ́sàn-án ń gbé ṣíbí.
meaning: Said of a person overreaching.

proverbs: Sún mọ ọ̀hún, sún mọ́ ìhín! Bí a bá kan ògiri ilé-e baba ẹni, ṣe là ń dúró gbọin-gbọin.
meaning: There must be a limit to how much one will back down before enemies.

proverbs: Ṣàgbà-ṣàgbà ò níí sé àgbà títí láí.
meaning: If responsible people wish to be retain other people’s respect, they must always act like elders.

proverbs: Ṣágo ń búgò, ó ló ṣẹnu gbáṣọ́rọ́.
meaning: It is silly to pick a blemish one shares as the basis for insulting others; the pot should not call the kettle black.

proverbs: Ṣàkì ń ṣe bí ọ̀rá, egungun ń ṣe bí ẹran.
meaning: One should not pretend to be what one is not.

proverbs: Ṣáláporẹ́ ò mọ ẹgbẹ́ ẹ̀ nínú omi.
meaning: One should know who one’s peers are and not overstep one’s bounds.

proverbs: Ṣe bóo ti mọ, ẹlẹ́wà-a Ṣàpọ́n.
meaning: Do not overreach, and do not be too full of yourself.

proverbs: ‘‘Ta ní ń bẹ níbẹ̀?’’ làgbẹ́ fi ń sán ìbàǹtẹ́ wọ̀lú.
meaning: People who make a spectacle of themselves show no regard for others.

proverbs: Ta ní mọ Òkolo lỌ́yọ̀ọ́?
meaning: Said of people who are of no account but act as though they matter.

proverbs: Ta ní ń jájá ní mọ́ṣáláṣí?
meaning: Said to tell off people who are not wanted in a company.

proverbs: Ta ní ń jẹun tájá ń jùrù?
meaning: Said to tell off people who make their presence felt when they should rather make themselves scarce.

proverbs: Tẹ̀tẹ̀ kì í tẹ́ .
meaning: May one never know disgrace.

proverbs: Tòlótòló mọ ẹni tó ń yìnbọn ìdí sí.
meaning: People must be careful in choosing the people they presume to approach with familiarity.

proverbs: Wèrè èèyàn ní ń wípé irú òun ò sí; irú rẹ̀ pọ̀ ó ju ẹgbàágbèje lọ.
meaning: No one is incomparable.

proverbs: Wọ́n ń pe gbẹ́nàgbẹ́nà ẹyẹ àkókó ń yọjú.
meaning: One should not think too much of one’s capabilities.

proverbs: ‘‘Yan àkàrà fún mi wá ká jìjọ jẹ ’’: àìtó èèyàn-án rán níṣẹ́ ní ń jẹ́ bẹ́ẹ̀.
meaning: People in authority should not be tentative in asserting their authority.

proverbs: Yíyẹ́ là ń yẹ́ Òkóró sí tí à ń pè é nígi obì; obì tí ì bá so lórí ẹ̀ ní ń ya abidún.
meaning: People who enjoy the respect of others should not make the mistake of overestimating their importance.

proverbs: A bímọ kò gbọ́n, a ní kó má ṣáà kú; kí ní ń pa ọmọ bí àìgbọ́n?
meaning: A foolish child is not much better than a dead child.

proverbs: A dẹ́bọ fún igúnnugún, ó ní òun kò rú; a d bọ fún àkàlà, ó ní òun kò rú; a dẹ́bọ fún ẹyẹlé, ẹyẹlé gbẹ́bọ, ó rúbọ.
meaning: The vulture and the ground hornbill were unfortunate in comparison with the pigeon, because they did not carry out the prescribed sacrifice.

proverbs: A fọwọ́ mú ajá o lọ, a ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ń fi ìka méjì pè é.
meaning: If both hands cannot detain a dog, two fingers from a distance will not bring it back.

proverbs: A fún ọ lọ́bẹ̀ o tami si; o gbọ́n ju ọlọ́bẹ̀ lọ.
meaning: A person who thus stretches the stew he or she is given would seem to know better than the person who served it how much would suffice for the meal.

proverbs: A kì í bọ́ sínú omi tán ká máa sá fún òtútù.
meaning: Precautions are useful only before the event.

proverbs: A kì í dá aró nÍṣokùn; àlà là ń lò.
meaning: Wherever one might be, one should respect the manners and habits of the place.
