proverbs: A kì í dá ẹrù ikùn pa orí.
meaning: Responsibilities should rest where they belong.

proverbs: A kì í du orí olórí kí àwòdì gbé tẹni lọ.
meaning: One should not save others at the cost of one’s own safety.

proverbs: A kì í duni lóyè ká fọ̀nà ilé-e Baálẹ̀ hanni.
meaning: A person should be treated either as an adversary or as an ally, not as both.

proverbs: A kì í fá orí l hìn olórí.
meaning: One does not settle a matter in the absence of the person most concerned.

proverbs: A kì í fi àgbà sílẹ̀ sin àgbà.
meaning: One should not slight one person in order to humor another.

proverbs: A kì í fi àì-mọ̀-wẹ̀ mòòkùn.
meaning: Never engage in a project for which you lack the requisite skills.

proverbs: A kì í fi ara ẹni ṣe oògùn àlọ̀kúnná.
meaning: Self-preservation is a compulsory project for all.

proverbs: A kì í fi aṣọ ṣèdìdí yọwó.
meaning: It is wise to know what one is negotiating to buy.

proverbs: A kì í fi ejò sórí òrùlé sùn.
meaning: Never let down your guard while danger still lurks.

proverbs: A kì í fi ẹ̀jẹ̀ ìbálé pa tírà; alákoto ò bí abo ọmọ.
meaning: One must not do the forbidden if one does not expect trouble.

proverbs: A kì í fi ẹran ikún gbọn ti àgbọ̀nrín nù.
meaning: Never prefer something of little value to something of great value.

proverbs: A kì í fi ẹ̀tẹ̀ sílẹ̀ pa làpálàpá.
meaning: More serious problems deserve more immediate attention.

proverbs: A kì í fi idà pa ìgbín.
meaning: Remedies should be commensurate with the problem.

proverbs: A kì í fi ìgbín sọ̀kò sórìṣà.
meaning: Service to the worthy should be performed with decorum, not with insult.

proverbs: A kì í fi iná sórí òrùlé sùn.
meaning: Better take care of problems before relaxing.

proverbs: A kì í fi ìtìjú kárùn.
meaning: Never be too shy to speak out on your own behalf.

proverbs: A kì í fi ìyá ẹní dákú ṣeré.
meaning: Never trifle with serious matters.

proverbs: A kì í fi ogun dán ẹ̀ṣọ́ wò.
meaning: Do not play with a loaded and primed gun.

proverbs: A kì í fi ohun sọ́wọ́ búra.
meaning: It is foolish to tempt fate; the dishonest person exposes himself or herself to the possibility of discovery.

proverbs: A kì í fi ohun-olóhun tọrẹ bí kò ṣe tẹni.
meaning: Never be too free with other people’s property.

proverbs: A kì í fi oko sin fún ìwọ̀fà.
meaning: It does not make sense to prevent a servant one has hired from doing what one hired him to do.

proverbs: A kì í fi olórí ogun ṣe ìfagun.
meaning: The best foot is the one to put forward.

proverbs: A kì í fi oníjà sílẹ̀ ká gbájúmọ̀ alápẹpẹ.
meaning: Focus rather on your main problem, not a sideshow.

proverbs: A kì í fi owó du oyè-e alágbára.
meaning: Money won’t buy everything.

proverbs: A kì í fi ọlá jẹ iyọ̀.
meaning: Too much of a good thing can be dangerous.

proverbs: A kì í fi ọ̀nà ikùn han ọ̀fun.
meaning: Do not presume to know better than the expert.

proverbs: A kì í fi ọ̀nà odò han ikún.
meaning: Telling someone what he or she already knows is silly.

proverbs: A kì í fi ọ̀rọ̀ sílẹ̀ gbọ́ ọ̀rọ̀.
meaning: Every obligation deserves attention.

proverbs: A kì í gbá ẹni tó yọ̀bẹ mú.
meaning: Prudence and caution are imperative in dealing with dangerous people.

proverbs: A kì í gbẹ́ àwòrán gàgàrà ká má fi ọwọ́ ẹ ti nǹkan.
meaning: Everybody needs some support.

proverbs: A kì í gbé ẹran erin lérí ká máa fẹsẹ̀ wa ihò ìrẹ̀.
meaning: If one is blessed with plenty, one should not keep chasing after trifles.

proverbs: A kì í gbé odò jiyàn-an ọṣẹ́ hó tàbí kò hó.
meaning: Where the claim can be put to the test, verbal argument is foolish.

proverbs: A kì í gbé ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ sọnù ká tún bèrè-e jàǹto.
meaning: Commiseration after injury is hypocritical.

proverbs: A kì í gbójú-u fífò lé adìẹ àgàgà; a kì í gbójú-u yíyan lé alágẹmọ.
meaning: To expect the impossible is to delude oneself.

proverbs: A kì í gbọ́ ẹjọ́ ẹnìkan dájọ́.
meaning: Justice requires impartiality and a full hearing.

proverbs: A kì í jẹ ‘‘Mo fẹ́rẹ̀-ẹ́ ’’ lọ́bẹ̀.
meaning: What one missed narrowly, one cannot enjoy at all.

proverbs: A kì í ka igún mọ́ ẹran jíjẹ.
meaning: Certain things one does not stoop to do.

proverbs: A kì í ka ilé òrìṣà kún ìlú.
meaning: Do not list questionable items as part of your wealth.

proverbs: A kì í ka oyún inú kún ọmọ ilẹ̀.
meaning: Never count your chickens before they are hatched.

proverbs: A kì í ka ọmọ fún òbí.
meaning: Do not presume to know better than those most intimately involved.

proverbs: A kì í kọ ọmọ bí ká sọ ọ́ ní Èwolódé?
meaning: Childbirth is always a happy event.

proverbs: A kì í léku méjì ká má pòfo.
meaning: Never try to go in two directions at once.

proverbs: A kì í lọ́mọ lẹ́hin kọ oúnjẹ.
meaning: No amount of anger or distress should keep one from looking after one’s dependents.

proverbs: A kì í mọ ọkọ ọmọ ká tún mọ àlè-e rẹ̀.
meaning: Never betray trust or connive at betraying it.

proverbs: A kì í mú ìbọn tetere.
meaning: Always be careful in handling dangerous matters.

proverbs: A kì í mú oko mú ẹjọ́ kí ọ̀kan má yẹ̀.
meaning: One cannot do two mind-absorbing tasks at once.

proverbs: A kì í mú ọmọ oǹdọ́pọ̀ dè.
meaning: It is not a crime to make an offer that might be unacceptable.

proverbs: A kì í mú ọmọ òṣì lọ sí Ìlọ́rọ̀.
meaning: A person cannot transcend his or her destiny.

proverbs: A kì í múlé móko kọ́kan má yẹ̀.
meaning: One cannot go in two opposite directions at once.

proverbs: A kì í ní ẹgbàá nílé wá ẹgbàá ròde.
meaning: Only the promise of a greater fortune should tempt one to neglect what one already has.

proverbs: A kì í pa asínwín ilé, nítorí ọjọ́ tí tòde yó bàá wá sílé.
meaning: One should cultivate one’s own madness; one might need it to combat others’ madness.

proverbs: A kì í pa igún, a kì í jẹ igún, a kì í fi igún bọrí.
meaning: Certain behaviors are beyond the pale.

proverbs: A kì í pé kí òṣìkà ṣe é ká wò ó.
meaning: Never tempt evil people to do their evil.

proverbs: A kì í peni lólè ká máa gbé ọmọ ẹran jó.
meaning: It is foolish to behave in ways that will confirm people’s evil opinion of one.

proverbs: A kì í rán ọ̀lẹ wo ojú ọjọ́ àárọ̀.
meaning: Never rely on the advice of people who have a vested interest in the matter being considered.

proverbs: A kì í re nísun lọ dà síbú.
meaning: Do not rob the poor to further enrich the wealthy.

proverbs: A kì í rí adìẹ nílẹ̀ ká da àgbàdo fún ajá.
meaning: Always direct help where it will be appreciated and where it will do some good.

proverbs: A kì í rí àjẹkù orò.
meaning: What must be consumed must be completely consumed.

proverbs: A kì í rí bàtá nílẹ̀ ká fẹnu sín in jẹ.
meaning: Too much talk about a problem is useless when a practical solution has presented itself. One should not make a person’s case for him or her when that person is present.

proverbs: A kì í rí ewé nílẹ̀ ká fọwọ́ fámí.
meaning: Take advantage of whatever aids are available to you.

proverbs: A kì í rí ẹni ranni l rù ká yọké.
meaning: Always avail yourself of offered help.

proverbs: A kì í rí ojú ẹkùn ká tọ́ ẹkùn.
meaning: It is foolish to invite disaster needlessly on one’s own head.

proverbs: A kì í sá fún àjíà ká dìgbò lu eégún.
meaning: Never court a greater disaster in an attempt to avert a minor one.

proverbs: A kì í sin àlè kọjá odò; ohun tí ń ṣe ọṣẹ́ ò tó nǹkan.
meaning: If one is engaged in a dangerous venture, one should not also cast discretion to the wind.

proverbs: A kì í sọ pé abẹ Ọ̀yọ mú; nígbà náà ni yó sọ pé bẹ́ẹ̀ ni òun ò tíì pọn.
meaning: Offer no braggart any opportunity to resume his bragging.

proverbs: A kì í sọrọ ìkọ̀kọ̀ lójú olófòófó.
meaning: Be careful with your secrets.

proverbs: A kì í sùn jẹ́rìí ìdí.
meaning: Assert only those things you know for certain.

proverbs: A kì í ṣe fáàárí ẹ̀ṣẹ́ dídì sọ́mọ adẹ́tẹ̀.
meaning: Never make fun of people because of their affliction.

proverbs: A kì í ṣe fáàárí itọ́ dídà sọ́mọ a-kú wárápá.
meaning: Never make fun of afflicted people by mimicking their affliction.

proverbs: A kì í ṣoore tán ká lóṣòó tì í.
meaning: Having done some good, do not hang around to compel gratitude.

proverbs: A kì í ṣòwò méjì kẹran má jẹ ọ̀kan.
meaning: One cannot effectively manage two enterprises at once.

proverbs: A kì í ti ojú ogun wẹ́fọ́n.
meaning: Always make your preparations well ahead of the event.

proverbs: A kì í ti ojú oníka mẹ́sàn-án kà á.
meaning: One must be discreet in speaking about other people’s flaws and deformities.

proverbs: A kì í tijú bá baálé ilé jẹ akátá; bó bá mú, ìwọ náà a mú tìẹ.
meaning: Never be too bashful to adopt the ways of the people among whom you find yourself.

proverbs: A kì í wá aláṣọ-àlà nísọ̀ elépo.
meaning: One should know the likely places to look for whatever one seeks.

proverbs: A kì í wà nínú ìṣẹ́ ká perin tọrẹ.
meaning: Always live according to your circumstances.

proverbs: A kì í wíjọ́ọ wíwò ká jàre.
meaning: One should not complain that other people are doing what one is also doing.

proverbs: A kì í yin ọmọdé lójú ara rẹ̀; ìfàsẹ́hìn ní ń kángun ẹ̀.
meaning: Children should not be praised too highly; they should always be made aware that they can be even better.

proverbs: A kúnlẹ̀ a pàgbò, alubàtá ní ‘‘ojú ò f rakù’’; o f bá wọn ṣúpó ni?
meaning: One should always know when to take one’s leave.

proverbs: A lé tẹ̀m̀bẹ̀lẹ̀kun jìnnà bí ẹnipé kó bọ́ jù sígbó.
meaning: No one should want anything to do with conspiracy.

proverbs: À ń fọ̀tún t ní, à ń fòsì tú ṣòkòtò, obìnrín ní a kò bá òun gbọ́ tọmọ.
meaning: Some people are incapable of recognizing and acknowledging favors.

proverbs: À ń gba òròmọ adìẹ lọ́wọ́ ikú, ó ní wọn ò jẹ́ kí òun jẹ̀ láàtàn.
meaning: Chicks foraging at the dump are easy prey for kites.

proverbs: À ń gbèjà Ọ̀jàá, Ọ̀jà ní ta ní ń jà lẹ́hìnkùlé òun?
meaning: Some people do not acknowledge or appreciate favors.

proverbs: A ní ìrókò ni yó pa ọmọdé, ó bojú-wẹ̀hìn; òòjọ́ ní ń jà?
meaning: The child obviously does not know that the fact that he does not die immediately in no way invalidates the curse.

proverbs: A ní kí olókùnrùn ṣe tó, ó ní òun ò lè ṣe tó, tò, tó.
meaning: The person addressed has his or her priorities reversed.

proverbs: A ní kọ́mọ má kùú, o ní kò jọ bàbá kò jọ ìyá.
‘‘À ń jùwọ́n’’ ò ṣéé wí lẹ́jọ́; ìjà ìlara ò tán bọ̀rọ̀.
meaning: Quarrels whose causes cannot be openly admitted will not readily end.

proverbs: À ń kì í, à ń sà á, ó ní òun ò mọ ẹni tó kú; a ní, ‘‘Alákàá ẹgbàá, a-biṣu-wọ̀rọ̀-wọ̀rọ̀-lóko, a-bàgbàdo-tàkì-tàkì-l gàn’’; ó ní, ‘‘Ọlọ́dẹ ló kú, tàbí ìnájà?’’
meaning: A person for whom everything must be spelled out, a person who cannot make deductions from the most obvious hints, is daft indeed.

proverbs: À ń kì í, à ń sà á, ó ní òun ò mọ ẹni tó kú; ó ń gbọ́, ‘‘Ikú mẹ́rù, pàgá, a-biṣu-ú-ta-bí-òdòdó, a-lábà-ọkà, a-roko-f yẹ-jẹ’’; ó ní, ‘‘Àgbẹ̀ ló kú, tàbí ọ̀nájà?’’
meaning: A person for whom everything must be spelled out, a person who cannot make deductions from the most obvious hints, is daft indeed.

proverbs: À ń sọ̀rọ̀ elégédé, obìnrín ń bèrè ohun tí à ń sọ, a ní ọ̀rọ̀ ọkùnrin ni; bí a bá kó elégédé jọ, ta ni yó sè é?
meaning: The woman, certainly. There is no point in excluding her from a matter that will eventually involve her anyway.

proverbs: À ń sọ̀rọ̀ obìnrin, a ní ká sọ́ bàrà ká lọ gbin bàrà sódò; ta ní máa báni pa á?
A rí i lójú, a mọ̀ ọ́ lẹ́nu; òṣòwò oṣẹ kì í pọ́n-wọ́-lá.
meaning: Soap is recognizable as soap, and anyone who has ever tasted it knows that one does not lick fingers caked with soap. Each trade has its don’ts.

proverbs: A ta bàbà, a fowó-o bàbà ra baba.
meaning: With what one has one seeks one’s goals.

proverbs: Ààrẹ ń pè ọ́ ò ńdÍfá; bÍfá bá fọọre tí Ààrẹ́ fọbi ń kọ́?
meaning: There is no point in attempting to restrict the action of an absolute authority.

proverbs: Àáyá bọ́ sílẹ̀, ó bọ́ sílé.
meaning: When danger lurks, the wisest course is to run for safety.

proverbs: Àáyá gbọ́n, Ògúngbẹ̀- sì gbọ́n; bí Ògúngbẹ́-ẹ́ ti ń bẹ̀rẹ̀ ni àáyá ń tiro.
meaning: The prey that knows its stalker’s tricks is safe.

proverbs: Àbá alágẹmọ lòrìṣà ń gbà.
meaning: One should heed the advice of trusted friends and advisers.

proverbs: Àbá kì í di òtítọ́; ojo ni kì í jẹ́ ká dá a.
meaning: Although plans may never bear fruit, people should still make them.

proverbs: Àbá ní ń di òtítọ́; ojo ni kì í jẹ́ ká da.
meaning: Without striving, one accomplishes nothing.

proverbs: Àbàtì àlàpà: a bà á tì, a bá a rẹ́ .
meaning: One reconciles oneself to matters one cannot control.

proverbs: A-bayé-jẹ́ kò ṣéé fìdí ọ̀ràn hàn.
meaning: One should keep one’s secrets from treacherous people.

proverbs: Abẹ́rẹ́ ò ṣéé gúnyán.
meaning: Some tools are inadequate for some tasks.

proverbs: Abẹ́rẹ́ tó wọnú òkun ò ṣéé wá.
meaning: Some tasks are hopelessly impossible to accomplish.

proverbs: Abiyamọ, kàgbo wàrà; ọjọ́ ń lọ.
meaning: Attend to duties on time.

proverbs: Abiyamọ kì í rìn kó ṣánwọ́ ahá.
meaning: She must be prepared to feed the baby.

proverbs: Abiyamọ́ purọ́ mọ́mọ-ọ rẹ̀ jẹun.
meaning: One uses every ruse available in the interest of one’s well-being.

proverbs: Abiyamọ́ ṣọwọ́ kòtò lu ọmọ-ọ rẹ̀.
meaning: Discretion is the better part of discipline.

proverbs: Àbọ̀ṣẹ́ kì í ṣe iṣ òòjọ́; iṣẹ́-ẹ baba ẹni ní ń gbani lọ́jọ́ gan-an.
meaning: One does not waste one’s time on trifles or hobbies.

proverbs: Àbùkún layé gbà.
meaning: Supplement rather than deplete.

proverbs: Adánilóró fagbára kọ́ni.
meaning: Once disappointed or injured, one learns to be self-reliant.

proverbs: Adẹ́tẹ̀ ò gbọdọ̀ dúró de eléépín.
meaning: Know your weaknesses.

proverbs: Adẹ́tẹ̀-ẹ̀ ní òun sẹ́ ọ̀ràn kan de àwọn ará ilé òun; ó ní bí òún bá lọ sídàálẹ̀, wọn ò j fi kàn-ìn-kàn-ìn òun wẹ̀.
meaning: People have a knack for skirting dangerous or distasteful situations.

proverbs: Adìẹ ìrànà ní ń ṣíwájú òkú.
meaning: Matters must be attended to in their proper sequence.

proverbs: Adìẹ ò lè ti ìwòyí sunkún ehín.
meaning: Everything at its proper time.

proverbs: Adìẹ ò lórúnkún ẹjọ́.
meaning: One should steer clear of actionable behavior.

proverbs: Adìẹ rí aláásáà, ó pa ìyẹ́ mọ́.
meaning: When one sees potential danger approaching, one should take precautions.

proverbs: Adìẹ-odò ò ṣéé bọ ìpọ̀nrí.
meaning: One should use only tools proper to the task at hand.

proverbs: Àdó gba ara ẹ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀, ká tó fi oògùn sí?
meaning: Do not seek protection from a helpless person.

proverbs: A-fasẹ́-gbèjò ń tan ara-a rẹ̀ jẹ.
meaning: The shiftless person hurts himself more than others.

proverbs: A-fàtẹ́lẹwọ́-fanná kì í dúró.
meaning: A person who has a pressing problem has no time for socializing.

proverbs: Àfẹ́ẹ̀rí kan ò ju ká rí igbó ńlá bọ́ sí lọ; ẹbọ kan ò ju ọ̀pọ̀ èèyàn lọ; ‘‘Òrìṣá gbé mi lé àtète’’ kan ò ju orí ẹṣin lọ.
meaning: Practical and realistic moves are more reliable than mysterious expectations.

proverbs: Afẹ́fẹ́ ń da ológìì láàmú; oníyẹ̀fun rọra.
meaning: When even those better situated are defeated, one must be prepared for tough times.

proverbs: A-fi-tiẹ̀-sílẹ̀-gbọ́-tẹni-ẹlẹ́ni: ọ̀gànjọ́ ni wọ́n ń sìnkú-u rẹ̀.
meaning: Do not sacrifice your self-interest to take care of others.

proverbs: Àfòmọ́ ń ṣe ara-a rẹ̀, ó ní òun ń ṣe igi.
meaning: The host’s death will also be the parasite’s death.

proverbs: Àgádágodo ò finú han ara-a wọn.
meaning: Some secrets one should not divulge to others.

proverbs: Àgùntàn ò jí ní kùtùkùyù ṣe ẹnu bọbọ.
meaning: One should not dawdle in the morning.

proverbs: Àgbà òṣìkà ń gbin ìyà sílẹ̀ de ọmọ-ọ rẹ̀.
meaning: One’s character often affects the fortunes of one’s children.

proverbs: Àgbà ṣoore má wo bẹ̀.
meaning: Do not advertise your acts of kindness or pointedly await acknowledgment of them.

proverbs: À-gbà-bọ́ ò di tẹni.
meaning: There is nothing like having one’s own.

proverbs: Àgbàdo kì í ṣe èèyàn; ta ní ń rí ọmọ l hìn eèsún?
meaning: One should not overestimate the value of thing.

proverbs: Àgbàká labiyamọ ń gbàjá mọ́ ọmọ-ọ rẹ̀.
meaning: One must be thorough in discharging one’s responsibility.

proverbs: Àgbàlagbàá ṣenú kẹrẹndẹn; èyí tó máa ṣe ń bẹ níkùn-un rẹ̀.
meaning: Be a person of thought and action, not of words.

proverbs: Àgbẹ̀jẹ ò korò nílé ń lá.
meaning: When one is in need, one cannot be too choosy.

proverbs: A-gbé-ọ̀ọ̀dẹ̀ bí òfé, a-mọ-ara-í-ré bí oódẹ; a dẹ́bọ fún òfé, òfé ò rú, agánrán gbẹ́bọ, ó rúbọ; àsẹ̀hìnwá àsẹ̀hìnbọ̀ òfé di ará Ọ̀yọ́, agánrán di ará oko; wọ́n rò pé òfé ò gbọ́n.
meaning: Never second-guess people who are better informed than you are.

proverbs: Àgbìgbò, rọra fò, ọdẹ́ ti dé sóko; àgbìgbò tí ò bá rọra fò á bọ́ sápò ọdẹ.
meaning: Conditions are hazardous; it behooves everyone to take care.

proverbs: Àgbò dúdú kọjá odò ó di funfun.
meaning: Propitious events can drastically change a person’s fortunes for the better.

proverbs: Àgbokan là ń rọ́ Ifá adití.
meaning: One cannot be too subtle with the daft.

proverbs: Àgbọn kì í ṣe oúnjẹ ẹyẹ.
meaning: Some things and some people are immune to some types of danger; one should not attempt the impossible.

proverbs: Ahún dùn; kò tóó jẹ fúnni.
meaning: One should husband one’s resources wisely.

proverbs: Ahún ńre àjò, ó gbé ilé-e rẹ̀ dání.
meaning: One’s dearest possessions deserve the closest attention.

proverbs: Ahún wọnú orù, ó ku àtiyọ.
meaning: One should consider the possible consequences of one’s actions before acting.

proverbs: Àìgbọ́n ni yó pa Iṣikan; a ní ìyáa rẹ̀-ẹ́ kú, ó ní nígbà tí òún gbọ́, ṣe ni òun ń dárò; bíyàá ẹní bá kú àárò là ń dá?
meaning: The wellbred person is always mindful of his or her obligations.

proverbs: Àì-gbọ́n-léwe ni à-dàgbà-di-wèrè.
meaning: The man turns out just as the child was; the grown person acquires his traits in childhood.

proverbs: Àì-mọ̀-ọ́-gbé-kalẹ̀ leégún fi ń gba ọtí.
meaning: Ineptitude makes an impossible job of the easiest tasks.)

proverbs: Àì-mọwọ́-ọ́-wẹ̀ ni àì-bágbà-jẹ; ọmọ tó mọwọ́-ọ́ wẹ̀ á bágbà jẹ.
meaning: To qualify to live in society, one must learn the social graces.

proverbs: Àìpé, ‘‘Tìrẹ nìyí’’ ní ń bí ayé nínú.
meaning: Failure to take account of people’s possible influence on one’s affairs incites their anger. As long as one assumes humility, people will let one be.

proverbs: Àì-roko, àì-rodò tí ń ṣápẹ́ fún eégún jó.
meaning: It is an idler who makes music for masqueraders to dance.

proverbs: Àì-sọ̀rọ̀ ní ń mú ẹnu rùn.
meaning: One should always say one’s piece in a discussion.

proverbs: Ajá èṣín ò mọdẹ.
meaning: One learns from experience and maturity.

proverbs: Ajá là bá kí; èse ò pẹran fúnni jẹ.
meaning: Assign commensurate values to your assets.

proverbs: Ajá ti eré-e rẹ̀ẹ́ bá dánilójú là ń dẹ sí ehoro.
meaning: One entrusts important tasks only to those one can trust.

proverbs: Ajá tí ò létí ò ṣé-é dẹ̀gbẹ́ .
meaning: A person who cannot be instructed is useless.

proverbs: Ajá tó gbé iyọ̀, kí ni yó fi ṣe?
meaning: Do not expend your effort on senseless ventures.

proverbs: Ajá tó lè sáré là ń dẹ sí egbin.
meaning: One entrusts important tasks only to those one can trust.

proverbs: Ajàkàṣù ò mọ̀ bí ìyàn-án mú.
meaning: Greed knows no thrift.

proverbs: Àjànàkú kúrò lẹ́ran à ń gọ dè.
meaning: The wise person puts some distance between himself and a formidable adversary.

proverbs: Àjànàkú ò ṣéé rù.
meaning: Some tasks are impossible to accomplish.

proverbs: Ìjàpá ní kò sí ohun tó dà bí ohun tí a mọ̀ ọ́ṣe; ó ní bí òun bá ń rìn lóko ẹ̀pà, ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan a máa bọ́ sóun lẹ́nu.
meaning: When one does what one is a true expert at doing, it seems like performing magic.

proverbs: Ìjàpá ní ọjọ́ tí òun ti jágbọ́n-ọn òo lọrùn ò ti wọ òun mọ́.
meaning: One who says yes to every request avoids a great many arguments.

proverbs: Ìjàpá ń yan lóko; aláìlóye-é ní ó jọ pẹ́pẹ́yẹ.
meaning: It is indeed a fool who cannot discern the obvious.

proverbs: Àjẹ́gbà ni ti kọ̀ǹkọ̀.
meaning: It is in the nature of sheep to follow and to lack initiative.

proverbs: Àjẹkù là ń mayo.
meaning: How one lives will show how well off one is.

proverbs: Àjẹkù làgbẹ̀ ń tà.
meaning: One takes care of one’s own needs before one disposes of the excess.

proverbs: Àjẹsílẹ̀-ẹ gbèsè tí ò j kí ẹgbẹ̀fà tóó ná.
meaning: Existing debts eat new fortunes away.

proverbs: A-jí-má-bọ̀ọ́jú: tí ń fi ojú àná wòran.
meaning: A person who does not keep his eyes peeled for developments is ever behind time.

proverbs: Àjímú kì í tí.
meaning: The task to which one gives the highest priority does not suffer.

proverbs: Àjò kì í dùn kódídẹ má rè Ìwó.
meaning: The so-journer should never allow the pleasantness of his or her sojourn to obliterate thoughts of returning home.

proverbs: Àjò kì í dùn kónílé má relé.
meaning: The traveler should never forget his or her home.

proverbs: Àjòjí lójú, ṣùgbọ́n kò fi ríran.
meaning: A stranger’s eyes are blind to the intricacies of his or her new surroundings.

proverbs: À-jókòó-àì-fẹ̀hìntì bí ẹní nàró ni.
meaning: Never do things by half measures.

proverbs: A-ká-ìgbá-tà-á náwó ikú.
meaning: Whoever engages in a dangerous venture more than earns his or her pay.

proverbs: Àkámọ́ ẹkùn-ún níyọnu.
meaning: One should be wary in deciding what prey to stalk.

proverbs: Àkísà aṣọ la fi ń ṣe òṣùká.
meaning: One’s most valuable possessions are not for careless use.

proverbs: Àkó balẹ̀, ó fi gbogbo ara kígbe.
meaning: A person who needs help should not be coy in asking.

proverbs: Akọ̀pẹ Ìjàyè ò gbọ́ tiẹ̀, ó ní ogún kó Agboroode.
meaning: The wise person learns from others’ misfortunes instead of gawking at them.

proverbs: Aláàárù kì í ru ẹṣin.
meaning: Certain tasks are impossible to accomplish.

proverbs: Aláàjàá gbé e sókè, o ní, ‘‘Kó ṣẹ!’’; o mọ̀ bí ibi lówí tàbí ire?
meaning: One should be certain about what is happening before one intervenes or becomes involved.

proverbs: Alágbàfọ̀ kì í bá odò ṣọ̀tá.
meaning: One does not turn one’s back on one’s means of livelihood.

proverbs: Alákatam̀pòó ṣe bí ọ̀bọ ò gbọ́n; ọ̀bọ́ gbọ́n; tinú ọ̀bọ lọ̀bọ́ ń ṣe.
meaning: It matters nothing to be derided as long as you know what you are doing and why.

proverbs: Alákìísà ní ń tọ́jú abẹ́rẹ́ tòun tòwú.
meaning: Each person looks after his her own interests.

proverbs: Aláǹtakùn, bí yóò bá ọ jà, a ta ká ọ lára.
meaning: The attentive person can detect signs of hostility before it occurs. Also, one makes good preparations before embarking on a venture.

proverbs: Aláǹtakùnún takùn sí ìṣasùn, ṣíbí gbọludé.
meaning: In the absence of the proper tools, one cannot fault the laborer for being idle.

proverbs: Aláṣedànù tí ń fajá ṣọdẹ ẹja.
meaning: It is folly to employ an impossible tool for a given task.

proverbs: Àlejò bí òkété là ń fi èkùrọ́ lọ̀.
meaning: One should approach other people as their stations dictate.

proverbs: Àlejò tó bèèrè ọ̀nà kò níí sọnù.
meaning: One should be willing to admit one’s ignorance and seek direction.

proverbs: Àlùkò ò ní ohùn méjì; ‘‘Ó dilé’’ lagbe ń ké.
meaning: One reveals one’s mettle at one’s place of employment.

proverbs: Ẹnu iṣẹ́ ẹni ni a ti ń mọ ẹni lọ́lẹ.
meaning: A person who will bring disaster on others behaves like the wayward foot that drags weeds into town.

proverbs: Amọ̀nà èṣí kì í ṣe amọ̀nà ọdúnnìí.
meaning: The person whose knowledge does not grow with the times soon becomes ignorant.

proverbs: Ẹní yára ni Ògún ń gbè.
meaning: The swift are justified in taking advantage of the tardy.

proverbs: Amùṣùà àgbẹ̀ tí ń gbin kókò.
meaning: It is a wastrel farmer that plants an inferior crop.

proverbs: Àpà èèyàn ò mọ̀ pé ohun tó pọ̀-ọ́ lè tán.
meaning: A wastrel knows no thrift.

proverbs: Àpà-á fi ọwọ́ mẹ́wẹ̀ẹ̀wá bọ ẹnu; àpà, a-bìjẹun-wọ̀mù-wọ̀mù.
meaning: A wastrel is immoderate in his eating.

proverbs: Apajájẹ ní ẹ̀rù adìẹ ń ba òun.
meaning: A hardened criminal pretends to have scruples about mere peccadilloes.

proverbs: Àpàkòmọ̀rà, tí ń gẹṣin lórí àpáta.
meaning: A person who has no part in paying for a thing is seldom careful in using it.

proverbs: A-pẹ́- -jẹ kì í jẹ ìbàjẹ́ .
meaning: Those who are patient will have the best of things.

proverbs: Àpèmọ́ra là ń pe Tèmídire.
meaning: Each person must advance his or her own interests.

proverbs: Àpọ́n dògí ó ṣàrò.
meaning: One should make provisions for the future in one’s youth.

proverbs: Ara ẹ̀ lara ẹ̀: ṣòkòtò ọlọ́pàá.
meaning: Leave nothing to waste, for one can always find some use for the smallest remnant.

proverbs: Ara kì í rọni ká ṣẹ́gi ta.
meaning: One who has found success does not persist in grubbing.

proverbs: Ara kì í tu ẹni káká, kí ara ó roni koko, ká má leè jíkàkà dÍfá.
meaning: Whatever one’s condition, one does what one must do.

proverbs: Ará ọ̀run ò ṣ tí aṣọ.
meaning: The uninitiated do not know the customs of a place.

proverbs: A-rìn-fàà-lójú-ak gàn, a-yan-kàṣà-lójú-abúni, abúni ò lówó nílé ju ẹnu-u rẹ̀ lọ.
meaning: One’s best course is to ignore detractors and insulters; all they have is their mouths.

proverbs: Arìngbẹ̀rẹ̀ ni yó mùú oyè délé; asárétete ò róyè jẹ.
meaning: The spoils do not necessarily go to those who exert themselves most.

proverbs: À-ró-kanlẹ̀ laṣọ ayaba; à-wà-kanlẹ̀ ni ti yàrà.
meaning: Whatever one has to do, one must be thorough and not satisfied with half measures.

proverbs: Arúgbó oǹdágbèsè: ó ní mélòó ni òun óò dúró san níbẹ̀?
meaning: A person whose days are numbered can afford to take on long-term obligations freely.

proverbs: A-sáré-lówó ń bẹ lọ́nà ogun; A-pọ̀ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀ ń bẹ lọ́nà èrò; Bó-pẹ́ -títí-n-ó-là ǹ bẹ lábà, ó ń jẹ ẹ̀sun iṣu.
meaning: Wealth comes to those who exert themselves, not to those who wait for it to find them.

proverbs: À-sìnkú-àì-jogún, òṣì ní ń tani.
meaning: One should have something to show for one’s efforts.

proverbs: Asínwín ní òun ó ti iná bọlé; wọ́n ní kó má ti iná bọlé; ó ní òun ó sáà ti iná bọlé; wọ́n ní bó bá tiná bọlé àwọn ó sọ ọ́ si; ó ní ìyẹn kẹ̀ ìkan.
meaning: Even an imbecile becomes sane when his life is at stake.

proverbs: A-sọ-aré-dìjà ní ń jẹ̀bi ẹjọ́.
meaning: One should take a jest in the spirit of jest.

proverbs: A-sọ̀kò-sádìẹ-igba, òkò ní ń sọ tí ilẹ̀- fi ń ṣú.
meaning: Tackling a job with inadequate tools makes the job interminable.

proverbs: Àṣàyá kì í j kí ọmọ ọ̀yà ó gbọ́n.
meaning: A person who takes life as a jest does not learn to be wary.

proverbs: A-ṣe-kó-súni, ẹrú-u Ségbá; ó fọ́ akèrègbè tán ó lọ sóde Ọ̀yọ́ lọ gba onísé wá; bẹ́ẹ̀ni ẹgbàá lowó onísé.
meaning: There is nothing one can do in the face of ingrained folly.

proverbs: À-ṣe-sílẹ̀ làbọ̀wábá; ẹni tó ṣu sílẹ̀ á bọ̀ wá bá eṣinṣin.
meaning: One reaps what one sows.

proverbs: À-ṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀-tọ́-ọtí-wò okùn-un bàǹtẹ́ já; bí a bá mu àmuyó ń kọ́?
meaning: One should match the response to the stimulus.

proverbs: Aṣiwèrè èèyàn lòjò ìgboro ń pa.
meaning: Only an imbecile ignores a refuge when one is available.

proverbs: Aṣiwèrè èèyàn ní ń gbèjà ìlú-u rẹ̀.
meaning: A town’s cause is no business of any one individual.

proverbs: A-ṣoore-jókòó-tì-í, bí aláìṣe ni.
meaning: One should not dwell on what favor one has done.

proverbs: Aṣòroójà bí ìjà ọjà; onítìjú ò níí sá; ẹni tí ń nà án ò níí dáwọ́ dúró.
meaning: Too much concern with appearances exposes one to occasional inconveniences.

proverbs: A-ṣòwò-ọṣẹ kì í pa owó ń la.
meaning: One’s success cannot exceed one’s enterprise.

proverbs: Aṣọ funfun òun àbàwọ́n kì í rẹ́ .
meaning: A person of good breeding does not associate with an ill-bred person.

proverbs: Aṣọ ìrókò ò ṣéé fi bora.
meaning: Always use the proper material for the job at hand.

proverbs: Aṣọ tá a bá rí lára igún, ti igún ni.
meaning: The vulture may lack feathers, but it does not borrow from other birds.

proverbs: A-ṣọ́-ẹ̀hìnkùlé ba ara-a rẹ̀ nínú jẹ́ ; ohun tó wuni là ń ṣe nílé ẹni.
meaning: What one does in the privacy of one’s home is nobody else’s business.

proverbs: Àtàrí ìbá ṣe ìkòkò ká gbé e fún ọ̀tá yẹ̀wò; a ní ó ti fọ́ yányán.
meaning: An enemy is not one to trust with one’s destiny.

proverbs: Atẹ́gùn ò ṣéé gbé.
meaning: Certain propositions are unrealizable.

proverbs: Àtẹ́lẹwọ́ ò ṣéé fi rúná.
meaning: One should not attempt difficult tasks without the proper resources.

proverbs: Atipo ò mọ erèé; ó ní, ‘‘Bàbá, mo réwé funfun lóko.’’
meaning: Ignorance is a curse.

proverbs: Àtònímòní ò tó àtànọ́mànọ́.
meaning: The person who has endured since yesterday takes precedence over the person who has endured all day.

proverbs: A-tọrọ-ohun-gbogbo-lọ́wọ́-Ọlọ́run kì í kánjú.
meaning: The supplicant must be patient for an answer.

proverbs: A-wí-fúnni-kó-tó-dáni, àgbà òmùjà ni.
meaning: One would be wise to avoid adversaries confident enough to show their hands beforehand.

proverbs: À-wí-ìgbọ́, àfọ̀-ọ̀-gbọ́ tí ń fi àjèjé ọwọ́ mumi.
meaning: The obstinate child drinks with the bare hand, even though it is unsatisfying.

proverbs: Àwítẹ́lẹ̀ ní ń jẹ́ ọmọ́ gbẹ́nà; ọmọ kì í gbẹ́nà lásán.
meaning: A clever child reflects the instruction he or she has received.

proverbs: Awo aláwo la kì í dá lẹ́ẹ̀mejì.
meaning: One might not put oneself out for others, but will do so for oneself.

proverbs: Àwòdì òkè tí ń wo ìkaraun kọ̀rọ̀, kí ni yó fìgbín ṣe?
meaning: One should not waste time on a task one cannot master.

proverbs: Awọ erin ò ṣéé ṣe gángan.
meaning: Employ the proper material for the task at hand.

proverbs: Awọ ẹlẹ́dẹ̀ ò ṣéé ṣe gbẹ̀du.
meaning: Certain materials are of no use in some applications.

proverbs: Awọ ẹnu ò ṣéé ṣe ìlù.
meaning: Employ the proper materials for the task at hand.

proverbs: Àyàn ò gbẹdùn.
meaning: Certain approaches must be rejected as improper.

proverbs: Àyangbẹ ẹjá dùn; ṣùgbọ́n kí la ó jẹ k já tó yan?
meaning: Although one must look to the future, one must also take care of the present.

proverbs: Ayé ń lọ, à ń tọ̀ ọ́.
meaning: One lives according to what life confronts one with.

proverbs: Ayé ò ṣé-é bá lérí; wọ́n lè ṣeni léṣe.
meaning: Be wary in dealing with the world.

proverbs: Ayé ò ṣé-é finú hàn; bí o lọ́gbọ̀n, fi síkùn ara-à rẹ.
meaning: People of the world are not reliable; whatever wisdom one wishes to pass on should be reserved for one’s own use.

proverbs: Baálé àìlọ́wọ̀ ni àlejò àìlọ́wọ̀.
meaning: The visitor responds according to his reception.

proverbs: Baálẹ̀ àgbẹ̀-ẹ́ ní òun ò ní nǹkan-án tà lọ́run, kí owó ọkà òún ṣáà ti pé.
meaning: If one does not ask for too much, one will not have to die to get it.

proverbs: Baba-ìsìnkú ò fọmọ-ọ rẹ̀ sọfà; alábàáṣe ń fọmọ-ọ rẹ̀ kówó.
meaning: The obligated person holds back, whereas the helper risks his all.

proverbs: ‘‘Báyìí là ń ṣe’’ níbìkan, èèwọ̀ ibòmín-ìn.
meaning: Different people, different ways.

proverbs: Bí a bá bá aṣiwèrè gbé, a ó gba odì ọlọgbọ́n; bí a bá bá ewé iyá ṣọ̀tẹ̀, a ó ṣẹ ẹlẹ́kọ.
meaning: Keeping bad company alienates good people; to shun a person is to shun that person’s friends.

proverbs: Bí a bá bá ẹrán wí, ká bá ẹràn wí.
meaning: If both sides in a dispute deserve blame, one should apportion it accordingly.

proverbs: Bí a bá fi ọwọ́ ọ̀tún na ọmọ, à fi ọwọ́ òsì fà á mọ́ra.
meaning: A child deserving punishment yet deserves love.

proverbs: Bí a bá jẹ̀wọ́ tán ẹ̀rín là ń rín; bí a bá yó tán orun ní ń kunni.
meaning: The action should match the occasion.

proverbs: Bí a bá kìlọ̀ fólè, ká kìlọ̀ fóníṣu ẹ̀bá ọ̀nà.
meaning: The offender and the tempter both deserve blame.

proverbs: Bí a bá ní mọ̀, ọ̀mọ̀ràn a mọ̀ ọ́.
meaning: The perceptive person can detect meaning in the slightest of signs.

proverbs: Bí a bá ń sunkún, à máa ríran.
meaning: However accommodating one is, one should never take leave of one’s good judgment.

proverbs: Bí a bá ránni níṣẹ́ ẹrú, à fi jẹ́ tọmọ.
meaning: The wellbred person removes the flaws in a message sent through him, or a task given him to perform.

proverbs: Bí a bá rántí ọjọ́ kan ìbálé, ká rántí ọjọ́ kan ìkúnlẹ̀ abiyamọ, ká rántí kan abẹ́ tí ń tani lára.
meaning: As one takes one’s pleasures, one should be mindful of the pains that make them possible.

proverbs: Bí a bá rí èké, à ṣebí èèyàn rere ni; à sọ̀rọ̀ ságbọ̀n a jò.
meaning: It is easy to mistake a bad person for a good one and to place trust in that person.

proverbs: Bí a bá rí òwúrọ̀, alẹ́ ń kọ́?
meaning: Nobody should be judged until he or she has reached the end of his or her days.

proverbs: Bí a bá sọ̀rọ̀ tán, ẹrín là ń rín; bí a bá yó tán orun ní ń kunni.
meaning: When a matter has been taken care of, one turns one’s attention in the appropriate direction.

proverbs: Bí a bá ṣe ohun ńlá, à fi èpè gba ara ẹni là.
meaning: One’s greatest duty is self-preservation.

proverbs: Bí a bá ta ará ilé ẹni lọ́pọ̀, a kì í rí i rà lọ́wọ̀n-ọ́n mọ́.
meaning: Once one has besmirched the name of a person one is close to, one cannot later wipe it clean.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá gbé ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ sọ sínú omi gbígbóná, ká tún gbé e sọ sí tútù, kì í mọ èyí tó sàn.
meaning: It takes a change in circumstances to make one appreciate good fortune.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá gbọ́n ju àparò oko ẹni lọ, a kì í pa á.
meaning: To succeed, one must be more clever than one’s adversary.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá rádànán, à fòòbẹ̀ ṣẹbọ.
meaning: One makes do with what one can find. See also the next entry.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá rígún a ò gbọdọ̀ ṣebọ; bí a ò bá rí àkàlà a ò gbọdọ̀ ṣorò.
meaning: Nothing can be accomplished in the absence of the requisite materials.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá torí iṣu jẹ epo, à torí epo jẹṣu.
meaning: If one does not perform a duty because one likes it, one performs it because it is the right thing to do.

proverbs: Bí a kò bímọ rí, a kò ha rọ́mọ lẹ́hìn adìẹ?
meaning: Children are no novelty to anyone.

proverbs: Bí a kò ránni sọ́jà, ọjà kì í ránni sílé.
meaning: Without making an effort, one cannot expect rewards.

proverbs: Bí a kò ṣe ọdẹ rí, a kò lè mọ ẹsẹ̀-ẹ kò-lọ-ibẹ̀un.
meaning: One is an ignoramus in a trade that is not one’s own.

proverbs: Bí alẹ́ bá lẹ́, à fi ọmọ ayò fún ayò.
meaning: When the time comes, one puts an end to whatever one is doing.

proverbs: Bí alẹ́ bá lẹ́ , bọnnọ-bọ́nnọ́ a rẹ̀wẹ̀sì.
meaning: There must be an end to every struggle and every exertion.

proverbs: Bí alẹ́ kò lẹ́ , òòbẹ̀ kì í fò.
meaning: All actions must await their auspicious moments.

proverbs: Bí apá ò ká àràbà, apá lè ká egbò ìdí-i rẹ̀.
meaning: If one is no match for the father, one may be more than a match for the child.

proverbs: Bí àrùn búburú bá wọ̀lú, oògùn búburú la fi ń wò ó.
meaning: One matches the medicine to the disease.

proverbs: Bí eégún ó bàá wọlẹ̀, orò ní ń ṣe.
meaning: A person intending to do something extraordinary should give prior warning.

proverbs: Bí ẹlẹ́rẹ̀kẹ́ régérégé bá ro ẹjọ́-ọ tirẹ̀ tán, kó rántí pé ẹlẹ́rẹ̀kẹ́ mẹ́kí á rí rò.
meaning: The person who looks good owing to the efforts of his or her subordinates should remember that they also deserve some credit.

proverbs: Bí eré bí eré, àlàbọrùn-ún dẹ̀wù.
meaning: Imperceptibly, a stop-gap arrangement has become the status quo.)

proverbs: Bí igí bá wó lu igi, tòkè là ń kọ́ gbé.
meaning: One should attend to affairs according to their urgency.

proverbs: Bí ikún bá jẹ, bí ikún bá mu, ikún a wo oòrùn alẹ́ .
meaning: Whatever one does, one should mind the passing of time.

proverbs: Bí ilẹ̀ bá laná, ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ á fò gun igi.
meaning: If your position becomes untenable, seek refuge elsewhere.

proverbs: Bí ilú bá dá sí méjì, tọba ọ̀rún là ń ṣe.
meaning: If there is a division in one’s group, one takes the side God would favor.

proverbs: Bí iṣẹ́ kò pẹ́ ẹni, a kì í pẹ́ iṣẹ́ .
meaning: Tasks that are easy should be finished promptly.

proverbs: Bí kò bá tíì rẹ ìjà, a kì í là á.
meaning: One cannot end a fight that is not yet over.

proverbs: Bí kókó bá dáni, a kì í jẹ orí ìmàdò; bí a bá jẹ orí ìmàdò, a kì í lọ sí àwùjọ póńpó; bí a bá lọ sí àwùjọ póńpó, ìwọ̀n ara ẹni là ń mọ̀.
meaning: If unforeseen circumstances force one to engage in risky behavior, one should be that much more careful.

proverbs: Bí nǹkán bá tán nílẹ̀, ọmọ ẹbọ a bọ́ síjó, àwọn tó wà níbẹ̀ a múra àti lọ.
meaning: One should not hang around after one’s business is done.

proverbs: ‘‘Bí o bá já n ó so ọ́’’; kókó yó wà láàárín-in rẹ̀.
meaning: Something repaired is seldom the same as something unspoilt.

proverbs: Bí o kò gbọ́ Ègùn, o kò gbọ́ wọ̀yọ̀-wọ̀yọ̀?
meaning: One may not understand what a person says, but one will be able to tell that the person is speaking.

proverbs: Bí o máa ṣe aya Olúgbọ́n ṣe aya Olúgbọ́n; bí o máa ṣe aya Arẹsà ṣe aya Arẹsà, kí o yéé pákọ̀kọ̀ lẹ́gbẹ̀ẹ́ ògiri; ẹni tí yó ṣe aya Olúfẹ̀ a kógbá wálé.
meaning: Once one has chosen a course, one should commit oneself completely to it.

proverbs: Bí obìnrin ò bá gbé ilé tó méjì, kì í mọ èyí tó sàn.
meaning: Unless one has tasted some adversity, one does not appreciate good fortune.

proverbs: Bí ojú bá mó, olówò a gbówò; ọ̀rànwú a gbé kẹ́kẹ́ ; ajagun a gbé apata; àgbẹ̀ a jí tòun tòrúkọ́; ọmọ ọdẹ a jí tapó tọrán; ajíwẹṣẹ a bá odò omi lọ.
meaning: When morning comes, everybody should embark on something useful.

proverbs: Bí ojú bá rí ọ̀rọ̀, a wò ó fín.
meaning: Imperfect understanding causes difficulties.

proverbs: Bí ojú ọmọdé ò tó ìtàn, a bá àwígbọ́.
meaning: If one does not witness something, one learns from those who did.

proverbs: Bí olósùn-ún bá lọ osùn, ara-a rẹ̀ ní ń fi dánwò.
meaning: One tries a remedy on oneself before offering it to others.

proverbs: Bí òrìṣá bá mú ẹlẹ́hìn, kí abuké máa múra sílẹ̀.
meaning: If a person like you suffers a certain fate, you too are at risk.

proverbs: Bí òwe bí òwe là ńlùlù ògìdìgbó; ọlọgbọ́n ní ń jo; ọ̀mọ̀ràn ní ń sìí mọ̀ ọ́.
meaning: Only the wise can follow subtle discourses.

proverbs: Bí òwe bí òwe ni Ifá ń sọ̀rọ̀.
meaning: The most profound speech is indirect and subtle.

proverbs: Bí ọ̀bùn ò mọ èrè, a mọ ojú owó.
meaning: If a person cannot improve a matter, he should at least not worsen it.

proverbs: Bí ọkùnrín réjò, tóbìrín pa á, à ní kéjò má ṣáà lọ.
meaning: One should not be a stickler about roles.

proverbs: Bí ọlọgbọ́n bá ń fi wèrè se iṣu, ọ̀mọ̀ràn a máa fi gègé yàn án.
meaning: If a person tries to mislead you, find your own direction.

proverbs: Bí Ọlọ́run-ún bá ti fọ̀tá ẹni hanni, kò lè pani mọ́.
meaning: Knowledge neutralizes dangers.

proverbs: Bí ọmọ́ bá jágbọ́n-ọn kíké, ìyá-a rẹ̀ a jágbọ́n-ọn rírẹ̀ ẹ́ .
meaning: One must be ready to adapt to cope with any situation.

proverbs: Bí ọmọ́ bá jágbọ́n-ọn kíkú, ìyá rè a jágbọ́n-ọn sísin.
meaning: One should learn to meet wiles with wiles.

proverbs: Bí ọmọ́ bá yó, a fikùn han baba.
meaning: When one accomplishes one’s goals, one feels like celebrating. Also, one should show appreciation to one’s benefactor.

proverbs: Bí ọmọdé bá dúpẹ́ ore àná, a rí tòní gbà.
meaning: The grateful person encourages others to do him more favors.

proverbs: Bí ọmọdé bá ń bẹ́ igi, àgbàlagbà a máa wo ibi tí yóò wòó sí.
meaning: Unlike the youth, the elder is mindful of consequences.

proverbs: Bí ọmọdé bá mọ ayò, ẹyọ la ó fi pa á.
meaning: A precocious child may be almost but not quite as accomplished as an adult.

proverbs: Bí ọmọdé bá ṣubú a wo iwájú; bí àgbá bá ṣubú a wo ẹ̀hìn.
meaning: The youth is mindful of what his superiors think of him; the elder is mindful of what the young think of him.

proverbs: Bí ọmọdé kọ iyán àná, ìtàn la ó pa fún un.
meaning: A person who boycotts a meal or some entitlement simply deprives himself or herself of some benefits.

proverbs: Bí ọmọdé ò bá rí oko baba ẹlòmíràn, a ní kò sí oko baba ẹni tó tó ti baba òun.
meaning: Until one has seen other people’s great accomplishments, one is overly impressed by one’s own.

proverbs: Bí ọ̀rán bá pẹ́ nílẹ̀, gbígbọ́n ní ń gbọ́n.
meaning: If one keeps at it long enough, one will find the solution for any problem.

proverbs: Bí ọwọ́ ò bá ṣeé ṣán, à ká a lérí.
meaning: If one cannot do as one would, one does what one can.

proverbs: Bí sòbìyà yó bàá degbò, olúgambe là á wí fún.
meaning: When a problem arises, one must consult those who can solve it.

proverbs: Bí túlàsí bá di méjì, ọ̀kan làá mú.
meaning: Concentrate on one problem at a time.

proverbs: ‘‘Bùn mi níṣu kan’’ kì í ṣáájú ‘‘Ẹ kú oko òo.’’
meaning: One does not ask a favor of or transact any business with any person without first exchanging pleasantries.

proverbs: Dà-á-sílẹ̀-ká-tun-pín, ogún ijọ́un, a ò pín in re.
meaning: Whatever needs to be done again must not have been done well the first time.

proverbs: Dídì ní ń mú abẹ mú.
meaning: Only by taking great care of them does one keep one’s possessions in good shape.

proverbs: Díẹ̀-díẹ̀ nimú ẹlẹ́dẹ̀ fi ń wọgbà.
meaning: A small problem, if not attended to, becomes unmanageable.

proverbs: DÍfá-dÍfá ò fIfá ṣeré.
meaning: One should not be careless about one’s livelihood.

proverbs: Dùgbẹ̀-dùgbẹ̀ kì í fi ẹyin-in rẹ̀ sílẹ̀.
meaning: One does not turn one’s back on one’s treasure.

proverbs: Dúró o kíkà; bí o ò dúró kíkà, ìkà a ba tìrẹ jẹ́ .
meaning: One’s best defense against wicked people is ingratiation.

proverbs: Ebi ń pa mí ọlọ́ṣẹ ń kiri; ìgbà tí n ò wẹnú n ó ṣe wẹ̀de?
meaning: One must order one’s priorities sensibly.

proverbs: Ebi ò pàJèṣà ó lóun ò jẹ̀kọ Ọ̀yọ́; ebí pa ọmọ Obòkun ó jẹ ori.
meaning: It is when one is not desperate that one is choosy.

proverbs: Ebi ò pàmọ̀le ó ní òun ò jẹ àáyá; ebí pa Súlè ó jọ̀bọ.
meaning: A desperate person is seldom finicky.

proverbs: Eégún Ẹ̀gbá, Ẹ̀gbá ní ń fọ̀.
meaning: One should speak to others in a manner that is fitting and that will facilitate one’s business with them.

proverbs: Eégún tí yó gbeni là ń dáṣọ fún; òrìṣà tí yó gbeni là ń sìn; bi igí bá gbè mí mà kó obì mà bọ igi.
meaning: One should confine one’s efforts to profitable ventures and one’s service to appreciative people.

proverbs: Eégún tí yó ṣe bíi Lébé, Lébé ni yó dà; èyí tí yó tàkìtì bí Olúfolé, òfurugbàdà ni yó ta á.
meaning: One must prepare oneself and gather one’s resources before one attempts momentous tasks.

proverbs: Ejò-ó rí ihò tó há ó kó wọ̀ ọ́; ìyá-a rẹ̀-ẹ́ lọ́wọ́ àti fà á yọ?
meaning: One had better be certain to be able to extricate oneself before venturing into tight spots.

proverbs: Elékuru kì í kiri lóko.
meaning: One wastes time attempting to sell things to those who produce them.

proverbs: Èló là ń ra adìẹ òkókó, tí à ń gba ọmọ-ọ rẹ̀ sìn?
meaning: Certain obligations are not worth the trouble.

proverbs: Èmi ò níí fẹ́ obìnrin tẹ́nìkan ń fẹ́, olúwarẹ̀ ò níí fẹ́ obìnrin ni.
meaning: A person who wants exclusive rights to a woman—or anything—will look for a long time and in vain.

proverbs: Èmi ò níí ṣu imí le imí, olúwarẹ̀ ó rìn jìnnà ààtàn.
meaning: People who are too finicky will pay in effort and delay for their habits.

proverbs: Èpè la fi ń wo èpè sàn.
meaning: One matches the remedy to the affliction.

proverbs: Epo ló ṣeé jẹṣu; àkàsọ̀ ló ṣeé gun àká; obìnrín dùn-ún bá sùn ju ọkùnrin lọ.
meaning: Certain things are fit for certain purposes; not just anything will do anytime.

proverbs: Epo lojú ọbẹ̀.
meaning: One should be particularly attentive to that one ingredient or thing whose absence mars the entire project.

proverbs: Eré là ń fọmọ ayò ṣe.
meaning: One should take time for pleasure when one may.

proverbs: Èrò kì í mọ ibùsọ̀ kọ́rùn ó wọ̀ ọ́.
meaning: One should measure one’s exertions to suit one’s capacity.

proverbs: Ète lẹ̀gbọ́n; ìmọ̀ràn làbúrò; bí-a-ó-ti-ṣe lẹ̀kẹta wọn.
meaning: First there is the goal, then a contemplation of it, and finally a plan for attaining it.

proverbs: Ètò lòfin kìn-ín-ní lóde ọ̀run.
meaning: Whatever one does, one must be orderly.

proverbs: Ewúrẹ́ ò ṣe-e fiṣu ṣọ́.
meaning: Do not entrust your affairs to your enemy.

proverbs: Èyí tó yẹ ará iwájú, èrò ẹ̀hìn fiyè sílẹ̀.
meaning: Learn from the examples of others.

proverbs: Ẹ̀bẹ̀ là ń bẹ òṣìkà pé kó tún ìlú-u rẹ̀ ṣe.
meaning: Gentle pleas are the only likely means of getting contrary people to do what is right.

proverbs: Ẹbọ díẹ̀, oògùn díẹ̀, ní ń gba aláìkú là.
meaning: One should not place all one’s faith in a single solution to a problem.

proverbs: Ẹbọ ẹnìkan là ń fi ẹnìkan rú.
meaning: Extraordinary problems demand extraordinary solutions.

proverbs: Ẹ̀ẹ̀kan lejò ń yánni.
meaning: The same disaster does not befall one more than once; after the first time one learns to avoid it.

proverbs: Ẹ̀fẹ́-ẹ́ dẹ̀fẹ̀ iyán; a paláwẹ́ ẹ̀kọ baálé ilé ní ẹ̀ ń pèun bí?
meaning: A person who wants something badly will not let a little teasing put him or her off taking it.

proverbs: Ẹ̀fẹ́-ẹ́ dẹ̀fẹ̀ iyán; ò báà gbémi lulẹ̀ n ó bàá ọ jẹun.
meaning: No amount of teasing will stop me from doing what I have in mind.

proverbs: Ẹgbẹ́ ẹni kì í wọ́n láyé ká wá a lọ sọ́run.
meaning: If one cannot find what one wants, one should learn to do without it.

proverbs: Ẹjọ́ a-f ni-lóbìnrin là ń wí; a kì í wíjọ́ a-f ni-lómọ.
meaning: One should not pursue causes without good grounds.

proverbs: Ẹlẹ́dẹ̀ẹ́ ní ọjọ́ tí òun ti jágbọ́n-ọn hùn, ọjọ́ náà ni ọ̀rọ̀ ò ti nìun lára mọ́.
meaning: A person who says nothing seldom gets in trouble.

proverbs: Ẹlẹ́jọ́ ṣa èyí tó wù ú wí.
meaning: One should concentrate on one’s most pressing problems.

proverbs: Ẹlẹ́nu-ú tóó rí sá.
meaning: Be wary of loquacious people.

proverbs: Ẹni à ń wò kì í wòran.
meaning: One should not ignore one’s problems to dwell on those of others.

proverbs: Ẹni a óò gbé òkú-u rẹ̀ sin, a kì í sọ pé ó ń rùn pani.
meaning: One should not run down a person or thing that will eventually devolve to one’s care.

proverbs: Ẹni a pé kó wáá wo kọ̀bì: ó ní kí nìyí kọ́bi-kọ̀bi?
meaning: One should not waste one’s breath expressing the obvious.

proverbs: Ẹni a wí fún ko gbọ́; ẹni a fọ̀ fún kó gbà; èyí tí ò gbọ́ yó filẹ̀ bora.
meaning: Refusal to heed advice can be deadly.

proverbs: Ẹni àìgbọ́n pa ló pọ̀; ẹni ọgbọ́n pa ò tó nǹkan.
meaning: Few things kill more surely than folly.

proverbs: Ẹní bá ríkun nímú ọlọ́jà ní ń fọn ọ́n.
meaning: Tactless or indiscreet people usually rue their bad judgment.

proverbs: Ẹní bá tó ẹni-í gbà là ń ké pè.
meaning: Do not seek the aid of feckless people.

proverbs: Ẹní du ara-a rẹ̀ lóyè Apènà: kó tó jẹ ẹran ọ̀f , ó dọ̀run.
meaning: If one does not grab opportunities when they present themselves, one is in for a difficult life.

proverbs: Ẹní gbọ́n juni lọ ní ń tẹni nÍfá.
meaning: Take advice only from those qualified to offer it.

proverbs: Ẹní léku méjì á pòfo.
meaning: One who pursues two or more objectives at once is likely to achieve neither.

proverbs: Ẹní máa ké ìbòsí á pa baba-a rẹ̀ jẹ.
meaning: Whoever acts without cause will have to justify his action by manufacturing a cause.

proverbs: Ẹní rúbọ òrìṣà-á gbọ́dọ̀ rú ti èèyàn kí ẹbọ-ọ́ tó gbà.
meaning: One can please the gods and yet run afoul of humans.

proverbs: Ẹni tí a bá fi orí-i rẹ̀ fọ́ àgbọn ò níí jẹ níbẹ̀.
meaning: Whoever takes foolhardy risks in pursuit of an end seldom lives to enjoy it.

proverbs: Ẹni tí a bá ń bá nájà là ń wò, a kì í wo ariwo ọjà.
meaning: One should keep mind on one’s business and leave extraneous matters aside.

proverbs: Ẹni tí a wífún kó gbọ́; ẹni tí kò gbọ́, tara-a rẹ̀ ni yó dà.
meaning: Those who refuse instruction lay the foundation for their own ruin.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ẹ̀gún gún lẹ́sẹ̀ ní ń ṣe lákáǹláká tẹ̀lé alábẹ́rẹ́ .
meaning: The person in need of help should make some effort in his own behalf and not expect the helper to make all the necessary effort.

proverbs: Ẹni tí kò gbọ́n lààwẹ̀ ń gbò.
meaning: The resourceful person can find a way around any difficulty.

proverbs: Ẹni tí kò mọ iṣẹ́-ẹ́ jẹ́ ní ń pààrà lẹ́ẹ̀mejì.
meaning: One saves time and effort by doing things right the first time.

proverbs: Ẹni tí kò mọ ọba ní ń fọba ṣeré.
meaning: The wise person recognizes potential danger and avoids it.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ó lè jà ni yóò kúnlẹ̀ kalẹ́ .
meaning: The person who cannot stay out of a fight will spend his or her time incessantly stating cases.

proverbs: Ẹni tí yó bọ Ògún, yó ra ọjà-a tirẹ̀ lọ́tọ̀.
meaning: If one’s priorities are incompatible with those of others, one parts company with them.

proverbs: Ẹni tí yó fò yó bẹ̀rẹ̀.
meaning: One must make adequate preparations for any project.

proverbs: Ẹni tí yó mu ẹ̀kọ fòrò, yó bàá ọmọ ẹlẹ́kọ ṣeré.
meaning: One must ingratiate oneself with the person from whom one expects a favor.

proverbs: Ẹni tí yó mu ẹ̀kọ ọ̀fẹ́ yó bàá ọmọ ẹlẹ́kọ ṣeré.
meaning: Nothing comes free.

proverbs: Ẹni tí yó ṣòwò àlè, ẹní-i rẹ̀ ní ń ká; ẹni tí yó ṣòwò-o Ṣàngó, ààjà-a rẹ̀ ní ń rà.
meaning: One prepares according to what is proper for one’s chosen trade.

proverbs: Ẹni tí yó yàáni lówó, tí kò níí sinni, ohùn ẹnu-u rẹ̀ la ti ń mọ̀.
meaning: The way people talk is a good indication of their character.

proverbs: Ẹni tó bá da omi síwájú á tẹ ilẹ̀ tútù.
meaning: The future will look kindly on those who look well to the future.

proverbs: Ẹni tó bá fi ojù àná wòkú, ẹbọra a bọ́ ọ láṣọ.
meaning: One behaves toward people according to the heights they have attained, not according to the way they used to be.

proverbs: Ẹni tó bá máa jẹ ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ a jẹ èyí tó lẹ́yin.
meaning: If one must suffer, one might as well do so with panache.

proverbs: Ẹni tó bá máa lu òṣùgbó a lu ńlá; kékeré ẹgbẹ̀fà, ńlá ẹgbẹ̀fà.
meaning: If the penalty for a small offense is the same as that for a grievous one, one might as well throw all caution to the wind.

proverbs: Ẹni tó bá máa mú ọ̀bọ a ṣe bí ọ̀bọ.
meaning: To succeed against an adversary, or with a person one desires, one must suit one’s approach to the other’s ways.

proverbs: Ẹni tó bá mọ ìdí ọ̀ràn tẹ́lẹ̀ ní ń bu àbùjá èké.
meaning: Prior knowledge is the surest weapon against lies.

proverbs: Ẹni tó bá ní igbà-á lò, bí igbà-á bá já, kó dúró so ó.
meaning: One must make time to attend to necessary chores.

proverbs: Ẹni tó bá pẹ́ lórí imí, eṣinṣin kéṣinṣin yó ò bá a níbẹ̀.
meaning: Nothing good comes of dawdling over what one must do.

proverbs: Ẹni tó bá rántí Efuji, kó má fi ore ṣe ẹṣin.
meaning: Remember those who have caused you injury and remember to show them no favor.

proverbs: Ẹni tó bá rántí ọjọ́ ní ń ṣe ọmọ òkú pẹ̀lẹ́ ; ta ní jẹ́ ṣe ọmọ eégún lóore?
meaning: When a good person dies, the survivors inherit the good will of those who remember him or her well.

proverbs: Ẹni tó bá sọ pé ẹsẹ̀ eégún ń hàn ní ń wá abẹ́rẹ́ lọ.
meaning: Some sights the eyes must not acknowledge seeing.

proverbs: Ẹni tó bá yá ìwọ̀fà ẹgbàá, tòun tirẹ̀ ní ńlọ ata kúnná.
meaning: Whatever comes too cheaply is sure to work unsatisfactorily.

proverbs: Ẹni tó dùbúlẹ̀-ẹ́ ṣe oògùn ìjàkadì tán.
meaning: The wise person forestalls problems.

proverbs: Ẹni tó fi irun dúdú ṣeré, yó fi funfun sin ẹniẹlẹ́ni.
meaning: If one wastes one’s youth, one spends one’s old age struggling for a living.

proverbs: Ẹni tó fi owó-o rẹ̀ ra ẹṣin, kò níí jẹ́ kó ṣe àrìnjẹ́ .
meaning: One guards one’s treasures jealously.

proverbs: Ẹni tó gbajúmọ̀ tí kò mọ èèyàn-án kí, òun òbúrẹ́wà ẹgbẹ́ra.
meaning: Good looks without the social graces amount to nothing.

proverbs: Ẹni tó máa t òkú ọ̀pọ̀lọ́, yó nìí ilé ògbóni tirẹ̀ lọ́tọ̀.
meaning: Whoever wishes to do the absurd should not expect the cooperation or approval of others.

proverbs: Ẹni tó máa yáni lẹ́wù, ti ọrùn-un rẹ̀ là ń wò.
meaning: One should be discriminating about those from whom to accept favors.

proverbs: Ẹni tó mi kùkùté, ara-a rẹ̀ ní ń mì.
meaning: Whoever takes on an invincible adversary fashions his or her own defeat.

proverbs: Ẹni tó mọ ẹtu ní ń kì í ní ‘‘òbèjé, ẹlẹ́sẹ̀ ọwọ̀.
meaning: Only those deeply involved in a profession are versed in its jargon.

proverbs: Ẹni tó ńṣáp fún wèrè jó, òun àti wèrè ọ̀kan-ùn.
meaning: Whoever joins the imbecile’s games is himself or herself an imbecile.

proverbs: Ẹni tó pa kẹ́tẹ́kẹ́tẹ́ yó ru káyá ẹrù.
meaning: Whoever is careless with his or her resources will pay dearly in the future.

proverbs: Ẹni tó ránṣẹ́ sí orò-ó bẹ̀wẹ̀ fún àìsùn.
meaning: (Whoever deliberately provokes trouble should be prepared for a difficult time.

proverbs: Ẹni tó re Ìbàdán tí kò dé ilé Olúyọ̀lé, oko igi ló lọ.
meaning: Whoever misses the principal sight of any place might as well not have visited the place at all.

proverbs: Ẹni tó rúbọ tí kò gba èèwọ̀, bí ẹni tó fi owó ẹbọ ṣòfò ni.
meaning: A person who knows the remedy but does not apply it is as badly off as the person who does not know the remedy at all.

proverbs: Ẹni tó sọ ẹlẹ́dẹ̀ lékùrọ́, oúnjẹ ló fún un.
meaning: One does not douse a fire by throwing oil on it.

proverbs: Ẹni tó torí òtútù fi ọmọrí odó yáná ò gbọdọ̀ retí a-ti-jẹyán.
meaning: One should not jeopardize one’s longterm interests by indulging in immediate gratifications.

proverbs: Ẹnu àìm nu, ètè àìmétè, ní ń mú ọ̀ràn bá ẹ̀rẹ̀kẹ́ .
meaning: The words that the mouth and lips allow to escape usually bring the slap to the cheek; a person who cannot keep his or her mouth shut often lands in trouble.

proverbs: Ẹnu ehoro ò gba ìjánu.
meaning: Do not adopt an inappropriate remedy for a problem.

proverbs: Ẹ̀rẹ̀kẹ́ ni ilé ẹ̀rín.
meaning: Suit the means to the project.

proverbs: Ẹ̀rù bíbà ní múni pe àjẹ́ ní ará ire.
meaning: It is wise to curry the favor of fearful or malicious people.

proverbs: Ẹrù-u hòo kì í wọni lọ́rùn.
meaning: Saying one agrees, even when one does not, spares one a great deal of headache.

proverbs: Ẹ̀sín alátọ̀sí ò sí lọ́wọ́ òkóbó.
meaning: Do not ridicule a person whose condition is no worse than yours.

proverbs: Ẹyẹ igbó kì í mọ fífò ọ̀dàn.
meaning: In a strange environment, one becomes a dunce.

proverbs: Ẹyẹ ń wá àtifò, wọ́ ń sọ òkò sí i.
meaning: One needs little encouragement to do what one is determined to do anyway; being forced to do what one wishes to do anyway is no punishment.

proverbs: Fi ìjà fún Ọlọ́run jà; fọwọ́ lérán.
meaning: Leave those who have injured one to God’s judgment and punishment.

proverbs: Fimí-pamọ́-kí-n pa-ọ́ làrùn ń jẹ́ .
meaning: A concealed disease is a deadly thing.

proverbs: ‘‘Gba ọmọ fún mi kí n rèdí’’; bí ìdí ò bá ṣe-é re ká gbọ́mọ fọ́lọ́mọ. ‘
meaning: One should not place oneself in difficulty in order to help others out of difficulty.

proverbs: Gbogbo ẹranko ìgbẹ́ pé, wọn ní àwọn ó fi ìkokò ṣe aṣípa; nígbà tó gbọ́ inú ẹ̀-ẹ́ dùn; ṣùgbọ́n nígbà tó ṣe ó bú sẹ́kún; wọ́n ní kí ló dé? Ó ní bóyá wọ́n lè tún ọ̀ràn náà rò kí wọ́n ní kì í ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀ mọ́.
meaning: Some people can be relied upon to find the sad aspect of the most fortunate event.

proverbs: Ìbéèrè kì í jẹ́ kí ẹni ó ṣìnà; ẹni tí kò lè béèrè ní ń pón ara rẹ̀ lójú.
meaning: One should not be too obstinate or too proud to seek help when one needs it.

proverbs: Ibi tí a bá ń gbé la ti ń gbàwìn; à-rà-àì-san ni ò sunwọ̀n.
meaning: There is nothing wrong in seeking favors from those close to one; what is bad is not returning favors.

proverbs: Ibi tí a gbé epo sí a kì í sọ òkò síbẹ̀.
meaning: One should always protect one’s base or where one’s best interests lie.

proverbs: Ibi tí à ń gbé là ń ṣe; bí a bá dé ìlú adẹ́tẹ̀ à di ìkúùkù.
meaning: While in Rome, do as the Romans do.

proverbs: Ibi tí a ti gùn, ibẹ̀ la ti ń rọ̀.
meaning: One must not shift the problems originating in one context to another, unrelated context.

proverbs: Ibi tí a ti ń jẹun bí ikun bí ikun, a kì í sọ̀rọ̀ bíi kẹ̀lẹ̀bẹ̀ bíi kẹ̀lẹ̀bẹ̀ níbẹ̀.
meaning: One must be careful not to bring up matters that are too sensitive for present company.

proverbs: Ibi tí o máa sùn lo tẹ́ ọmọ sí.
meaning: Said of a person deceiving himself or herself in the futile hope that a transparent ruse will work to his or her advantage.

proverbs: Ibi tí òjò-ó ti ńpa igún bọ̀-ọ́ jìnnà; ta ní rán igún níṣẹ́?
meaning: If one’s choices land one in difficulty, one should not blame others.

proverbs: Ibi tí òjò-ó bá ọjọ́ ní ń pa á sí.
meaning: One should do what one has to do as the opportunities present themselves.

proverbs: Ibi tí oníyọ̀nmọ̀ntìí ṣubú sí, ibẹ̀ ló ti tà á tán.
meaning: It makes no sense to dwell on unrecoverable disasters.

proverbs: Ibi tí oyín gbé ń hó, tí àdó ń hó, ìfun ò dákẹ́ lásán.
meaning: No matter what other people’s preoccupations are, one should not ignore one’s own problems.

proverbs: Ìdí òwò ni òwòó gbé tà.
meaning: One would be wise to protect one’s base.

proverbs: Igún ṣoore ó pá lórí, àkàlà-á ṣoore ó yọ gẹ̀gẹ̀; nítorí ọjọ́ mìíràn kẹni ó má ṣe oore bẹ́ẹ̀ mọ́.
meaning: In the future, one should not do those kinds of favors.

proverbs: Igúnnugún ò torí abẹ párí.
meaning: One’s actions are not determined by one’s fear of any person.

proverbs: Ìgbà ara là ń búra.
meaning: Everything in its proper time.

proverbs: Igbá là ń pa, a kì í pa àwo.
meaning: What is appropriate treatment for one thing may be inappropriate for another.

proverbs: Ìgbà òjò ń lọ, ìgbà ẹ̀rùn ń lọ, a ní ká dí isà eku kó le; ìgbà wo la óò tó wá peku náà?
meaning: One must do what needs to be done while there is still time rather than resort to transparent temporizing ruses.

proverbs: Ìgbà tí a bá dóko làárọ̀ ẹni.
meaning: People must not be slaves of time but use time to their own advantage.

proverbs: Ìgbà tí a bá rẹ́ni lòwúrọ̀ ẹni.
meaning: One does what one has to do when it is convenient to do it.

proverbs: Igbá tó gbédè là ń pè lóṣùwọ̀n.
meaning: One places one’s confidence only in those of the same mind.

proverbs: Ìgbín ìbá má mọ̀-ọ́ jẹ̀ ìbá ti kú síjù.
meaning: However disadvantaged one might be, one could still thrive if one took life easy.

proverbs: Ìgbín ìbá má mọ̀-ọ́ jẹ̀ kò tó okòó.
meaning: With caution, one can offset the effects of any handicap

proverbs: Ìgbín kì í pilẹ̀ aró, àfè ìmòjò kì í pilẹ̀ àràn.
meaning: One should stick to habits that are proper for oneself.

proverbs: Igbó lẹranko ń gbé.
meaning: Everything in its proper place.

proverbs: Ìgbọ̀nwọ́ ti kékeré yọké.
meaning: Said of a precocious person.

proverbs: Ìjà ní ń pa onítìjú; ogun ní ń pa alágbára.
meaning: One should not court danger or disaster simply to avoid losing face.

proverbs: Ijó ní ń bọ́ṣọ, ìjà ní ń bọ́ ẹ̀wù.
meaning: Different situations call for different responses.

proverbs: Ikúdú pa ẹṣin à ń yọ̀; ó ń bọ̀ wá pa ọmọ èèyàn.
meaning: We should take other people’s misfortunes as a reminder that we are not immune to such misfortunes.

proverbs: Ilé ajá là ń wá ìwo lọ?
meaning: One should not bark up the wrong tree.

proverbs: Ilé olóńjẹ là ń dẹ̀bìtì àyà sí.
meaning: People usually position themselves where they imagine there is something to gain.

proverbs: Ilẹ̀ nìjòkò ń jókòó de ìdí.
meaning: One should maintain one’s place and not, for example, go out of the house to receive a visitor.

proverbs: Ìlẹ̀kẹ̀ àmúyọ, a kì í sin kádìí tán.
meaning: One should not deploy all one’s resources at once.

proverbs: Ìloro là ń wọ̀ ká tó wọlé.
meaning: Everything in its proper order.

proverbs: Ìlọ-ọ́ yá; oníbodè Atàdí, wọ́n kó o nílé, wọ́n gbà á lóbìnrin, ọ̀pẹ̀lẹ̀ tó ní òun ó fi wádìí ọ̀ràn, ajá gbé e, ọmọ ẹ̀ tó lé ajá láti gba ọ̀pẹ̀lẹ̀, ó yí sí kàǹga; oníbodè Atàdí wá dáhùn ó ní, ‘‘Ìlọ-ọ́ yá.’’ It is time to get out of here; the gatekeeper of Atadi, his home was burglarized; his wife was
meaning: When a place becomes too hot for a person, he or she should know it is time to get out.

proverbs: Iná èsìsì kì í jóni lẹ́ẹ̀mejì.
meaning: One should learn a lesson from the first bad experience.

proverbs: Iná kúkú ni yó ba ọbẹ̀ ará oko jẹ́ .
meaning: An ignorant person’s ignorance will ruin whatever venture he or she embarks on.

proverbs: Iná tó ń lérí omi á kù sọnù.
meaning: It is foolhardy to take on a power one is no match for.

proverbs: Ìpàṣán tí a fi na ìyálé ń bẹ láàjà fún ìyàwó.
meaning: Do not assume that the misfortune that befell those who went before will pass you over.

proverbs: Ìròrẹ́ ò le-è jà ó múlé ti agbọ́n.
meaning: If one is weak, one should befriend the strong.

proverbs: Isó inú ẹ̀kú, à-rá-mọ́ra.
meaning: The insult one cannot escape from, one has to endure.

proverbs: Ìṣeǹṣe ewúrẹ́, kágùntàn fiyè sí i.
meaning: One should learn from the fates of others.

proverbs: Iṣú ta iṣu ò ta, ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan là ń wúṣu lébè.
meaning: There is no task so small or insignificant that it does not deserve care and attention.

proverbs: Ìtórò tó so lóko tí kò fẹ̀hìntì, afẹ́fẹ́ oko ní ń tú u.
meaning: A weak person who has no support will fall victim to puny forces.

proverbs: Ìwò-o ọlọgbọ́n ò jọ ti aṣiwèrè.
meaning: A wise person considers matters in a more rational way than an imbecile does.

proverbs: Ìyàwó mi ò sunwọ̀; nítorí ọmọ ni mo ṣe fẹ́ ẹ; ẹni mélòó la ó wìí fún tán?
meaning: One should not embark on the endless and futile task of justifying one’s decisions to others.

proverbs: Ìyàwó sọ ọ̀rọ̀ kan tán: ó ní ìyálé òun a-bẹnu-funfun-bí-ègbodò.
meaning: Said of people who have done the unthinkable.

proverbs: Ìyàwó ṣe ọ̀ràn kan tán; ọkọ ẹ̀-ẹ́ ṣe ọ̀ràn-an n kò-jẹ-mọ́.
meaning: Said of people who have caused unpardonable offense.

proverbs: ‘‘Já ilé ẹ kí n bá ẹ kọ́ ọ’’; ìt èèkàn kan ní ń fúnni.
meaning: One relies on other people’s promise of help only at one’s own risk.

proverbs: Jùrù-fẹ̀fẹ̀ jùrù-fẹ̀fẹ̀, ewúrẹ́ wọ ilé àpọn jùrù-fẹ̀fẹ̀; kí làpọ́n rí jẹ tí yó kù sílẹ̀ féwúrẹ́ ?
meaning: One wastes time expecting largesse from a destitute person.

proverbs: Kàkà kí ọmọdé pàgbà láyò, àgbà a fi ọgbọ́n àgbà gbé e.
meaning: An elder should save face and protect his standing by all means available.

proverbs: Kékeré egbò ní ń gba ewé iyá; àgbà egbò ní ń gba ẹ̀gbẹ̀sì; tilé-wà-tọ̀nà-wá egbò ní ń gba ìgàn aṣọ.
meaning: Remedies must fit the complaint.

proverbs: Kéré-kéré leku ń jawọ; díẹ̀-díẹ̀ leèrà ń bọ̀ ìyẹ́ .
meaning: Use caution in all enterprises.

proverbs: Kì í jẹ́ kí etí ẹni di kì í jẹ́ kí inú ẹni dùn.
meaning: Learn to turn a deaf ear to certain things for the sake of your peace of mind.

proverbs: Kì í ṣe gbogbo ẹni tí ń ṣe ‘‘Ẹni Ọlọ́run bùn ó bùn mi’’ là ń fún ní nǹkan.
meaning: One should be judicious as to those to whom one shows kindness.

proverbs: Kí ni à ń wọ̀ nínú-u ṣòkòtò m ta ọ̀ọ́dúnrún?
meaning: Much ado about a worthless thing.

proverbs: Kí ni fìlà yó ṣe lórí ògógó? Ata ni yó ṣi.
meaning: Superfluous adornments make no sense when one goes to battle or engages in strenuous work.

proverbs: Kí ni ìyá aláṣọ ń tà tó yọ ẹgba lọ́wọ́? Ewúrẹ́ ń jẹ wúlìnì?
meaning: One should not engage in meaningless or unnecessary activities.

proverbs: Kíkọ́ ni mímọ̀, òwe àjàpá.
meaning: To know, one must learn.

proverbs: Kò sí aláásáà tí ń ta ìgbokú; gbogbo wọn ní ń ta oyin.
meaning: Everybody presents himself or herself in the best light.

proverbs: Kò sí alámàlà tí ń sọ pé tòun ò yi; aládàlú nìkan ló sòótọ́.
meaning: One puts the best face on one’s own affairs.

proverbs: Kò sí ẹni tí kò mọ ọgbọ́n-ọn ká fẹran sẹ́nu ká wá a tì.
meaning: Nobody is a complete fool.

proverbs: Kókó ló kọ́kọ́ dé orí, tàbí orí ló kọ́kọ́ dé kókó?
meaning: A chastisement for someone attempting to reverse the order of precedence.

proverbs: Kóńkólóyo: èyí tó ní tèmi.
meaning: However small it is [usually a child], one is glad to have it.

proverbs: Kóró-kóró là ń dá Ifá adití.
meaning: One should match one’s actions to the circumstances. Or, one should err on the side of repetitiousness in cautioning an obstinate person.

proverbs: ‘‘Kùbẹ̀rẹ̀, ká roko ìpére.’’ Ó ní èyí tí òún lọ òun òì bọ̀. ‘
meaning: When one has not recovered from the consequences of a venture, one is not ready to embark on another.)

proverbs: Lójú òpè, bí-i kọ́lọgbọ́n dàbí ọ̀lẹ.
meaning: The worthless person always wishes others were equally worthless.

proverbs: ‘‘Máa jẹ́ ǹ ṣó’’ lọ̀yá fi ń ju ẹmọ́ lọ.
meaning: Excessive consideration for others can be disadvantageous.

proverbs: ‘‘Màá kó ẹrú, màá kó ẹrù’’ là ń bá lọ sógun; ọ̀nà lẹnìkẹta ń báni.
meaning: Too often one is so preoccupied with the good aspects of a proposition that the bad aspects sneak up on one.

proverbs: Màjèṣín dóbò àkọ́kọ́, ó sáré yọ okó síta, ó ní Olúwa-á ṣeun.
meaning: A novice knows not how to relish good things.

proverbs: Mójú-kúrò nilé ayé gbà; gbogbo ọ̀rọ̀ kọ́ ló ṣéé bínú sí.
meaning: The best way to live is to ignore petty annoyances.

proverbs: Ní ìlú tí a ò ti f ẹyẹlé, adìẹ yóò ṣọ̀wọ́n níbẹ̀.
meaning: Onerous things will not be countenanced where easy obligations are not.

proverbs: Ní ìlú tí a ò ti f ẹyẹlé, tí a ò f adìẹ, irú ẹyẹ wo ní yóò jí wọn lójú orun?
meaning: A person who will not be pleased by anything will simply have to do without everything.

proverbs: Ní inú Ifá ni Fá-túmọ̀-ọ́ wà.
meaning: Every problem bears the seeds to its own solution.

proverbs: ‘‘Níbo ló gbé wà?’’ nìyájú ẹkùn.
meaning: One should be smart enough to hide one’s ignorance about things one should know.

proverbs: Nígbà tí ọwọ́ ò tí ì gbọ́n lojú ń ṣepin.
meaning: A wise person will know how to manage and conceal his shortcomings.

proverbs: Nítorí adití lòjó fi ń ṣú; nítorí afọ́jú ló ṣe ń kù.
meaning: The wise person should be able to read portents and take precautions.

proverbs: Nítorí èèyàn la ṣe ń ní ọwọ́ ọ̀tún; òsì là bá lò.
meaning: One must learn the grace that is appropriate for decent company.

proverbs: Nítorí-i ká lè ríbi gbé e la ṣe ń ṣe ọyàn sódó.
meaning: One should anticipate problems and prepare solutions for them.

proverbs: Ó di kan-nu-rin kan-nu-rin, agogo Ògúntólú.
meaning: The statements being made are senseless.

proverbs: O fẹ́ joyè o ní o-ò ní-í jà.
meaning: It is self-deceit to wish for something without being prepared for the struggle that getting it demands.

proverbs: O fi awọ ẹkùn ṣẹbọ àìkú; ẹkùn ìbá má kùú ìwọ ìbá rawọ ẹ̀ ṣoògùn?
meaning: One should not chase impossible dreams.

proverbs: O jó nÍfọ́n Ifọ́n tú; o jó lÉjìgbò Èjìgbó fàya bí aṣọ; o wá dé Ìlá ràngún ò ńkàndí; gbogbo ìlú òrìṣà ni wọ́n ní kí o máa bàj kiri?
meaning: A person who has the reputation for causing disasters should not be given freedom of action anywhere.

proverbs: O kò bá ìṣín máwo, o ò bá ìrókò mulẹ̀; abẹ́rẹ́ ẹ-ẹ́ bọ́ sómi o ní o ó yọ ọ́.
meaning: Unless one has superhuman powers, one should not attempt the impossible.

proverbs: O kò bá òkun máwo, o ò bá ọ̀sà mulẹ̀; abẹ́rẹ́ ẹ-ẹ́ bọ́ sódò o ní o ó yọ ọ́.
meaning: Unless one has extraordinary means, one should not attempt the impossible.

proverbs: O kò bá Ọya máwo, o ò bá Ògún mulẹ̀; abẹ́rẹ́ ẹ-ẹ́ bọ́ sódò o ní o ó yọ ọ́.
meaning: One should not embark on missions for which one has not made adequate preparations.

proverbs: O kò lu òmìrán lóru, ò ń lù ú lọ́sàn-án.
meaning: One should court trouble only if and when one has some cover.

proverbs: O kò wọ bàtà nínú ẹ̀gún ò ń sáré; o lágbára màlúù?
meaning: Unless one is well fortified, one should not court danger.

proverbs: O kò-ì mú ẹrú, o ní Àdó ni ò ó tà á fún.
meaning: One should not use a commodity before one has it.

proverbs: O ló-o fẹ́ jọba o ní o-ò nìí ṣÒgbóni, o-ò níí pẹ́ lóyè.
meaning: Whoever wishes to prosper must observe the conditions for prosperity.

proverbs: Ò ń bẹ oníṣègùn, o ò bẹ asínwín; bí oníṣègùn-ún ṣe tí asínwín ò gbà ńkọ́?
meaning: When two steps are required to accomplish a purpose, one should not take one and slight the other.

proverbs: ‘‘Ó ń bọ̀, ó ń bọ̀!’’ la fi ń dẹ́rù ba ọmọdé; bó bá dé tán ẹ̀rù a tán.
meaning: Looming problems often cause consternation out of all proportion to their real damaging force.

proverbs: O ní kí ará ọ̀run ṣe oore fún ọ, bẹ́ẹ̀ni o rí ẹni tí eégún ń lé, tó fá lọ́bẹ̀ lá.
meaning: One should not expect to receive better treatment from a person who is known to be vicious to others.

proverbs: Ó ń ti ilé bọ̀ kò ra ẹ̀gbẹ; ó dé oko tán ó ní ẹ̀gbẹ ni oníkú ẹ̀kọ.
meaning: One should make provisions against one’s future needs.

proverbs: O rí etí adẹ́tẹ̀ o fi san okòó; kò nípọn tó ni, tàbí kò rẹ̀ dẹ̀dẹ̀ tọ́? Y
meaning: Said of someone who applies the wrong value to things.

proverbs: O rí ẹsẹ̀-ẹ wèrè o ò bù ú ṣoògùn; níbo lo ti máa rí tọlọgbọ́n?
meaning: One should take advantage of the weak and vulnerable, because one will not be able to take advantage of the strong.

proverbs: O rojọ́ láàárọ̀ o ò jàre, ó dal o ní kọ́ba dúró gbọ́ tẹnu ẹ; ohun tó o wí láàárọ̀ náà kọ́ lo máa wí lálẹ́ ?
meaning: Repeated stating will not make a bad case a good one.

proverbs: O sá fún ikú, o bọ́ sí àkọ̀ idà.
meaning: Said of a person who has got into a worse predicament than the one he or she was fleeing from.

proverbs: ‘‘Ó ṣe mí rí’’; ògbó adìẹ rí àwòdì sá.
meaning: One learns to run from danger once one has recognized it as such.

proverbs: Ó ti ojú orun wá ó ń fọ ẹnà; ó ní ‘‘ẹ jẹ́ ká máa ji ní mẹ́mu-mẹ́mu.’
meaning: An ignorant person will always make stupid suggestions.

proverbs: O wà láyé, mo wà láàye, ò ń bi mí bí ọ̀rún ṣe rí.
meaning: Said of a person seeking information from someone in no better position to know than the seeker.

proverbs: Ó yẹ kí eégún mọ ẹni tó mú àgbò so.
meaning: One should acknowledge those who have done one some favor.

proverbs: Obìnrin ò gbé ibi tó máa rọ̀ ọ́ lọ́rùn.
meaning: Women seldom know until it is too late which home would best suit them.

proverbs: Òbò ò ṣéé ṣe àlejò.
meaning: Good things are not good for all purposes

proverbs: Odídẹrẹ́ dawo, ìkó ìdí ẹ̀-ẹ́ dọ̀gbẹ̀rì.
meaning: The person being propped up achieves great glory, but his backer loses his standing.

proverbs: Odó iyán ò jẹ́ gún ẹ̀lú; odó ẹ̀lú ò jẹ́ gúnyán; àtẹ tá-a fi ń pàtẹ ìlẹ̀kẹ̀, a ò j fi pàtẹ ọ̀rúnlá.
meaning: Each object has its proper uses.

proverbs: Òdú kì í ṣe àìmọ̀ olóko.
meaning: An indication that a matter under discussion is not such a secret after all.

proverbs: Ogún kì í pọ̀ ká pín fún aládùúgbò.
meaning: However abundantly one is blessed, one should manage one’s resources wisely.

proverbs: Ogún n bókòó? Òwe aṣiwèrè.
meaning: Trust an imbecile to pose stupid questions.

proverbs: Ohùn àgbà: bí kò ta ìgún, a ta èbù.
meaning: There is some value in whatever comes out of an elder’s mouth.

proverbs: Ohun tí a bá pàdé ò jọ ohun tí a rí tẹ́lẹ̀.
meaning: No new friend or find can be as valuable as the one you have had for some time.

proverbs: Ohun tí a ni la fi ń kẹ́ ọmọ ẹni.
meaning: One should not go beyond one’s means simply to make a good impression on others.

proverbs: Ohun tí a ò rí rí lèèwọ̀ ojú.
meaning: Whatever one has encountered before cannot be too much to accommodate.

proverbs: Ohun tí a ṣe nílé àna ẹni, ‘‘Ojú ń tì mí’’ kúrò níbẹ̀.
meaning: One must not be reticent in doing whatever one must do.

proverbs: Ohun tí kò jẹ́ káṣọ pé méjì ni ò jẹ́ kó dú.
meaning: Misfortune teaches fortitude; scarcity teaches thrift.

proverbs: Ohun tí kò jẹ́ kí oko pọ̀ ni ò j kó mọ́.
meaning: A basic defect will manifest itself in sundry ways.

proverbs: Ohun tó fọ́ni lójú ló ń júwe ọ̀nà fúnni.
meaning: Misfortune teaches those it afflicts how to cope with it.

proverbs: Ohun tó jọ oun la fi ń wé ohun; èpo ẹ̀pà ló jọ ìtẹ́ ẹ̀lírí.
meaning: One should observe propriety in dealing with respectable people.

proverbs: Ohun tó ní òun óò bẹ́ni lórí, bó bá ṣíni ní fìlà, ká dúpẹ́ .
meaning: If misfortune turns out to be far milder than expected, one should give thanks.

proverbs: Ohun tó ní òun óò ṣeni lẹ́rú, tó wá ṣeni níwọ̀fà, ká gbà á.
meaning: One should gratefully accept a fate that turns out more merciful than it might have been.

proverbs: Ohun-a-lè-ṣe, tó forí sọ àpò òwú; wọ́n ní ṣe bó rí yangí nílẹ̀, ó ní ‘‘Ohun a bá lè ṣe là ń lérí sí.
meaning: Attempt only feats that will cause no headache.

proverbs: Òjò òì dá a ní kò tó tàná.
meaning: One should not arrive at conclusions until one has all the facts.

proverbs: Òjòwú ò já gèlè; kooro ló lè já.
meaning: Some people are all mouth and no action.

proverbs: Òjòwú ò lẹ́ran láyà.
meaning: Excessive jealousy eats up the jealous.

proverbs: Ojú àwo làwó fi ń gba ọbẹ̀.
meaning: One should not delegate matters crucial to oneself to others.

proverbs: Ojú kan làdá ń ní.
meaning: One should concentrate on one matter at a time.

proverbs: Ojú kì í pọ́nni ká fi pọ́nlẹ̀.
meaning: Difficulties should not lead one to foolish behavior.

proverbs: Ojú kì í pọ́nni ká mu ìṣápá; òùngbẹ kì í gbẹni ká mu ẹ̀jẹ̀.
meaning: Desperation must never push one beyond the bounds of acceptable behavior.

proverbs: Ojú kì í ti àgbà lóru; jagun a lóṣòó góńgó.
meaning: One can do whatever one pleases when no eyes are watching.

proverbs: Ojú kì í ti eégún kó má mọ̀nà ìgbàlẹ̀.
meaning: One cannot become so shamed abroad that one cannot return to the embrace of one’s home.

proverbs: Ojú la fi ń mọ àísí epo; ẹnu la fi ń mọ àìsíyọ̀; ọbẹ̀ tí ò bá lépo nínú òkèèrè la ti ń mọ̀ ọ́.
meaning: In some matters the evidence of the eyes is enough to reveal all one needs to know.

proverbs: Ojú tó rọ̀ nirorẹ́ ń sọ.
meaning: Other people always take advantage of gentle people.

proverbs: ‘‘Òkè ìhín ò j ká rí tọ̀ún’’ ò ṣéé pa lówe nílé àna ẹni.
meaning: There are some obligations one cannot sidestep with flippant excuses.

proverbs: Okó ilé kì í jọ obìnrin lójú, àfi bó bá dó tìta.
meaning: One hardly ever appreciates what one has until one has flirted with, and has been disappointed by, alternatives.

proverbs: Oko kì í jẹ́ ti baba àti tọmọ kó má nìí àlà.
meaning: Even close relatives may benefit from good fences.

proverbs: Oko mímọ́ ṣe-é ro; ọ̀nà mímọ́ dùn-ún tọ̀; gbogbo ìyàwó dùn-ún gbàbálé; aṣọ ìgbà-á ṣe-é yọ.
meaning: Everybody loves performing the most pleasant of chores.

proverbs: Okotorobo-ó tùy sílẹ̀ ọmọ titún ń gbe jó; ó ní ó rọ òun lọ́rùn lòún tu ú?
meaning: One should be careful before taking over things that others have rejected.

proverbs: Okotorobo-ó yé ẹyin sílẹ̀, àdàbà ń garùn wo ẹyin ẹl yin.
meaning: One should mind one’s own business.

proverbs: Òkú ẹran kì í ti ajá lójú.
meaning: If one’s means are limited, one cannot be too choosy.

proverbs: Olè tó gbé fèrè ọba ò róhun gbé.
meaning: There can be no rational explanation for acts of utter senselessness.

proverbs: Olé tó jí kàkàkí: níbo ni yó ti fọn ọ́n?
meaning: One should not waste one’s efforts chasing something one can never use.

proverbs: Olóhun kì í rí ohun ẹ̀ kó pè é lórò.
meaning: One cannot be afraid of what one owns.

proverbs: Olóhun-ún dolè; ‘‘Gbà bù jẹ́ ’’ dolóhun.
meaning: The tables are turned: the rightful owner is displaced by a usurper.

proverbs: Olóògùn ní ń ṣe bí a-láigbọ́-mọ̀ràn; bí ogun ó bàá wọ̀lú ọlọgbọ́n là ń fọ̀rọ̀ lọ̀.
meaning: Trust in wisdom rather than in magical charms.

proverbs: Olórìṣà tó da kiriyó: ọjọ́ tó gbọ́ dùrù orí ijó lẹsẹ̀-ẹ́ kán sí.
meaning: Old habits die hard.

proverbs: Olòṣì ọmọ ní ń fọwọ́ òsì júwe ilé-e baba-a rẹ̀.
meaning: One should show proper regard for one’s own patrimony.

proverbs: Olóúnjẹ- tó-ó bá kú.
meaning: Food is a good enough reason to cast one’s lot with another person.

proverbs: Olówe laláṣẹ̀ ọ̀rọ̀.
meaning: There is no authority like proverbial authority.

proverbs: Olówó á wá; aláwìn á wá; ìlú tí à ń gbé la gbé ń gbàwìn; à-rà-àì-san ni ò súnwọ̀n.
meaning: There is nothing bad about buying on credit as long as one eventually pays.

proverbs: Olówó pèlù o ò jó; ọjọ́ wo lo máa rówó pe tìẹ?
meaning: One should take advantage of every opportunity to supply one’s deficiencies.

proverbs: Òmùgọ̀ èèyàn ní ń bóbìnrin mulẹ̀; ọjọ́ tóbìnrín bá mawo lawó bàjẹ́ .
meaning: Never trust a woman.

proverbs: Òmùgọ̀ ní ń gbé ígunnu; ọlọgbọ́n ní ń gbowó.
meaning: The wise person chooses the most profitable option available.

proverbs: Onígẹ̀gẹ́ fìlẹ̀kẹ̀ dọ́pọ̀; adámú fi sàárà san ẹgbẹ̀ta.
meaning: One usually sets little value on what one cannot use.

proverbs: Onígi ní ń figi ẹ̀ dọ́pọ̀.
meaning: People take their cue from the owner of a thing in placing a value on it.

proverbs: Onígbá ní ń pe igbá ẹ̀ ní àíkàrágbá káyé tó fi kólẹ̀.
meaning: If one does not value what one has, other people will value it even less.

proverbs: Onígbèsè tí ń pa àpatà ẹyẹlé.
meaning: The debtor is desperate, because there is not much meat to a pigeon, and few people eat pigeons anyway.

proverbs: Oníṣègùn tó sọ pé díẹ̀ ò tó òun, òfo ni yó fọwọ́ mú.
meaning: One should not demand too much from people who are in dire straights.

proverbs: Ooré pẹ́, aṣiwèrè-é gbàgbé.
meaning: Only an imbecile forgets a favor even long after it was done.

proverbs: Oòrùn kì í jẹ iṣu àgbà kó má mọbẹ̀.
meaning: A grown-up person should know where he went wrong and make amends accordingly.

proverbs: Oòrùn kì í là kínú bí olóko.
meaning: Everybody welcomes an auspicious event.

proverbs: Orí ọ̀kẹ́rẹ́ popo láwo; bí a wí fọ́mọ ẹni a gbọ́ràn.
meaning: Refusal to listen to counsel leads to disaster.

proverbs: Orí tí yó jẹ igún kì í gbọ́; bí wọ́n fun ládìẹ kò níí gbà.
meaning: The person destined to suffer will manage to succumb to the suffering despite efforts by others to save him or her.

proverbs: Orí tó kọ ẹrù, owó ní ń náni.
meaning: It costs money to have others do what one refuses to do for oneself.

proverbs: Orin tí ò ṣoro-ó dá kì í ṣòro-ó gbè; bí ó bá ní ‘‘héééé,’’ à ní ‘‘háááá.’’
meaning: One expends on a task only the amount of effort commensurate with it.

proverbs: Orín yí, ìlù-ú yí padà.
meaning: One should match one’s behavior to one’s circumstances.

proverbs: Òrìṣà tó ní tÒgún kì í ṣe ọ̀nà ò ní rí nńkan jẹ lásìkò tó fẹ́ .
meaning: Humor those in a position to punish you.

proverbs: Òṣùpá lé a ní kò gún; ẹni tọ́wọ́ ẹ̀-ẹ́ bá to kó tún un ṣe.
meaning: It is pointless to complain about things one can do nothing about.

proverbs: Òtòṣì ò gbọ́ tìṣẹ́ ẹ̀ ó ní ogún kó àparò; ọdẹ́ rorò.
meaning: Rather than deal with their own problems, people sometimes gloat over the troubles of others.

proverbs: Owó kì í lóye kọ́mọ kú s rú.
meaning: One does not endure adverse conditions when one is capable of the effort to escape them. The following proverb is something of a variant.

proverbs: Owó kì í yéye kọ́mọ ó kú.
meaning: One should spare no expenses to take care of one’s children or one’s affairs.

proverbs: Owó la fi ń fíná owó; bí ẹgbẹ̀rún bá so lókè, igbió la fi ń ká a.
meaning: Without some expenditure there can be no profit.

proverbs: Owó la fi ń lògbà; ọgbọ́n la fi ń gbélé ayé.
meaning: Riches are desirable, but wisdom is more valuable.

proverbs: Owó ní ń pa ọjà ọ̀mọ̀ràn.
meaning: A wise trader knows how to use his money to make his offer successful.

proverbs: Owó tọ́mọdé bá kọ́kọ́ ní, àkàrà ní ń fi-í rà.
meaning: Young people seldom know how to manage wealth.

proverbs: Òwú kì í là kínú bí olóko.
meaning: The success of a venture does not make one angry.

proverbs: Owú pani ju kùmọ̀.
meaning: Jealousy is a dangerous thing.

proverbs: Òyìnbó Òkè Eléérú, ó ṣubú sóde Alọ́ba; kùmmọ ni yó gbe dìde.
meaning: A person who becomes disabled where he is at his enemy’s mercy can expect rough handling.

proverbs: Ọ̀bẹ ń wólé ara ẹ̀ ó ní òun ń ba àkọ̀ jẹ́ .
meaning: Said of people whose actions will hurt them more than they will hurt other people.

proverbs: Ọbẹ̀ tí baálé kì í jẹ, ìyálé ilé kì í sè é.
meaning: One should not do what one knows one’s comrades hate.

proverbs: Ọ̀dẹ̀ ọmọ ń fi ìdò ṣeré.
meaning: A simpleton does not know the value of anything.

proverbs: Ọ̀dẹ̀dẹ̀ ò gba òró, àfi abẹ́ ọdán.
meaning: An invitation to repair to another place outside other people’s earshot to discuss confidential matters.

proverbs: Ọ̀fàfà fohùn ṣakin.
meaning: The loud person attracts attention.

proverbs: Ọgbọ́n a-dákọ-kéré ò tó ti a-yọwó-má-rà.
meaning: One does not have to patronize a dishonest trader.

proverbs: Ọgbọ́n dùn-ún gbọ́n; ìmọ́ dùn-ún mọ̀.
meaning: Always seek wisdom and knowledge.

proverbs: Ọgbọ́n ju agbára.
meaning: Always prefer wisdom to strength.

proverbs: Ọgbọ́n kì í tán.
meaning: There will always be a place and some use for wisdom.

proverbs: Ọgbọ́n la fi ń gbé ayé.
meaning: Wisdom is indispensable.

proverbs: Ọgbọ́n lajá fi ń pa ìkokò bọ Ifá.
meaning: A cunning person can get the better of people far more powerful than he.

proverbs: Ọgbọ́n ní ń ṣẹ́gun; ìmọ̀ràn ní ń ṣẹ́ ẹ̀tẹ̀.
meaning: Cunning and knowledge will help one prevail.

proverbs: Ọgbọ́n ọlọgbọ́n la fi ń ṣọgbọ́n; ìmọ̀ràn ẹnìkan ò tọ́ bọ̀rọ̀.
meaning: Wisdom and knowledge are best shared.

proverbs: Ọgbọ́n ọlọgbọ́n ò jẹ́ ká pe àgbà ní wèrè.
meaning: The person who can learn from others will avoid a lot of embarrassment.

proverbs: Ọgbón tí ahún gbọ́n, ẹ̀hìn ni yó máa tọ ti ìgbín.
meaning: Some people cannot hope to be more cunning than certain others.

proverbs: Ọgbọ́n tí ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ fi pa ẹfọ̀n ló fi ń jẹ .
meaning: If a person has proved himself capable of doing the impossible, one should not doubt that he can accomplish another impossibility.

proverbs: Ọgbọọgbọ́n làgbàlagbà-á fi ń sá fún ẹranlá.
