meaning: A grown person should know how to avoid disaster without losing face.

proverbs: Ọjọ́ eré là ń jiyàn ohun.
meaning: Arguments conducted in jest conceal some serious import.

proverbs: Ọjọ́ tí ìlù-ú bá ń lu onílù, iṣẹ́ mìíràn-án yá.
meaning: One should know when to abandon an unprofitable proposition.

proverbs: Ọjọ́ tí olówó ń ṣẹbọ ni à-wà-jẹ-wà-mu ìwọ̀fà.
meaning: The poor will eat when the rich provide a feast.

proverbs: Ọ̀kẹ́rẹ́ ń sunkún agbádá; èyí tí àjàò-ó dá léṣìí kí ló fi ṣe? Ṣebí igi ló fi ń gùn.
meaning: It is silly to hanker for something one cannot use anyway.

proverbs: Ọkọ́ ọlọ́kọ́ la fi ń gbọ́n èkìtì.
meaning: One is usually more respectful of one’s own property than that of others.

proverbs: Ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan là ń yọ ẹsẹ̀ lábàtà.
meaning: The best way to approach a problem is systematically.

proverbs: Ọkùnkan là ń yọ ẹsẹ̀ lẹ́kù.
meaning: The best way to approach a problem is systematically.

proverbs: Ọkùnrin jẹ́jẹ́ a-bìwà-kunkun.
meaning: The quiet type is often a tough customer.

proverbs: Ọlọ ò lọ ló dé Ìbarà? Ìbarà a máa ṣe ilé ọlọ?
meaning: People do not travel from home without some reason.

proverbs: Ọlọ́gbọ́n dorí ẹja mú; òmùgọ̀ dìrù-u rẹ̀ mú.
meaning: The wise person knows better than a fool the best way to handle a situation.

proverbs: Ọlọ́gbọ́n jẹni bí ẹmùrẹ́n; aṣiwèré jẹni bí ìgbọ̀ngbọ̀n.
meaning: Cautiousness will get one to the goal far more successfully than brashness.

proverbs: Ọlọgbọ́n ló lè mọ àdììtú èdè.
meaning: The deep meanings and nuances of an utterance are for only the wise to understand.

proverbs: Ọlọgbọ́n ń dẹ ihò, ọ̀mọ̀ràn-án dúró tì í; ọlọgbọ́n ní ‘‘Háà, ó jáde!’’ Ọ̀mọ̀rán ní ‘‘Háà, mo kì í!’’ Ọlọgbọ́n ní ‘‘Kí lo kì?’’ Ọ̀mọ̀rán ní ‘‘Kí nìwọ náà-á ló jáde?’’
meaning: Two matched wits are in contest.

proverbs: Ọlọgbọ́n ni yó jogún ògo; aṣiwèrè ni yó ru ìtìjú wálé.
meaning: A wise child is to be preferred to an idiot.

proverbs: Ọlọgbọ́n ọmọ ní ń mú inú-u bàbá ẹ̀ dùn; aṣiwèrè ọmọ ní ń ba inú ìyá ẹ̀ jẹ́ .
meaning: Every parent would prefer a wise child to an idiot.

proverbs: Ọlọ́jà kì í wípé kọ́jà ó tú.
meaning: People always want the best outcome for their ventures.

proverbs: Ọlọ́tí kì í mọ ọmọ ẹ̀ lólè.
meaning: One is always blind to the flaws of those one loves.

proverbs: Ọlọ́tọ̀ọ́ ní tòun ọ̀tọ̀; ìyá ẹ̀-ẹ́ kú nílé, o gbé e lọ sin sóko.
meaning: The unconventional person will always do things differently.

proverbs: Ọmọ atiro tó ra bàtà fún bàbá ẹ̀, òrọ̀ ló fẹ́ gbọ́.
meaning: One must not be thoughtless in one’s actions.

proverbs: Ọmọ ẹní dàra, bí-i ká fi ṣaya kọ́.
meaning: Not all attractive propositions can be pursued.

proverbs: Ọmọ ẹni ẹlẹ́ni ò jọ ọmọ ẹni; ọmọ eni ì-bá jiyán, ọmọ ẹni ẹlẹ́ni a jẹ̀kọ.
meaning: One always favors one’s own children over those of others.

proverbs: Ọmọ ẹni kì í gbọnsẹ̀ ká fi eèsún nù ú nídìí.
meaning: We do not deliberately injure those who look to us for protection.

proverbs: Ọmọ iná là ń rán síná.
meaning: It is best to match the remedy to the problem.

proverbs: Ọmọ tí ò ní baba kì í jìjà ẹ̀bi.
meaning: Never provoke trouble unless you have strong backers.

proverbs: Ọmọdé kékeré ò mọ ogun, ó ní kógun ó wá, ó ní bógún bá dé òun a kó síyàrá ìyá òun.
meaning: Ignorance often leads people to bite off much more than they can chew.

proverbs: Ọmọdé kì í mọ àkókò tí kúrò-kúròó fi ń kúrò.
meaning: Youth is a stranger to etiquette or protocol.

proverbs: Ọmọde kì í mọ ìtàn, kó mọ à-gbọ́-wí, kó mọ ọjọ́ tí a ṣe ẹ̀dá òun.
meaning: However knowledgeable a youth might be, some deep knowledge would be beyond him.

proverbs: Ọmọdé kì í mọ ori-í jẹ kó má ràá a l nu.
meaning: A youth may be clever but will inevitably make some mistakes.

proverbs: Ọmọdé kì í ní iná níle kí tòde má jòó o.
meaning: Being secure and well respected in one’s home does not save one from vicissitudes outside the home.

proverbs: Ọmọdé mọ sáárá, ṣùgbọ́n kò mọ àlọ̀yí.
meaning: A child is good at consuming but not at procuring.

proverbs: Ọmọdé ní wọ́n ń jẹ igún, bàbá ẹ̀-ẹ́ ní wọn kì í jẹ ; ó ní ẹnìkán jẹ rí lójú òun; bàbá ẹ̀-ẹ́ ní ta ni? Ó ní ẹni náà ò sí.
meaning: The youth who attempts to challenge the wisdom of the elders will find himself tripped up by his own mouth.

proverbs: Ọmọdé ò mẹ̀fọ́, ó ń pè é légbògi.
meaning: An uninformed person will inevitably make a fool of himself or herself.

proverbs: Ọmọdé ò mọ oògùn, ó ń pè é lẹ́fọ̀ọ́, kò mọ̀ pé ikú tó pa baba òun ni.
meaning: People may call disasters on their own heads out of ignorance.

proverbs: Ọmọdé ò moògùn ó ń pè é l gùn-ún.
meaning: The ignorant person knows not the value of anything.

proverbs: Ọmọdé yìí, máa wò mí lójú, ẹni (tí) a bá lọ sóde là ń wò lójú.
meaning: Always pay attention to what your guide and instructor does and tells you to do.

proverbs: ‘‘Ọmọ-ọ̀ mi ò yó’’ la mọ̀; ‘‘ọmọ-ọ̀ mí yó, ṣùgbọ́n kò rí sáárá f ,’’ a ò mọ ìyẹn.
meaning: People should care for their children, not spoil them with overindulgence.

proverbs: Ọ̀mọ̀ràn ní ń mọ oyún ìgbín.
meaning: Deep wisdom is the gift of only a select few.

proverbs: Ọ̀pá gbóńgbó ní n ṣíwájú agbọ́ọni.
meaning: One uses the tools or weapons at one’s disposal to tackle challenges.

proverbs: Ọpẹ́ ló yẹ ẹrú.
meaning: People should be grateful for whatever charity they receive.

proverbs: Ọ̀pẹ̀lẹ̀ èèyàn, bí a ò bá gbé e lulẹ̀, kò níí lè fọhùn ire.
meaning: Some people respond only to force.

proverbs: Ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ ní kéjò máa kálọ; ìjà òun di ojú ọ̀nà.
meaning: Weaklings always make sure that saviors are around before they get into a fight.

proverbs: Ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ ní òun lè sín ìlẹ̀kẹ̀; ta ní jẹ́ fi ìlẹ̀kẹ̀ ọ̀pọ̀ló sídìí ọmọ-ọ ẹ̀?
meaning: Not just anything will do for discriminating people.

proverbs: Ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ ń yan káńdú-kàǹdù-káńdú lóju ẹlẹ́gùúsí; ẹlẹ́gùúsí ò gbọdọ̀ yí i láta.
meaning: A person outside one’s jurisdiction may well taunt one.

proverbs: Ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ ò mọ̀nà odò, ó dà á sí àwàdà.
meaning: When one is stumped, one covers one’s embarrassment with laughter.

proverbs: Ọ̀pọ̀lọpọ̀ òjò ní ńlé eégún wọlé kẹri-kẹri.
meaning: When problems become overwhelming, one has no choice but to succumb to them.

proverbs: Ọ̀ràn kan la fi ń ṣòfin ọ̀kan.
meaning: Experience establishes a precedent for future occurrences.

proverbs: Ọ̀ràn ọlọ́ràn la fi ń kọ́gbọ́n.
meaning: One should learn from other people’s vicissitudes.

proverbs: Ọ̀ràn tí ò sunwọ̀n, konko ǹ ṣojú.
meaning: When one is in the wrong, one hides behind braggadocio.

proverbs: Ọ̀rọ̀ kì í gbórín ká fi ọ̀bẹ bù ú, ẹnu la fi ń wí i.
meaning: The weightiest problem is resolvable through discussion and negotiation.

proverbs: Ọ̀rọ̀ la fi ń jẹ omitooro ọ̀rọ̀.
meaning: It is with words that one resolves all problems.

proverbs: Ọ̀rọ̀ rere ní ń yọ obì lápò; ọ̀rọ̀ búburú ní ń yọ ọfà lápó.
meaning: Judicious language defuses problems, whereas thoughtless talk aggravates them.

proverbs: Ọ̀rọ̀ tí ọlọgbọ́n bá sọ, ẹnu aṣiwèrè la ti ń gbọ́ ọ.
meaning: Rumormongers always distort the news they hear from reliable sources.

proverbs: Ọ̀rọ̀ tó dojú rú di ti ọlọ́rọ̀, ayé á dẹ̀hìn.
meaning: People will help one only so far; in the end each person must confront his or her problems alone.

proverbs: Ọ̀rọ̀-ọ́ ni òun ò nílé; ibi tí wọ́n bá rí ni wọ́n ti ń sọ òun.
meaning: Any place is a good place for an exchange of views.

proverbs: Ọsán gbé ojú ọrun le kókó; bó bá wọ odò, a di ọ̀-rọ̀-pọ̀jọ̀-pọ̀jọ̀.
meaning: One thrives on one’s home ground where conditions are ideal; in hostile territory one becomes helpless.

proverbs: Ọ̀sán ọ̀run ò pọ́n; ẹni tó bá yá kó máa bá tiẹ̀ lọ.
meaning: One is not eager to join others in deadly adventures.

proverbs: Ọwọ́ aṣiwèrè ni a gbé ń bá apá yíya.
meaning: Simpleminded people do not know how to cover their tracks or get rid of the evidence.

proverbs: Ọ̀wọ̀-ọ kókó la fi ń wọ igi; ọ̀wọ̀ òrìṣà la fi ń wọ àfín.
meaning: One extends one’s regard for certain people to those associated with them.

proverbs: Rà á ire, gà á ire; ìpéǹpéjú ni àlà-a fìlà.
meaning: One may be free to use one’s possession as one pleases, but there are still some conventions to observe.

proverbs: Ràdà-ràdà-á mọ ibi tí ó ń rè.
meaning: A person who seems without a purpose may be engaged in something known to himself or herself.

proverbs: ‘‘Sìn mí ká relé àna,’’ ó wẹ̀wù ẹtù.
meaning: Said of a person who attempts to steal other people’s glory whom he or she is supposed to be helping.

proverbs: Sọ̀rọ̀ kí ọlọ́rọ̀ gbọ́, àbùkù ní ń fi kanni.
meaning: One should refrain from rumormongering.

proverbs: Ṣàǹgó kì í jà kó mú ilé aró.
meaning: Some people are beyond the reach of some nemesis.

proverbs: Ṣàngó ní òun ní ń kó ọkùnrin suuru bá jà; Èṣù ní bí-i tòun? Ṣàngó ní kí tÈṣù kúrò.
meaning: No one wants to engage in any venture with an unpredictable troublemaker.

proverbs: ‘‘Ṣe mí níṣu’’ ní ń ṣíwájú ‘‘ẹ kúuṣẹ́’’ bí?
meaning: It is bad form to ask people for favors before you greet them.

proverbs: Ṣẹ̀kẹ̀rẹ̀ ò ṣéé fọ̀pá na.
meaning: Always apply the proper tool to the job.

proverbs: Ṣẹ́kẹ́-ṣẹkẹ̀-ẹ́ dára, ṣùgbọ́n alágbẹ̀dẹ ò rọ ọ́ fún ọmọ ẹ̀.
meaning: When trouble is being distributed, one always wishes to exempt one’s own people.

proverbs: Sútà ò nílé; ìkóríta lÈṣù ń gbé.
meaning: No one makes room in his or her home for an abomination.

proverbs: Ta lèèyàn nínú ẹrú Ààrẹ? A ní Ìdaganna la wá wá, ẹ ní Ìdakolo?
meaning: Said to indicate that one’s auditor is making nonsense out of the sense one is making. Also, there is nothing to choose between two worthless things.

proverbs: Ta ní jẹ́ jẹ ọṣẹ kó fògìrì fọṣọ?
meaning: Who would seek unease when ease is available?

proverbs: Ta ní mọ̀dí òjò, bí kò ṣe Ṣàngó?
meaning: Only those privy to mysteries can explain mysterious events.

proverbs: Tábà tí ò dùn, ẹnu ò tà á.
meaning: No amount of talk will make something unpleasant become pleasant.

proverbs: ‘‘Tèmi ò ṣòro,’’ tí kì í jẹ kọ́mọ alágbẹ̀dẹ ní idà.
meaning: The person who always yields to others will never get anywhere.

proverbs: Tẹni ní ń jọni lójú; eèrà-á bímọ-ọ rẹ̀ ó sọ ọ́ ní òyírìgbí.
meaning: One always tends to overestimate the worth of one’s own possession.

proverbs: Tẹni n tẹni; bí àpọ́n bá sun iṣu a bù fọ́mọ-ọ rẹ̀.
meaning: One makes do with what one has.

proverbs: Tẹ̀tẹ́ ní ń ṣíwájú eré sísa.
meaning: One should observe some order in what one does.

proverbs: Tìẹ́ sàn, tèmí sàn, lolókùnrùn méjì-í fi ń dìmú.
meaning: Fools will fight over the most stupid things.

proverbs: Tinú ọ̀lẹ lọ̀lẹ ń jẹ; aṣiwèrè èèyàn ni ò mọ èrú tí yó gbà.
meaning: If one lacks industry, one had better be resourceful.

proverbs: Wàrà-wàrà là ń yọ oró iná.
meaning: Do not delay in exacting vengeance for a wrong.

proverbs: Wèrè-é dùn-ún wò, kò ṣé-é bí lọ́mọ.
meaning: One might be tolerant of simplicity or irresponsibility in other people but not in one’s own relatives.

proverbs: Wèrè-é yàtọ̀ sí wéré; wéré kì í ṣe wèrè; ìjá yàtọ̀ sí eré.
meaning: One should not confuse jesting with quarreling.

proverbs: Wéré-wéré lọmọdé ń bọ oko èèsì.
meaning: Painful problems enforce quick attention.

proverbs: Wò mí lójú, wò mí lẹ́ẹ̀kẹ́ ; ẹni a bá lọ sóde là ń wò lójú.
meaning: People should not cultivate wandering eyes.

proverbs: ‘‘Wo ọmọ-ọ̀ mi dè mí’’: ó ń lo kíjìpá mẹ́ta gbó; mélòó ni ọlọ́mọ-ọ́ máa lò gbó?
meaning: The caretaker should not use up all his own resources for the benefit of his or her employer.

proverbs: Wolé-wolé kì í wolé agbọ́n láì tẹ́ .
meaning: One should be cautious in performing one’s duties.

proverbs: Wọ́n ní, ‘‘Afọ́jú, o ò tanná alẹ́ .’’ Ó ní àtọ̀sán àtòru, èwo lòún rí níbẹ?
meaning: One should not waste efforts in procuring things one cannot use.

proverbs: Wọ́n ní, ‘‘Afọ́jú, ọmo-ọ̀ rẹ-ẹ́ pẹran.’’ Ó ní kò dá òun lójú, àfi bí òun bá tọ́ ọ wò.
meaning: Always insist on positive proof.

proverbs: A bu omi lámù a rí eégún; kí ni ẹni tó lọ sódò lọ pọnmi yó rìí?
meaning: If a person exposed to minimal risk cries disaster, what would the person exposed to much greater risk do?

proverbs: A fún ọ níṣu lỌ́yọ̀ọ́ ò ń dúpẹ́ ; o rígi sè é ná?
meaning: Never assume that a propitious beginning assures a successful conclusion.

proverbs: A ki ẹsẹ̀ kan bọ odò omí fà á; bí a bá wá ti mejèèjì bọ̀ ọ́ ńkọ́?
meaning: Repercussions should not be disproportionate to the act.

proverbs: A kì í bá ẹl nu jìjà òru.
meaning: Never get into a competition with a braggart unless a witness is present.

proverbs: A kì í bú ọba onígẹ̀gẹ̀ lójú àwọn èèyàn-án rẹ̀.
meaning: Never expose yourself to repercussions with careless speech or indiscreet behavior.

proverbs: A kì í fi ìkánjú lá ọbẹ̀ gbígbóná.
meaning: Patience is best in delicate or difficult matters.

proverbs: A kì í gbélé gba ọfà láìlọ ogun.
meaning: One should be safe in one’s own home.

proverbs: A kì í kánjú tu olú-ọrán; igba ẹ̀ ò tó-ó sebẹ̀.
meaning: Certain tasks demand patience if they are to come out right.

proverbs: A kì í rídìí òkun; a kì í rídìí ọsà; ọmọ-oní-gele-gele kì í jẹ́ kí wọ́n rídìí òun.
meaning: People should not expose their innermost secrets to all and sundry.

proverbs: A kì í rójú ẹni puró mọ̀ni.
meaning: It is always easier to do evil to people who are absent.

proverbs: A kì í sọ̀rọ̀ orí bíbẹ́ lójú ọmọdé; lọ́rùnlọ́-rùn ni yó máa wo olúwa-a rẹ̀.
meaning: Never discuss a secret in the hearing of a person whose behavior will give the secret away.

proverbs: À ń gba òròmọ adìẹ lọ́wọ́ ikú, ó ní wọn ò jẹ́ kí òun jẹ̀ láàtàn.
meaning: Chicks foraging at the dump are easy prey for kites.

proverbs: A níṣẹ́ iṣẹ́ ẹ, o ní ò ń lọ sóko; bó o bá lọ sóko ò ń bọ̀ wá bá a nílé.
meaning: One may devise stratagems to defer carrying out one’s duties, but they are unlikely to make others carry them out.

proverbs: À ń ṣa kẹ́kẹ́ , aájò ẹwà ni; à ń bàbàjà, aájò ẹwà ni.
meaning: The pains one takes to adorn oneself are for a good end.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ó gbálẹ̀ ni ilẹ̀ ń mọ́ fún.
meaning: Those who exert themselves are the ones who reap rewards.

proverbs: Àáké tí ń gégi-í kọsẹ̀, gbẹ́nàgbẹ́nà-á bu ètù sórí.
meaning: The evildoer’s conscience will not let him or her rest.

proverbs: Àáyá kan-án bẹ̀ ọ́ wò; igba wọ́n ti rí ọ.
meaning: A secret disclosed to one person is as good as published for all.

proverbs: Abẹ ní ń bẹ orí; oníṣẹ́ àtẹ́lẹsẹ̀ ní ń bẹ ọ̀nà; bèbè ìdí ní ń bẹ kíjìpá; bí a dáwọ́-ọ bíbẹni, a tán nínú ẹni.
meaning: One is placated by a person close to one; afterward, one allows oneself to be appeased.

proverbs: Abẹ́rẹ́ bọ́ sómi táló; Ọ̀dọ̀fín ní òun-ún gbọ́ ‘‘jàbú!’’
meaning: Excessive exaggeration amounts to lying.

proverbs: Abiyamọ, kàgbo wàrà; ọjọ́ ń lọ.
meaning: Attend to duties in time.

proverbs: Àbùlẹ̀ ní ń mú aṣọ tọ́; ẹni tí kò tọ́jú àbùlẹ̀ yó ṣe ara-a rẹ̀ lófò aṣọ.
meaning: Everything has its use; conserve your resources.

proverbs: Àdàbà ń pògèdè, ó rò pé ẹyẹlé ò gbọ́; ẹyẹlé gbọ́, títiiri ló tiiri.
meaning: Never mistake a peron’s easygoing demeanor for cowardice or folly.

proverbs: Adìẹ́ ń jẹkà, ó ń mumi, ó ń gbé òkúta pẹ́-pẹ̀-pẹ́ mì, ó ní òun ò léhín; ìdérègbè tó léhín ń gbé irin mì bí?
meaning: One should be content with one’s lot.

proverbs: Àdó gba ara ẹ̀ tẹ́lẹ̀, ká tó fi oògùn si?
meaning: Do not seek protection from a helpless person.

proverbs: Àdóìṣí loògùn ọrọ̀.
meaning: One should not be a rolling stone.

proverbs: Afẹ́fẹ́ tó wọlé tó kó aṣọ iyàrá, ìkìlọ̀ ni fún ẹni tó wọ tiẹ̀ sọrùn.
meaning: When disaster befalls the most formidable people, those less formidable should take warning.

proverbs: Àfojúdi ìlẹ̀kẹ̀ ní ń jẹ́ ‘‘Ẹrú-kò-ní.’’
meaning: One must be mindful of how one’s actions might affect others.

proverbs: Àgékù ejò, tí ń ṣoro bí agbọ́n.
meaning: A wounded adversary is a vicious one.

proverbs: Àgúnbàjẹ́ ni tolódó.
meaning: One should exercise restraint in using what one has in abundance.

proverbs: Àgùntàn bọ̀lọ̀jọ̀ ò gbàgbé eléèrí bọ̀rọ̀.
meaning: One remembers one’s benefactor

proverbs: Àgùntàn ń wò sùn-ùn; ọgbọ́n inú pé egbèje.
meaning: Looks are deceptive.

proverbs: Àgùntàn ò jí ní kùtùkùtù ṣe ẹnu bọbọ.
meaning: One should not dawdle in the morning.

proverbs: Àgbà òṣìkà ń gbin ìyà sílẹ̀ de ọmọ-ọ rẹ̀.
meaning: One’s character often affects the fortunes of one’s children.

proverbs: Àgbẹ̀ ò dáṣọ lóṣù, àfọdún.
meaning: The reward for one’s labor is often a long time coming.

proverbs: Àgbẹ̀ tó bá pẹ́ nílé ò níí kọ oko ọ̀sán.
meaning: He who dallies makes his tasks that much more difficult.

proverbs: À-gbẹ́rù-àì-wẹ̀hìn lọ̀pálábá fi gbàgbé ìyá ẹ̀ sílẹ̀.
meaning: The broken bottle suffered its fate, perhaps, because it was not careful about what it ‘‘carried.’’ The hasty traveler leaves his goods behind.

proverbs: Agbójúlógún fi ara-a rẹ̀ fóṣì ta.
meaning: One should secure one’s own living.

proverbs: Àgbọ́ká etí ọlọ́ràn á di.
meaning: There is some benefit to ignoring certain things.

proverbs: Àgbọ́kànlé ò pani lébi.
meaning: One’s reserve guarantees one’s supplies.

proverbs: Àìfẹ̀sọ̀ké ìbòsí ni kò ṣéé gbè.
meaning: If the person who raises an alarm puts people off by his or her methods, they will not come to his or her aid.

proverbs: Àìgbọ̀ràn, baba àfojúdi.
meaning: To disobey people is to show a lack of regard for them.

proverbs: Àìlèfọhùn ní ń ṣáájú orí burúkú.
meaning: A person who will not speak on his or her own behalf suffers the consequences.

proverbs: Àìrọ́rọ̀sọ ìyàwó tó wí pé èkúté-ilé yó jẹ idẹ; bẹ́ẹ̀ni Mọ́jidẹ nìyálé-e rẹ̀ ńjẹ́ .
meaning: Veiled insults directed at an adversary are as potent as any other sort of provocation.

proverbs: Àìsàn là ń wò, a kì í wo ikú.
meaning: If one neglects an illness until death intervenes, the treatment comes too late.

proverbs: Àìtètèmólè, olèé mólóko.
meaning: One must be alert in dealing with slippery people; otherwise, they turn the tables.

proverbs: Ajá ilé ò mọdẹ ṣe.
meaning: Pampering kills initiative.

proverbs: Ajá kì í dán-nu ‘‘Kò séwu’’ lókò ẹkùn.
meaning: Never sneer at obvious danger.

proverbs: Ajá tí yó sọnù kì í gbọ́ fèrè ọdẹ.
meaning: No matter what help one may render, one cannot save an ill-fated person.

proverbs: Ajá tó rí mọ́tò tó dúró fi ara-a rẹ̀ bọ Ògún.
meaning: A person who needlessly endangers himself or herself deserves his or her fate.

proverbs: Àjànàkú tí a gbẹ́ ọ̀fìn sílẹ̀ dè, erin-ín mojú; erin ò bá ibẹ̀ lọ.
meaning: The alert person will thwart an enemy’s machinations.

proverbs: Àjẹ́ ń ké, òkùnrùn ò paradà; ó lówó ẹbọ nílé.
meaning: One need not fear a scourge for which one has the remedy.

proverbs: Ajẹnifẹ́ni, èkúté ilé.
meaning: Be wary of adversaries who pose as friends.

proverbs: Àkàlàmàgbò-ó ṣoore ó yọ gẹ̀gẹ̀ lọ́rùn.
meaning: Good deeds sometimes come back to haunt the doer.

proverbs: Akánjú jayé, ọ̀run wọn ò pẹ́ .
meaning: Reckless living leads to early death.

proverbs: Àkèekèé ò ṣé-é dì níbò.
meaning: Some matters call for extreme caution.

proverbs: Àkèekèé rìn tapótapó.
meaning: The stalwart is never unprepared to answer a call.

proverbs: Àkèekèé ta Kindo lẹpọ̀n, ará ilée Labata ń rojú; kí ló kàn án níbọ?
meaning: One should not take on matters that are not one’s business.

proverbs: Àkọ̀ tó bá bá ọ̀bẹ dìtẹ̀ á gbọgbẹ́ láti inú.
meaning: Never court the anger of a person in a position to inflict injury on you.

proverbs: Akóbáni lèkúté-ilé; ejò kì í jàgbàdo.
meaning: Bad company brings bad fortune.

proverbs: Àlá tí ajá bá lá, inú ajá ní ń gbé.
meaning: Keep your own counsel.

proverbs: Aláàárù kì í sọ pé kí ajé ṣe òun pa; ẹl rù ńkọ́?
meaning: One should not assume other people’s responsibilities and risks.

proverbs: Alágbàró ò yege; aláṣọ á gbà á bó dòla.
meaning: There is nothing like having one’s own.

proverbs: Aláǹgbá tó fojú di erè, ikùn ejò ni yó bàá ara-a ẹ̀.
meaning: Whoever disdains obvious danger will suffer dire consequences.

proverbs: Alápàáǹdẹ̀dẹ̀ ń jayé lébé-lébé.
meaning: The best way to live is carefully.

proverbs: Alára ò lè wí pé kò dun òun, ká ní ó kú àìsùn, ó kú àìwo.
meaning: One does not commiserate with a person who does not admit his or her misfortune

proverbs: Alárìnjó tí yó jòó, kó ti ìwòyí mú ẹsẹ̀ kó le kó kó kó.
meaning: Before embarking on a trade, one should hone one’s tools.

proverbs: Aláwàdà ló lè ṣọkọ òṣónú; ẹni tí kò lẹ́nu mímú tete ò lè ṣọkọ alápẹpẹ.
meaning: Incompatible natures cannot make a good marriage.

proverbs: Àlejò tó wọ̀ nílé-e Pọ́ngilá, Pọ́ngilá ní, ‘‘Ìwọ ta ni?’’ Àlejò-ó ní òun Bugijẹ; Pọ́ngilá ni, ‘‘Tòò, lọ́ dájú igi-i tìrẹ lọ́tọ̀.’’
meaning: Do not encourage people to take advantage of you or abuse your generosity.

proverbs: Àlọ ti alábaun; àbọ̀ ti àna-a rẹ̀.
meaning: The person in the right in a dispute, if he or she is too vindictive, quickly becomes the one in the wrong.

proverbs: Àlùkẹrẹsẹ ò mọ̀ pé olóko-ó ládàá.
meaning: The evildoer does not consider the response of the person wronged.

proverbs: Àmọ̀jù là ń mọ ẹkùn-un Sàárẹ́ .
meaning: An immoderate display of knowledge soon backfires.

proverbs: Àpáàdì ló tó ko iná lójú.
meaning: Only a person capable of facing a situation should take it on.

proverbs: Apatapara-á pa ara-a rẹ̀ lájùbà; ẹni tí yó ko là ń wòye.
meaning: One should not outstrip one’s help.

proverbs: Àpò tí a kò fi ọwọ́ ẹni dá ṣòro-ó kiwọ́ bọ̀.
meaning: One should keep one’s hands in one’s own pockets.

proverbs: Ará Ìbàdàn kì í ságun; à ó rìn s hìn ni wọ́n ń wí.
meaning: There are ways of avoiding battle without seeming to do so.

proverbs: À-rí-ì-gbọdọ̀-wí, à-rí-ì-gbọdọ̀-fọ̀ ni ikú awo.
meaning: The eyes sometimes see things that are too sacred for the mouth to mention.

proverbs: Àrísá iná, àkòtagìrì ejò; àgbà tó réjò tí kò sá, ara ikú ló ń yá a.
meaning: Fire and snakes are not things to take lightly, and elders should not be embarrassed to flee from danger.

proverbs: Àròkàn ní ń mú à-sun-ùn-dá wá; ẹlẹ́kún sunkún ẹ̀ ó lọ.
meaning: If one keeps thinking sad thoughts, one will ever remain miserable; if one must be sad, one must observe some limits.

proverbs: Arọ ò n asẹ̀ kan dí ọ̀nà.
meaning: A person with a handicap should not challenge those who are not handicapped.

proverbs: Arọ tí kò lẹ́sẹ̀ nílẹ̀-ẹ́ lọ́gbọ́n nínú.
meaning: Whatever one’s handicaps, one will have some asset.

proverbs: Arọ́basá ò ṣojo.
meaning: One’s safest course is to steer clear of those in authority.

proverbs: Arúgbó ṣoge rí; àkísà-á lògbà rí.
meaning: Those who are favored should remember that times and circumstances do change.

proverbs: Àrùn là ń wo; a kì í wokú.
meaning: We should attend to problems before they become unmanageable.

proverbs: Asárétete ní ń kọjá ilé; arìngbẹ̀rẹ̀ ni yó rìí oyè jẹ.
meaning: A fast start does not guarantee success.

proverbs: Àṣá ń bá ẹyẹlé ṣeré, ẹyẹlé ń yọ̀; ẹyẹlé ń fikú ṣeré.
meaning: An enemy who pretends friendship is even more dangerous.

proverbs: Àṣàyá kì í jẹ́ kí ọmọ ọ̀yà ó gbọ́n.
meaning: A person who takes life as a jest does not learn to be wary.

proverbs: Àṣesílẹ̀ làbọ̀wábá; ẹni tó da omi síwájú á tẹlẹ̀ tútù.
meaning: One reaps what one sows.

proverbs: Àṣẹ̀ṣẹ̀wọ́n ológbò ní ń jìyà; bó bá pẹ́ títí a tó eku-ú pa.
meaning: A child may be helpless today but not in the future.

proverbs: Aṣòroówọ̀ bí ẹ̀wù àṣejù.
meaning: Wearing the cloak of immoderation exposes one to difficulties.

proverbs: Ata-á kéré; ìjá jù ú.
meaning: One should not judge people by their size.

proverbs: Ataare-é rẹ́ni tún ìdí-i rẹ̀ ṣe ó ń fi òbùró ṣẹ̀sín; òbùró ìbá r ni tún ìdí-i rẹ̀ ṣe a sunwọ̀n jú ataare lọ.
meaning: A person enjoying a run of good fortune should not deride the less fortunate; if they had been similarly favored, there is no telling what they might have accomplished.

proverbs: Atàkò fọ́ ẹyin àparò: ohun ojú ń wá lojú ńrí.
meaning: The culprit is asking for trouble, and he will not be disappointed.

proverbs: Atẹ̀hìnrọ́gbọ́n agétí ajá; a gé e létí tán ó fabẹ pamọ́.
meaning: Prevention makes sense only before the disaster.

proverbs: Àtẹ́lẹwọ́ ẹni kì í tanni.
meaning: One’s trust is best placed in one’s own resources.

proverbs: Atọrọ-ohungbogbo-lọ́wọ́-Ọlọ́run kì í kánjú.
meaning: The supplicant must be patient for an answer.

proverbs: Àwòfín ní ń mú ọ̀rẹ́ bàjẹ́ ; fírí là ń wo ẹni tí ń woni.
meaning: A battle of looks does not help a friendship.

proverbs: Ayáraròhìn, aya ọdẹ, ó ní ọkọ òun-ún pa èkínní, ó pa ẹ̀kẹfà.
meaning: The impatient reporter is likely to outstrip her report.

proverbs: Àyé gba ògùnmọ̀ ó ránṣẹ́ sí òdú; àyé gba Tápà ó kọ́lé ìgunnu.
meaning: When one enjoys a life of ease, one is tempted to overreach.

proverbs: Ayé ò ṣéé fipá jẹ.
meaning: Life demands caution.

proverbs: ‘‘Bá mi mádìẹ’’ kì í fi orúnkún bó.
meaning: Overzealousness in helping others is a fault.

proverbs: Baálé ilé kú, wọ́n fi olókùnrùn rọ́lé; ẹkún ń gorí ẹkún.
meaning: People known to be unsuitable should not be entrusted with important affairs.

proverbs: ‘‘Baálé pè mí n kò wá,’’ ọ̀hànhàn ní ń pa wọ́n.
meaning: A person who defies his or her main succor heads for ruin.

proverbs: Bánú sọ, má bàá èèyàn sọ; èèyàn ò sí; ayé ti dèké.
meaning: There is no one to trust but oneself.

proverbs: Bí a bá bu ìrẹ̀ jẹ, ká bu ìrẹ̀ sápò.
meaning: Even if one has only a little, one should still save something for the morrow.

proverbs: Bí a bá bú ọba, à sẹ́; bí a bá bú ọ̀ṣọ̀run, à sẹ́ .
meaning: One may disdain authority, but should not expose oneself to punishment for doing so.

proverbs: Bí a bá bu ọba tí a sẹ́, ọba a fini sílẹ.
meaning: One should not be held accountable for an insult one recants.

proverbs: Bí a bá dákẹ́, tara ẹni a báni dákẹ́ .
meaning: If one does not disclose one’s problems, one can expect no help.

proverbs: Bí a bá fa àgbò féégún,àfiokùn-un rẹ̀ sílẹ̀.
meaning: When one has made a gift of something, one should forget about it.

proverbs: Bí a bá f ràn ọ̀rẹ́ ẹni láfẹ̀ẹ́jù, bó bá forígbún, ìjà níńdà.
meaning: Friendship that knows no limits is a burden.

proverbs: Bí a bá fi dídùn họ ifàn, a ó họra dé eegun.
meaning: Even pleasures should be pursued in moderation.

proverbs: Bí a bá fi ojú igi gbígbẹ wo tútù, tútù-ú lè wó pani.
meaning: One should be alive to the peculiarities of whatever situations one finds oneself in.

proverbs: Bí a bá fi ọdún mẹ́ta pilẹ̀ṣẹ̀-ẹ wèrè, ọjọ́ wo la ó bunijẹ?
meaning: Preparations for an action should not be endless.

proverbs: Bí a bá fi ọdún mẹ́ta ṣánpá, ọdún mélòó la ó fi fò?
meaning: Preparations for an action should not be interminable.

proverbs: Bí a bá fi ọwọ́ kan fọmọ fọ́kọ, ọwọ́ mẹ́wẹ̀ẹ̀wá kì í ṣeé gbà á mọ́.
meaning: Mistakes made casually are seldom easy to correct.

proverbs: Bí a bá lé ẹni, tí a kò bá ẹni, ìwọ̀n là ń bá ẹni-í ṣọ̀tá mọ.
meaning: Envy should not turn into hatred.

proverbs: Bí a bá ní ká b igi, a ó bẹ̀ẹ́ èèyàn.
meaning: If one behaved toward certain people as they deserve, one would offend innocent people.

proverbs: Bí a bá ní ká jẹ èkuru kó tán, a kì í gbọn ọwọ́-ọ rẹ̀ sáwo.
meaning: If one wishes a quarrel to end, one does not keep recalling its cause.

proverbs: Bí a bá ń jà, bí í kákú là ń wí?
meaning: Quarrels should stop short of death wishes.

proverbs: Bí a bá ń retí òfò, ká fi ohun tọrẹ.
meaning: Rather give things away than lose them.

proverbs: Bí a bá perí ajá, ká perí ìkòkò tí a ó fi sè é.
meaning: If one proposes a momentous action, one should also consider the consequences.

proverbs: Bí a bá róbìnrin à lérí ogun; bí a bá róbìnrin à sọ̀rọ̀ ìjà; bí a dé ojú ogun à ba búbú.
meaning: Before women, one protects one’s image; in battle, one protects one’s life.

proverbs: Bí a bá sọ pé ẹyẹ ni yó jẹ ojú ẹni, bí a rí tí-ń-tín, a ó máa sá lọ.
meaning: Given prior warning of a peril, take extraordinary precautions.

proverbs: Bí a bá sọ̀kò sí àárín ọjà, ará ilé ẹni ní ń bà.
meaning: Random acts of wickedness are likely to affect those close to one.

proverbs: Bí a bá sọ̀rọ̀ fún olófòófó, ajádìí agbọ̀n la sọ ọ́ sí.
meaning: Words whispered to a talebearer are in effect broadcast.

proverbs: Bí a bá ṣí ìdí ẹni sókè, ọmọ aráyé á rọ omi gbígbóná sí i.
meaning: If one exposes one’s vulnerability to people, one will be done in.

proverbs: Bí a bá wí a dàbí òwe; bí a ò bá wí a dàbí ìjà.
meaning: In certain delicate situations no option is safe.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá láyà-a rìndọ̀rìndọ̀, a kì í jẹ aáyán.
meaning: One should avoid things one cannot stomach.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá lè kú, ìpẹ̀ là ń gbà.
meaning: Unless you want to die of grieving, allow yourself to be consoled.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá lè mú ọkọ, a kì í na obìnrin-in rẹ̀.
meaning: Never provoke a fight you cannot fight.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá lówó aládìn-ín, à jẹun lójúmọmọ, à gbálẹ̀ sùn wàrà.
meaning: One’s plans and actions should fit one’s resources.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá ní èsè ẹ̀fà, a kì í kó iṣu òje.
meaning: One’s aspirations should match one’s means.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá rí wọlé-wọ̀de a ò gbọdọ̀ wọlé ọba.
meaning: Always ask leave before venturing into another person’s domain.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá rígún, à fàkàlà ṣẹbọ.
meaning: One makes do with what one has.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá ṣe fún ilẹ̀, a kì í fi ọwọ́ sọ ọ́.
meaning: One cannot expect sustenance where one has not cultivated.

proverbs: Bí a kò rówó ra ẹrú, à sọ adìẹ ẹni lórúkọ.
meaning: One should somehow make do with what one has and be content.

proverbs: Bí a ó ti ṣe é ní ń fi ara-a rẹ̀ hàn.
meaning: The way to accomplish a task will always reveal itself.

proverbs: Bí aáṣẹ́ bá ti ń fò, bẹ́ẹ̀ la ti ń sọ̀kò sí i.
meaning: One responds according to the situation one is confronted with.

proverbs: Bí adìẹ́ bá gbélẹ̀ a ya òpìpì.
meaning: Whatever endowment one has, one loses it if one neglects it.

proverbs: Bí àjànàkú ò bá gbẹ́kẹ̀lé fùrọ̀, kì í mi òdù àgbọn.
meaning: Unless one can cope with the consequences, one does not engage in an action.

proverbs: Bí àjẹ́ bá mupo, ojú-u rẹ̀ a rọ̀.
meaning: After one has achieved one’s goal, one should relax.

proverbs: Bí alágbára-á bá jẹ ọ́ níyà, fẹ̀rín sí i.
meaning: Never protest against victimization by one against whom you can do nothing.

proverbs: Bí alágẹmọ-ọ́ bá fẹ́ẹ́ kọjá, ìjàm̀pere ò ní-í jà.
meaning: The cautious person is immune to the dangers that beset others.

proverbs: Bí al bá lẹ́, adẹ́tẹ̀ a rìn, a yan.
meaning: Night is a welcome cloak for blemishes.

proverbs: Bí àṣá bá ń bínú, sùúrù ló yẹ ọlọ́jà.
meaning: One must learn forbearance in the face of provocation.

proverbs: Bí awó ti ń lù lawó ti ń jó.
meaning: One’s actions are best suited to the circumstances.

proverbs: Bí bàtá bá ró àrójù, yíya ní ń ya.
meaning: Excess leads to disaster.

proverbs: Bí ekòló bá kọ ebè, ara-a rẹ̀ ni yó gbìn sí i.
meaning: The consequences of a person’s actions will fall on that person’s own head.

proverbs: Bí èṣù ikú bá ń ṣe ìgbín nìgbín ń yẹ́yin.
meaning: A person who knows an action will be disastrous but carries it out anyway deserves what he gets.

proverbs: Bí ẹjá bá sùn, ẹja á fi ẹja jẹ.
meaning: If one does not wish to be taken advantage of, one must be ever watchful.

proverbs: Bí ẹlẹ́hìnkùlé ò sùn, à pẹ́ lẹ́hìnkùlé-e rẹ̀ títí; bó pẹ́ títí orun a gbé onílé lọ.
meaning: Patience accomplishes all ends.

proverbs: Bí ẹlẹ́jọ́ bá mọ ẹjọ́-ọ rẹ̀ lẹ́bi, kì í pẹ́ níkùnúnlẹ̀.
meaning: Penitence invites leniency.

proverbs: Bí ẹnìkán bá fojú di Orò, Orò a gbé e.
meaning: Whoever disdains potential dangers eventually pays for the disdain.

proverbs: Bí ẹnìkán ṣe ohun tí ẹnìkan ò ṣe rí, ojú-u rẹ̀ á rí ohun tí ẹnìkan ò rí rí.
meaning: Those who do unusual things should expect unusual consequences.

proverbs: Bí ìdí ìkokò kò bá dá a lójú, kì í gbé egungun mì.
meaning: One should not attempt a thing whose repercussions one cannot withstand.

proverbs: Bí ìfà bí ìfà lọmọdé fi ń dáràn wọlé.
meaning: A youth seldom realizes what actions will involve his household in trouble.

proverbs: Bí ilé bá dá, adẹ́tẹ̀ a rìn, a yan.
meaning: When one is unobserved, one does as one pleases.

proverbs: Bí ìlùú bá dún àdúnjù, yó fàya.
meaning: Disaster follows excess.

proverbs: Bí iná bá jóni, tó jó ọmọ ẹni, tara ẹni là ń kọ́ gbọ̀n.
meaning: Without first attending to one’s own needs, one cannot attend to those of others.

proverbs: Bí iṣu ẹní bá funfun, à fọwọ́ bò ó jẹ.
meaning: It would be unwise to flaunt good fortune.

proverbs: Bí kò bá sí oníṣẹ́ iṣẹ́ ò leè lọ; bí kò bá sí ọlọ́wẹ̀ a kì í ṣọ̀wẹ̀; àkẹ̀hìnsí ọlọ́wẹ̀ là ń ṣípá.
meaning: The employee is most industrious under the supervision of the employer.

proverbs: Bí o máa ra ilá ra ilá, bí o máa gba ènì gba ènì; ọmọdé kì í wá sọ́jà Agbó-mẹ́kùn kó wá mú eku.
meaning: One’s deeds should be appropriate to the location.

proverbs: Bí obìnrín bá wọgbó Orò, a ò lè rí àbọ̀-ọ ẹ̀ mọ́.
meaning: Any person who engages in forbidden action courts destruction.

proverbs: Bí ògbó ẹni ò bá dánilójú, a kìífigbárí wò.
meaning: One should not swear by something about which one is not certain.

proverbs: Bí ojú alákẹdun ò dá igi, kì í gùn ún.
meaning: One should not embark on projects one cannot accomplish.

proverbs: Bí ojú onísó ò bá sunwọ̀n, a kì í lọ̀ ọ́.
meaning: Do not incite a person who is spoiling for a fight.

proverbs: Bí ológbò-ó bá pa eku,a fi ìrù-u rẹ̀ dẹlé.
meaning: One should save something of one’s fortune for the future.

proverbs: Bí ológbò-ó bá ṣẹ̀ ń pa ẹmọ́, à mọ̀ pé ó máa lọ.
meaning: A person who embarks on improper behavior invites ostracism.

proverbs: Bí olówe-é bá mọ òwe-e rẹ̀, tí kò já a, ẹ̀rù ìjà ń bà á ni.
meaning: A person who has reason to take offense but does not is avoiding a fight.

proverbs: Bí òní ti rí, ọ̀la ò rí bẹ́ẹ̀; ni babaláwo-ó fi ń dÍfá lọ́rọọrún.
meaning: Since no one knows the future, one must constantly reassess one’s decisions.

proverbs: Bí oníṣú bá fi iṣu-u rẹ̀ se ẹ̀bẹ́ , ọgbọ́n a tán nínú a-tu-èèpo-jẹ.
meaning: If the perennial victim learns to protect himself, the victimizer is stumped.

proverbs: Bí ooré bá pọ̀ lápọ̀jù, ibi ní ń dà.
meaning: There can be too much of even a good thing.

proverbs: Bí òwe ò bá jọ òwe, a kì í pa á.
meaning: One’s comparisons should be apt.

proverbs: Bí ọmọ ẹní bá dára, ká sọ pé ó dára; bí-i ká fi ṣaya ẹni kọ́.
meaning: However much one is attracted to a forbidden thing, one must avoid it.

proverbs: Bí ọmọdé bá dárí sọ apá, apá á pá; bó bá dárí sọ ìrókò, ìrókò a kò ó lọ́nà.
meaning: Whoever incites a terrible force to fight will rue his folly.

proverbs: Bí ọmọdé ò rí àjẹkù-u kìnìún nínú igbó, a ní kí ẹran bí ẹkùn ó pa òun.
meaning: One is likely to disdain forces the extent of whose powers one is ignorant of.

proverbs: Bí ọ̀nà-á dé orí àpáta, níṣe ní ń pin.
meaning: When an insurmountable obstacle intervenes, efforts must stop.

proverbs: Bí ọ̀ràn-án bá ṣú òkùnkùn, à bẹ̀ ẹ́ wò lábẹ́ .
meaning: If the facts of a matter are a close secret, one should quietly investigate it.

proverbs: Bí ọ̀ràn ò tán, ibì kan là ń gbé; arékété lohun ń ṣe.
meaning: One should await the outcome of a confused situation before taking further action.

proverbs: Bí ọtí bá kún inú, ọtí á pọmọ; bí oòrùn-ún bá pọ̀ lápọ̀jù a sọ ọmọ di wèrè; bí a bá lọ́ba lánìíjù a sínni níwín; tẹ̀tẹ̀ ẹ̀gún pọ̀ lódò o di olú eri.
meaning: Excess in anything is evil.

proverbs: Bí ọwọ́ ò bá tẹ èkù idà, a kì í bèrè ikú tó pa baba ẹni.
meaning: Until one is able, one should not attempt to right an injustice.

proverbs: Bíbi là ń bi odò wò ká tó wọ̀ ọ́.
meaning: One must study well any situation before becoming involved in it.

proverbs: Bọ̀rọ̀kìnní àṣejù, oko olówó ni ń múni lọ.
meaning: Excessive trendiness depletes a person’s resources.

proverbs: Bọ̀rọ̀kìnnín lọ̀tá ìlú; afínjú lọba ń pa.
meaning: The people of a town may envy a dandy, but it is the reckless person who comes to grief.

proverbs: Dàda ò leè jà, ṣùgbọ́n ó lábùúrò tó gbójú.
meaning: One who may not be able to do much has relatives to take up his cause.

proverbs: Dágun-dágun Kaletu tí ń dá ìbejì lápá.
meaning: A person who provokes someone with powerful champions is a troublemaker.

proverbs: Dá-mìíràn-kún-mìíràn tí ń pa àpatà ẹyẹlé.
meaning: Refers to a hardened criminal who piles crimes on crimes.

proverbs: Dàńdógó kọjá ẹ̀wù àbínúdá; bí a bá ko ẹni tó juni lọ, a yàgò fún un.
meaning: One should know one’s limits.

proverbs: Dá-nǹkan-dá-nǹkan, tí kì í dáṣọ̀, tí kì í dẹ́wù.
meaning: What a troublemaker brings is trouble, never anything useful.

proverbs: Èèyan má-jẹ̀ẹ́ -kí-èèyàn-kú ń bẹ níbòmí ràn; bó-le-kú-ó-kú ǹ bẹ nílé-e wa.
meaning: It is not our way to stop people bent on destroying themselves. Also, we do have evil people in our home.

proverbs: Èèyàn-án ní òun ó bà ọ́ jẹ́ o ní kò tó bẹ́ẹ̀; bí ó bá ní o ò nùdí, ẹni mélòó lo máa fẹ fùrọ̀ hàn?
meaning: No one is immune to malicious defamation.

proverbs: Èké tan-ni síjà ẹkùn, ó fi ọrán ṣíṣ sápó ẹni.
meaning: It is dangerous to follow a devious person’s counsel.

proverbs: Eku ò gbọdọ̀ ná ọjà tí ológìnní dá.
meaning: One should not deliberately court disaster.

proverbs: Eku tí yó pa ológìnní ò níí dúró láyé.
meaning: It is foolhardy to take on powers that can destroy you.

proverbs: ‘‘Èmi ló lòní, èmi ló lọ̀la’’ lọmọdé fi ń dígbèsè.
meaning: Lack of foresight leads to disaster

proverbs: Èmi ò wá ikún inú agbè fi jiyán; ṣùgbọ́n bíkún bá yí sínú agbè mi mo lè fi jiyán.
meaning: I will not steal, but neither will I refuse a lucky find.

proverbs: Èpè-é pọ̀ ju ohun tó nù; ab r sọnù wọ́n lọ gbé Ṣàǹgó.
meaning: One’s reaction to a situation should be commensurate to it.

proverbs: Èpè-é pọ̀ ju ohun tó nù lọ; abẹ́rẹ́ sọnù a gbé ṣẹ́ẹ́rẹ́ síta.
meaning: One should not overreact to events.

proverbs: Eré-e kí lajá ń bá ẹkùn ṣe?
meaning: One should know better than to court disaster.

proverbs: Èrò kì í jẹ́wọ́-ọ ‘‘Mo tà tán.’’
meaning: People are ever loath to disclose the extent of their good fortune.

proverbs: Eṣinṣin ò mọkú; jíjẹ ni tirẹ̀.
meaning: The fly will persist in attacking an open sore, heedless of death; nothing will keep an addict from the thing he or she is addicted to.

proverbs: Èṣù ò ṣejò; ẹni tó tẹ ejò mọ́lẹ̀ lẹ̀bá ń bá.
meaning: It is not the snake inadvertently stepped on that is in peril; it is the person who inadvertently steps on the snake.

proverbs: Etí mẹ́ta ò yẹ orí; èèyàn m ta ò dúró ní méjì-méjì.
meaning: Good things are not good in all situations; one can have too much of a good thing.

proverbs: Ewú logbó; irùngbọ̀n làgbà; máamú làfojúdi.
meaning: One’s appearance in a group sometimes indicates one’s attitude toward the group.

proverbs: Ewúrẹ́ jẹ ó relé; àgùntán jẹ ó relé; à-jẹ-ì wálé ló ba ẹlẹ́dẹ̀ jẹ́ .
meaning: There is nothing wrong with traveling, as long as one knows when to go home.

proverbs: Ewúrẹ́ kì í wọlé tọ ìkokò.
meaning: Never knowingly put yourself in harm’s way.

proverbs: Èyí ayé ń ṣe n kà ṣàì ṣe; bádìẹ- máa wọ ọ̀ọ̀dẹ̀ a bẹ̀rẹ̀.
meaning: One should not violate established custom.

proverbs: Èyí ò tófò, èyí ò tófò: fìlà ìmàle-é kù pẹ́tẹ́kí.
meaning: If one keeps dispensing one’s property only a little at a time, soon little will be left.

proverbs: Ẹ pa Ayéjẹ́nkú, ẹ pa Ìyálóde Aníwúrà; ìgbà tí ẹ pa Ìyápọ̀ ẹ gbàgbé ogun.
meaning: Past misbehaviors might have gone unpunished, but the latest will have dire repercussions.

proverbs: Ẹ̀bi alábaun kì í gbèé dẹ̀bi àna-a rẹ̀.
meaning: Incommensurate retaliation soon transfers public sympathy from the aggrieved person to the culprit.

proverbs: Ẹ̀bìtì ò peèrà tó ṣe pẹ̀lẹ́pẹ̀lẹ́ ; ẹnu ẹni ní ń pani.
meaning: The cautious will live long on the earth; the incautious engineers his or her own death.

proverbs: Ẹ̀bìtì tí ò kún ẹmọ́ lójú, òun ní ń yí i lẹ́pọ̀n sẹ́hìn.
meaning: Dangers that one belittles are likely to cause great havoc.

proverbs: Ẹ̀ẹ̀kan ṣoṣo lọmọ ń sín tí à ńní ‘‘à-sín gbó, à-sín-tọ́.’’
meaning: Casual responses are appropriate only for minor difficulties; if the difficulties grow serious, more appropriate measures must be adopted.

proverbs: Ẹ̀gbá mọ̀dí Ọbà; ẹni tó gbéniṣánlẹ̀-ẹ́ lè pani.
meaning: Whoever holds a person’s secret has some power over that person, just as the wrestler who can throw his opponents can probably also kill him.

proverbs: Ẹgbẹ́ ẹja lẹja ń wẹ̀ tọ̀; ẹgbẹ̀ ẹyẹ lẹyẹ ń wọ́ lé.
meaning: One should seek and keep the company of people of one’s own station.

proverbs: Ẹ̀hìn àjànàkú là ń yọ ogbó; ta ní jẹ́ yọ agada lójú erin?
meaning: One can be brave after the danger has been removed.

proverbs: Ẹ̀hìn ní ń dun ol-ókùú-àdá sí.
meaning: A person who does not make adequate preparations for a task or test will rue his or her negligence.

proverbs: Ẹ̀kọ tí kò bá léwé làgbà ń gbà.
meaning: One who is careless with one’s property is likely to lose it.

proverbs: Ẹkùn kì í yan kí ajá yan.
meaning: One should recognize danger and avoid it.

proverbs: Ẹlẹ́dẹ̀ tó kú légbodò ló ní ká fòun jẹyán.
meaning: If one puts oneself in harm’s way, one deserves what one gets.

proverbs: Ẹlẹ́jọ́ kú sílé, aláròyé kú síta gbangba.
meaning: The busybody’s fate is worse than that of the person involved in the affair.

proverbs: Ẹlẹ́kún sunkún ó bá tirẹ̀ lọ; aláròpa ìbá sunkún kò dákẹ́ .
meaning: One should not keep harping on one’s injuries.

proverbs: Ẹlẹ́rù ní ń gbé ẹrù ká tó ba ké ọfẹ.
meaning: Only those who make an effort on their own behalf deserve help from others.

proverbs: Ẹ̀lúlùú, ìwọ ló fòjò pa ara-à rẹ.
meaning: Whatever your difficulty is, you brought it on yourself.

proverbs: Ẹni àjò ò pé kó múra ilé.
meaning: One should know when it is time to go home.

proverbs: Ẹní bá f abuké ni yó ru ọmọ-ọ rẹ̀ dàgbà.
meaning: One who knowingly gets himself or herself into a difficulty will bear the consequences.

proverbs: Ẹní bá fẹ́ arúgbó gbẹ̀hìn ni yó sìnkú-u rẹ̀.
meaning: One should weigh the obligations an enterprise will entail before embarking on it.

proverbs: Ẹní bá mọ ayé-é jẹ kì í gun àgbọn.
meaning: Whoever cares about his or her welfare does not live dangerously.

proverbs: Ẹní bá mọ ayé-é jẹ kì í jà.
meaning: The best way to enjoy life is to avoid conflict.

proverbs: Ẹní bá mọ iṣin-ín jẹ a mọ ikú ojú-u rẹ̀-ẹ́ yọ̀.
meaning: One should be sure of one’s capabilities before attempting dangerous feats.

proverbs: Ẹní bá na Ọ̀yẹ̀kú á ríjà Ogbè.
meaning: If one assaults a protected person, one should be prepared to answer to his or her protector.

proverbs: Ẹní bá pé kí àkàlà má jòkú, ojú-u rẹ̀ lẹyẹ ń kọ́kọ́ yọ jẹ.
meaning: Whoever tries to prevent the inevitable will be trampled in the process of its occurring.

proverbs: Ẹní bá rọra pa eèrà á rí ìfun inú-u rẹ̀.
meaning: One must handle delicate matters carefully.

proverbs: Ẹní bá sọ púpọ̀ á ṣìsọ.
meaning: It is best to be a person of few words.

proverbs: Ẹní bẹni-í t ni.
meaning: A beseecher places the beseeched at risk of losing face.

proverbs: Ẹní dáríjiní ṣèté ẹjọ́.
meaning: Once the aggrieved person is pacified, there is no further point in pursuing the case.

proverbs: Ẹní dúró de erín dúró dekú; ẹní dúró dẹfọ̀n-ọ́n dúró dèjà; ẹní dúró de eégún alágangan, ọ̀run ló fẹ́-ẹ́ lọ.
meaning: Whoever sees trouble approaching and does not flee courts disaster.

proverbs: Ẹní fi ìpọ́njú kọ ẹyìn á kọ àbọ̀n; ẹní fi ìpọ́njú rojọ́ á jẹ̀bi ọba; ẹní fi ìpọ́njú lọ gbẹ́ ìhò á gbẹ́ ihò awọ́nrínwọ́n.
meaning: Nothing turns out well if done in desperation. Easy does it.

proverbs: Ẹní gúnyán kalẹ̀ yóò júbà ọbẹ̀.
meaning: The prudent person cultivates the source of what he or she needs.

proverbs: Ẹní gbé adíẹ òtòṣì-í gbé ti aláròyé.
meaning: One should choose one’s adversaries with prudence.

proverbs: Ẹní kánjú jayé á kánjú lọ sọ́run.
meaning: Patience is what life calls for.

proverbs: Ẹni méjì kì í bínú egbinrin.
meaning: If there is to be any hope of ending a quarrel, at least one of the parties must be willing to make up.

proverbs: Ẹni òyìnbó f ràn ní ńtì mọ́lé.
meaning: Whoever becomes too friendly with a white man deserves what the white man does to him. A favorite, being more likely to take liberties with his or her benefactor, is more likely to get in trouble than the unfavored.

proverbs: Ẹní ṣe ọ̀ràn Ìjẹ̀bú: etí ẹ̀ á gbọ́ ìbọn.
meaning: If one incites a bellicose person, one asks for trouble.

proverbs: Ẹni tí a bá ń bá ṣiṣẹ́ kì í ṣọ̀lẹ; bórí bá túnni ṣe a kì í tẹ́ bọ̀rọ̀.
meaning: One should make the most of unexpected good fortune and not squander the opportunity it presents.

proverbs: Ẹni tí a bá ń mú ìyàwó bọ̀ wá fún kì í garùn.
meaning: One should not be unduly impatient for what is coming toward one anyway.

proverbs: Ẹni tí a bá ti rí kì í tún ba mọ́lẹ̀ mọ́.
meaning: Once the damage is done, prevention comes too late.

proverbs: Ẹni tí a fẹ́-ẹ́ sunjẹ kì í fepo para lọ jókòó sídìí iná.
meaning: One should not facilitate one’s own undoing.

proverbs: Ẹni tí a lù lógbòó mẹ́fà, tí a ní kó fiyèdénú: ìgbà tí kò fiyèdénú ńkọ́?
meaning: A victim with no access to any remedy needs no advice to let matters drop.

proverbs: Ẹni tí a ò lè mú, a kì í gọ dè é.
meaning: Pick fights only with those over whom you can prevail.

proverbs: Ẹni tí a ò lè mú, Ọlọ́run là ń fi lé lọ́wọ́.
meaning: If your adversary is too much for you, let God attend to him or her.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ń sáré kiri nínú-u pápá ń wá ọ̀nà àti jìn sí kòtò.
meaning: Reckless action can lead to disaster.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ó bá mu ọtí ogójì á sọ̀rọ̀ okòó.
meaning: A little wine opens the way for even less information.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ó bá obìnrin kó lọ sílé-e rẹ̀ yó sùn nínú ẹ̀rù.
meaning: Illicit acts carried on indiscreetly are attended by great anxiety.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ó ba ogún-un baba rẹ̀ jẹ́ , ó ja òkú ọ̀run lólè, yó sì di ẹni ìfibú.
meaning: We must keep faith with our ancestral heritage.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ó bá wọ odò ni àyà ń kò, àyà ò fo odò.
meaning: It is the person who takes on an invincible adversary, not the adversary, who has a problem.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ò f wọ àkísà kì í bá ajá ṣe eré-e géle.
meaning: People should avoid situations that might earn them disgrace.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ó jìn sí kòtò-ó kọ́ ará ìyókù lọ́gbọ́n.
meaning: One learns from the experiences of those who have gone before.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ó mú u lórí ní ó kú, ìwọ tí o mú u lẹ́sẹ̀-ẹ́ ní ó ń jòwèrè.
meaning: Novices should not presume to be more knowledgeable than the experts.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ó tọ odò tí kò dẹ̀hìn yò bàá Olúwẹri pàdé.
meaning: Whoever persists in courting danger will eventually find it.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ò tóni-í nà ò gbọdọ̀ ṣe kọ́-ń-dú síni.
meaning: People should not challenge forces they cannot withstand.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ó yá ẹgbàafà tí kò san án, ó bẹ́gi dí ọ̀nà egbèje.
meaning: A person who defaults in little things does himself or herself out of the opportunity for larger benefits.

proverbs: Ẹni tí Orò-ó máa mú ń ba wọn ṣe àìsùn Orò.
meaning: The intended victim innocently helps in making preparations for his or her own demise; if there is the slightest possibility of peril, one should not act carelessly.

proverbs: Ẹnìkan kì í fi ọ̀bẹ tó nù jẹṣu.
meaning: People are loath to admit they are at fault in any matter.

proverbs: Ẹnu ẹyẹ ní ń pẹyẹ; ẹnu òrofó ní ń pòrofó; òrofó bímọ mẹ́fà, ó ní ilé òun-ún kún ṣọ́ṣọ́ṣó.
meaning: To boast about good fortune is to invite predators.

proverbs: Ẹnu iná ní ń pa iná; ẹnu èrò ní ń pa èrò.
meaning: Reckless persons bring disaster on their heads by their own actions.

proverbs: Ẹnu ni àparò-ó fi ń pe ọ̀rá; a ní ‘‘Kìkì ọ̀rá, kìkì ọ̀rá!’’
meaning: Conspicuous display of one’s good fortune invites predators.

proverbs: Ẹnu òfòrò ní ń pa òfòrò; òfòrò-ó bímọ méjì, ó kó wọn wá s bàá ọ̀nà, ó ní ‘‘Ọmọ-ọ̀ mí yè koro-koro.’’
meaning: Excessive boasting about one’s good fortune invites predators.

proverbs: Ẹnu tí ìgbín fi bú òrìṣà ní ń fi-í lọlẹ̀ lọ bá a.
meaning: The person who insults a powerful person will in time eat his or her words before the person insulted.

proverbs: Ẹnu-ù mi kọ́ ni wọ́n ti máa gbọ́ pé ìyá ọba-á lájẹ̀ẹ́ .
meaning: I will not place myself in jeopardy by speaking dangerous truths; one should not acknowledge or comment on everything one sees.

proverbs: Ẹrẹ̀ òkèọ̀dàn ni yó kìlọ̀ fún aláròógbálẹ̀ aṣọ.
meaning: The thoughtless person will learn wisdom when his or her thoughtlessness comes home to roost.

proverbs: Ẹ̀rù kọ́ ní ń ba ọ̀pẹ tó ní ká dá òun sí, nítorí ẹmu ọ̀la ni.
meaning: What we have the good sense to preserve today will yield benefits for us in the future.

proverbs: Ẹṣin iwájú ni ti ẹ̀hìn ń wò sáré.
meaning: One takes example from those that have gone before.

proverbs: Ẹ̀sọ̀ ẹ̀sọ̀ la fi ń lá ọbẹ̀ tó gbóná.
meaning: The more dangerous the task, the greater the care required.

proverbs: Ẹ̀tẹ́ ní ń gbẹ̀hìn aláṣejù.
meaning: Lack of moderation results in disgrace.

proverbs: Ẹyẹ kí lo máa pa tí ò ń fi àkùkọ ṣe oògùn àtè?
meaning: It is unreasonable to expend something of great value in pursuit of something of lesser value.

proverbs: Ẹyin adìẹ ò gbọdọ̀ forí sọ àpáta.
meaning: It is unwise to take on forces one cannot withstand.

proverbs: Ẹyin lọ̀rọ̀; bó bá balẹ̀ fífọ́ ní ń fọ́.
meaning: Words are delicate things; once spoken, they cannot be retrieved.

proverbs: Fáàárí àṣejù, oko olówó ní ń mú ọmọ lọ.
meaning: Squandered resources bring destitution.

proverbs: Fẹ̀hìntì kí o rí ìṣe èké; farapamọ̀ kí o gbọ́ bí aṣeni-í ti ń sọ.
meaning: One must be cagey in order to learn the truth about unreliable people.

proverbs: Fi ẹ̀jẹ̀ sínú, tu itọ́ funfun jáde.
meaning: Never show your hand to your enemy or let your words or action reveal your intentions.

proverbs: Fi ohun wé ohun, fi ọ̀ràn wé ọ̀ràn; fi ọ̀ràn jì ká yìn ọ́.
meaning: Rather than permit an offense to recall earlier ones, one should forgive and forget.

proverbs: Fi ọ̀ràn sínú pète ẹ̀rín; fi ebi sínú sunkún ayo.
meaning: One should keep one’s woes to oneself and show a happy face to the world.

proverbs: Fò síhìn-ín fò sọ́hùn-ún làkèré fi ń ṣẹ́ nítan.
meaning: Restlessness lands people in trouble.

proverbs: Ganganran ò ṣéé kì mọ́lẹ̀; a-gúnni-lọ́wọ́-bíi-ṣoṣoro.
meaning: Dangerous things must be handled very carefully.

proverbs: Gìdì-gìdì ò mọ́là; ká ṣiṣ bí ẹrú ò da nǹkan.
meaning: One does not necessarily prosper by working oneself to death.

proverbs: Gùdùgudu ò túra sílẹ̀ lẹ́ẹ̀kan.
meaning: A certain person has never been known to be off his or her guard.

proverbs: Gùdùgudu-ú kan légbò kán-ín-kán-ín.
meaning: The subject is something one must stay away from, for encounter with it is unpleasant.

proverbs: ‘‘Gbà sókè’’ ni ‘‘Gbà sọ́kọ̀’’; ohun tá a bá sọ síwájú là ń bá.
meaning: One reaps the rewards of the good one sows.

proverbs: Gbéjò-gbéjò ò gbé ọká.
meaning: There are some perils even the bravest of people should not court.

proverbs: Gbẹ́ran-gb ran ò gbé ẹkùn.
meaning: There are some risks even the most brazen risk taker would be wise to avoid.

proverbs: Gbígbòòrò là ń ṣe ọ̀nà igi.
meaning: One should make provisions adequate for the task ahead.

proverbs: Gbogbo ajá ní ń jẹ imí: èyí tó bá jẹ tiẹ̀ bẹ́nu laráyé ń pè ní dìgbòlugi.
meaning: No one is without blemish, but one must keep one’s flaws within reasonable bounds.

proverbs: Gbogbo ìjà nìjà; bóo gbémi lulẹ̀ mà mọ́ ẹ lójú lákọ lákọ.
meaning: One must know one’s limitations, especially when up against insurmountable odds.

proverbs: Gbogbo obìnrin ló ń gbéṣẹ́ , èyí tó bá ṣe tiẹ̀ láṣejù laráyé ń pè láṣẹ́wó.
meaning: Nobody is without blemishes; the important thing is to keep them from getting out of hand.

proverbs: Gbólóhùn kan Agán tó awo-ó ṣe.
meaning: The truly competent person need not strain overmuch to accomplish much.

proverbs: Gbólóhùn kan la bi elépo; elépo ń ṣe ìrànrán.
meaning: A person plagued by a bad conscience makes endless excuses when asked simple questions.

proverbs: Gbólóhùn kan-án ba ọ̀rọ̀ jẹ̀; gbólóhùn kan-án tún ọ̀rọ̀ ṣe.
meaning: A single sentence can cause irreparable damage; a single sentence can also repair the greatest relational damage.

proverbs: Ìbẹ̀rẹ̀ òṣì bí ọmọ ọlọ́rọ̀ là ń rí.
meaning: A course of action that will lead to disaster often has a pleasant beginning.

proverbs: Ibi ìṣáná la ti ń kíyè sóògùn.
meaning: One should always match one’s vows with adequate preparation to effectuate them.

proverbs: Ibi rere làkàsọ̀-ọ́ ń gbé sọlẹ̀.
meaning: A prayer that one may always land at a fortunate place.

proverbs: Ibi tí a gbọ́n mọ là ń ṣòwò-o màlúù mọ.
meaning: Be careful not to put at risk more than you can afford, or to get in over your head.

proverbs: Ibi tí à ń lọ là ń wò, a kì í wo ibi tí a ti ṣubú.
meaning: The best course of action is not to dwell on setbacks but to face the future resolutely.

proverbs: Ibi tí a ti ń wo olókùnrùn la ti ń wo ara ẹni.
meaning: One should be as solicitous of one’s own welfare as of others’.

proverbs: Ibi tí akátá ba sí, adìẹ ò gbọdọ̀ débẹ̀.
meaning: Keep as clear of known dangers as possible.

proverbs: Ibi tí inú ń bí asẹ́ tó, inú ò gbọdọ̀ bí ìkòkò débẹ̀; bínú bá bí ìkòkò débẹ̀, ẹlẹ́kọ ò ní-í rí dá.
meaning: The more power one has, the more one should exercise restraint.

proverbs: Ibi tí ó mọ là ń pè lọ́mọ.
meaning: When one reaches the end of a matter, or the end of a road, one should acknowledge the end.

proverbs: Ìbínú baba òṣì.
meaning: Anger achieves no good but may backfire on whoever expresses it.

proverbs: Ìbínú lọbá fi ń yọ idà; ìtìjú ló fi ń bẹ́ ẹ.
meaning: Once one begins an injudicious action on impulse, one may have to carry it through to avoid embarrassment.

proverbs: Ìbínú ò da nǹkan; sùúrù baba ìwà; àgbà tó ní sùúrù ohun gbogbo ló ní.
meaning: Forbearance will avail one everything, whereas anger will always prove futile.

proverbs: Ìbínú ò mọ̀ pé olúwa òun ò lẹ́sẹ̀ ń lẹ̀.
meaning: Anger does not know prudence.

proverbs: Ìbìsẹ́hín àgbò kì í ṣojo.
meaning: One should not mistake for indecisiveness a person’s deliberateness before acting.

proverbs: Ìbọn-ọ́n ní apátí kò lápátí, taní jẹ́ jẹ́ ká kọjú ìbọn kọ òun?
meaning: One should not take foolish chances.

proverbs: Ì-dún-kídùn-ún òyo ni wọ́n fi ń sọ òyo nígi; ì-fọ̀-kúfọ̀ ògbìgbì ni wọ́n fi ń ta ògbìgbì lókò; ì-jẹ-kújẹ àdán ní ń fi-í tẹnu pọ̀ fẹnu ṣu.
meaning: A person’s mouth may be his or her death.

proverbs: Ìfẹ́ àfẹ́jù lewúrẹ́ fi ń bá ọko-ọ rẹ̀ hu irùngbọ̀n.
meaning: In all things, moderation is advisable.

proverbs: Ìfi ohun wé ohun, ìfi ọ̀ràn wé ọ̀ràn, kò j kí ọ̀ràn ó tán.
meaning: Refusal to forget the past prevents reconciliation.

proverbs: Ìfunra loògùn àgbà.
meaning: The person who is always wary will avoid much grief.

proverbs: Igi ganganran má gùn-ún mi lójú, òkèèrè la ti ń wò ó wá.
meaning: Don’t wait until problems arise before preparing to deal with them.

proverbs: Igi tó bá bá Ṣàngó lérí, gbígbẹ ní ń gbẹ.
meaning: Never take on an adversary too tough for you to handle.

proverbs: Igúnnugún gbọ́n sínú.
meaning: Even a person who appears foolish may be quite astute.

proverbs: Ìgbà ara ń bẹ lára là ń bù ú tà.
meaning: One makes a gift only of one’s surplus.

proverbs: Igbá dojúdé ò jọ ti òṣónú, tinú igbá nigbá ń ṣe.
meaning: One should not read evil intent into others’ innocent actions.

proverbs: Ìgbà tí a bá ní kí Ègùn má jà ní ń yọ̀bẹ.
meaning: Said of people who redouble their efforts belatedly, just when they are supposed to break off.

proverbs: Ìgbà tí a bá perí àparò ní ń jáko.
meaning: Said of a person who plays into his or her adversary’s hand just when the adversary most wants to injure him or her.

proverbs: Igbá tó fọ́ ní ń gba kasẹ létí; ìkòkò tó fọ́ ní ń gba okùn lọ́rùn.
meaning: It is the person who makes trouble who is visited with repercussions.

proverbs: Ìgbẹ̀hìn ní ń yé olókùúàdá.
meaning: Sometimes wisdom comes too late to salvage lost opportunities.

proverbs: Ìgbín ń ràjò ó filé ẹ̀ ṣẹrù.
meaning: Said of people who are overly possessive of their goods or turf.

proverbs: Ìgbín tó ń jẹ̀ ní màfọ̀n, tí ò kúrò ní màfọ̀n, ewé àfọ̀n ni wọn ó fi dì í dele.
meaning: One should know when to quit, or else one will wind up in trouble.

proverbs: Ìhàlè-é ba òṣó èèyàn jẹ́ .
meaning: One’s mouth should not be more powerful than one’s arms.

proverbs: Ìjẹǹjẹ àná dùn méhoro; ehoró rebi ìjẹ àná kò dẹ̀hìn bọ̀.
meaning: Persistence in risky ventures leads to disaster.

proverbs: Ìjímèrè tó lóun ò ní-í sá fájá, ojú ajá ni òì tí-ì to.
meaning: The coward may boast as much as he or she wishes, until the real test materializes.

proverbs: Ijó àjójù ní ń mú kí okó eégún yọ jáde.
meaning: One should exercise restraint in performing even pleasurable activities.

proverbs: Ìkánjú òun pẹ̀lẹ́, ọgbọọgba
meaning: Great haste offers no advantage over patience.

proverbs: Ìkekere ń fọ̀rọ̀ ikú ṣẹ̀rín.
meaning: One should not take serious or deadly matters lightly.

proverbs: Ìkóeruku èèwọ̀ Ifẹ̀; ajá kì í gbó níbòji ẹkùn.
meaning: One should not engage in forbidden or dangerous acts.

proverbs: Ìkòkò ń seṣu ẹnìkan ò gbọ́; iṣú dénú odó ariwó ta.
meaning: Matters disclosed only to prudent people can be contained, but once they leak to irresponsible persons, they become broadcast.

proverbs: Ìkókó ọmọ tó tọwọ́ bọ eérú ni yó mọ̀ bó gbóná.
meaning: Experience best teaches that one should avoid dangerous ventures.

proverbs: Ikú ń dẹ Dẹ̀dẹ̀, Dẹ̀dẹ̀ ń dẹ ikú.
meaning: Said of a person whom people are after but who does everything to become even more vulnerable.

proverbs: Ikún ń jọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ ikún ń rèdí; ikún ò mọ̀ pé ohun tó dùn ní ń pani.
meaning: Overindulgence in good things can result in serious problems.

proverbs: Ìlara àlàjù ní ń múni gbàjẹ́, ní ń múni ṣẹ́ṣó.
meaning: Too much envy leads to antisocial behavior.

proverbs: Ilé nÌjèṣà-á ti ń múná lọ sóko.
meaning: The wise person assembles all the materials needed before embarking on a venture.

proverbs: Iná kì í wọ odò kó rójú ṣayé.
meaning: Whoever ventures into dangerous situations deserves the repercussions.

proverbs: Iná ò ṣé-é bò máṣọ.
meaning: One should not hide one’s pressing problems but seek help.

proverbs: Ìnàkí kì í ránṣẹ́ ìjà sẹ́kùn.
meaning: People should not challenge forces they are no match for.

proverbs: Inú ẹni lorúkọ tí a ó sọ ọmọ ẹni ń gbé.
meaning: One should not broadcast one’s secrets to the whole world.

proverbs: Inúure àníjù, ìfunra atèébú ní ń mù wá báni.
meaning: One can be too good to others.

proverbs: Ìpàkọ́ là ń dà sẹ́hìn ká tó da yangan sẹ́nu.
meaning: One should not put the cart before the horse.

proverbs: Ìpàkọ́ ò gbọ́ ṣùtì, ìpẹ̀hìndà ò mọ yẹ̀gẹ̀ yíyẹ̀.
meaning: The best response to insults is to disregard them.

proverbs: Isà tí ò lójú Alalantorí ń dẹ ẹ́, áḿbọ̀ǹtorí àgbá ikún.
meaning: A person who watches his or her pennies is not likely to be careless with dollars.

proverbs: Isán ni à ń mọ olè; ìtàdógún là ń mọ dọ́kọ-dọ́kọ.
meaning: Bad habits can be kept secret only so long; they are eventually exposed.

proverbs: Ìṣẹ́ kì í pani; ayọ̀ ní ń pani.
meaning: Indulgence kills more surely than want.

proverbs: Iṣẹ́ tí a kò ránni, òun ìyà ló jọ ń rìn.
meaning: One usually rues doing things one has no business doing.

proverbs: Itọ́ tí a tu sílẹ̀ kì í tún padà re ẹnu ẹni mọ́.
meaning: Once one has said something, one cannot take it back.

proverbs: Ìtọ́jú ló yẹ abẹ́rẹ́.
meaning: One should pay special attention to matters that are very delicate.

proverbs: Ìtọsẹ̀ ló nìlú.
meaning: Investigating matters well before acting helps maintain harmony in a group.

proverbs: Ìwà òní, ẹjọ̀ ọ̀la.
meaning: The foolish behavior of the present sows the seeds of difficulties for the future.

proverbs: Ìyá là bá bú; bí a bú baba ìjà ní ń dà.
meaning: One should measure one’s insults in order to avoid a fight; a father is valued well over a mother.

proverbs: Iyán àmọ́dún bá ọbẹ̀.
meaning: Whenever one’s good fortune comes will be time enough to enjoy it.

proverbs: Iyán mú, ìrẹ́ yó; ìyàn-án rọ̀, ìrẹ́ rù.
meaning: One should husband one’s resources wisely and save for lean times in times of plenty.

proverbs: Ìyàwó la bá sùn; ọkọ ló lóyún.
meaning: The person directly involved in a matter does not make as much fuss as the person only tangentially involved.

proverbs: Ìyàwó ò fọhùn ó fọ́jú.
meaning: Persons newly arrived in a place or a company should shut their mouths and open their eyes so that they learn the customs before speaking.

proverbs: Ìyẹ̀wù kan ṣoṣo ò lè gba olókùnrùn méjì.
meaning: Make adequate provisions for whatever one contemplates doing.

proverbs: Já ewé ọ̀pọ̀tọ́ kí o ríjà eèrùn; jáwé bọ ẹnu kóo ríjà odi.
meaning: Whoever takes unnecessary risks will very likely face dangerous consequences.

proverbs: Jayé-jayé fi ẹ̀lẹ̀ jayé; báyé bá já kò ní àmúso.
meaning: One should observe moderation in all things.

proverbs: Jẹ kí o yó oògùn ni kò sunwọ̀n.
meaning: Anything without measure is dangerous.

proverbs: Jẹ ẹ́ kí ọmọ ó ti ọwọ́ ìyá ẹ̀ kú wá.
meaning: One should not become involved in the affairs of a person intent on his or her own ruin.

proverbs: Kàkà kí ó sàn lára ìyá àjẹ́, ó fi gbogbo ọmọ bí obìnrin; ẹye ń gorí ẹyẹ.
meaning: Despite all efforts, the fortunes of a person may continue to be bad.

proverbs: Kàkà kí ọmọ ó bẹ̀bẹ̀ ọ̀ràn, òmíràn ni kò ní-í ṣe mọ́.
meaning: One should look to the future and not dwell on past mistakes.

proverbs: Kànìké tìtorí oókan kùngb .
meaning: It makes no sense to lose control of oneself over trifling matters.

proverbs: Kékeré ejò, má foore ṣe é.
meaning: Better to be safe than sorry.

proverbs: Kékeré la ti ń pa ẹkàn ìrókò; bó bá dàgbà ọwọ́ kì í ká a mọ́.
meaning: One should take care of problems before they become unmanageable.

proverbs: Kékeré nìmàlé ti ńkọ́ ọmọ ẹ̀ lóṣòó.
meaning: One should do things in a timely manner.

proverbs: Kèrègbè tí kò lọ́rùn ni yóò júwe bí àgbẹ̀ ó ti so òun kọ́.
meaning: A difficult person prompts others as to the best way to handle him or her.

proverbs: Kèrègbè tó fọ́ a padà lẹ́hìn odò.
meaning: One should know when to stop pursuing an adversary.

proverbs: Kí a baà lè mọ̀ pé ìjàpá ṣe ògbóni, wọ́n ní ‘‘Káàbọ̀’’; ó ní ‘‘Awo àbí ọ̀gbẹ̀rì?’’
meaning: Said of those who unnecessarily flaunt their accomplishments.

proverbs: Kí a baà lè mọ̀ pé Wòrú pa awó, wọ́n ní ‘‘Káàbọ̀’’; ó ní ‘‘Kẹnkẹn làpò.’’
meaning: Said of people gratuitously proclaiming their accomplishments when no one is interested.

proverbs: Kí á fọn fèrè, ká jámú sí-i, ọ̀kan yóò gbélẹ̀.
meaning: No one can hope to perform two conflicting activities at the same time.

proverbs: Kí á jìnnà séjò tí a ò b lórí; ikú tí yó panni a jìnnà síni.
meaning: One should recognize dangerous situations and keep away from them.

proverbs: Kí á lé akátá jìnnà ká tó bá adìẹ wí.
meaning: Get rid of the immediate danger before reprimanding those who caused it.

proverbs: Kí a máa re tábà ká máa wòkè, kọ́jọ́ tó kanrí ká wo oye ìka tí yó kù.
meaning: One should pay close attention when one is engaged in dangerous work.

proverbs: Kí á ṣiṣẹ́ ká lówó lọ́wọ́ ò dàbí-i ká mọ̀-ọ ná.
meaning: Riches are nothing if one does not know how to use the wealth.

proverbs: Kí á ta sílẹ̀ ká ta s nu, ká má jẹ̀ẹ́ kí tilẹ̀ pọ̀ ju ti inú igbá lọ.
meaning: One should do one’s duty by others but not at the expense of providing for one’s future.

proverbs: Kí á tan iná pa agbọ́nrán, ká fọ̀pá gbọọrọ pejò, ká dìtùfù ká fi gbọ̀wẹ̀ lọ́wọ́-ọ Ṣàngó; ní ìṣojú-u Mádiyàn lagará ṣe ń dáni.
meaning: One should adopt the appropriate solution for every problem instead of engaging in long disputes.

proverbs: Kí á tó mọ̀ pé kíjìpá kì í ṣe awọ, ó di ọdún mẹ́ta.
meaning: It may take time, but one will eventually realize that no one is invulnerable to misfortune.

proverbs: Kì í bọ́ lọ́wọ́ èèyàn kó bọ́ sílẹ̀; ọwọ́ ẹlòmíràn ní ń bọ́ sí.
meaning: Other people always stand ready to appropriate whatever one carelessly lets slip through one’s fingers.

proverbs: Kì í ṣe ojú-u kọ̀lọ̀kọ̀lọ̀ ladì ti ń jẹ̀.
meaning: One would be foolish to let down one’s guard when one knows that danger is nearby.

proverbs: Kì í tán nígbá osùn kó má ba àlà jẹ́.
meaning: Some people or conditions are so unredeemable that no matter what one does, they persist in being evil.

proverbs: Kì í tètè yé oníbúrẹ́dì; ó dìgbà tó bá di mẹ́ta kọ́bọ̀.
meaning: People rarely learn to mend their ways until they have suffered some reverses.

proverbs: Kì í tètè yéni: òwe ńlá ni.
meaning: People tend always to learn wisdom too late.

proverbs: Kí ni ó yá apárí lórí tó ń mòòkùn lódò?
meaning: One should not unnecessarily endanger oneself.

proverbs: Kí ni ológìní ń wá tó fi jóna mọ́le? Ṣòkòtò ló fẹ́ẹ́ mú ni, tàbí ẹrù ní ń dì?
meaning: One should not put oneself in the path of avoidable dangers.

proverbs: Kí oníkálùkù rọra ṣe é; ìfẹjú òbò ò lè fa aṣọ ya.
meaning: Overexcitement accomplishes little; it is far better to take life easy.

proverbs: Kìtì ò mọ́là; ká ṣiṣẹ́ bí ẹrú ò da nǹkan.
meaning: One does not guarantee greatness for oneself by slaving.

proverbs: Kò sí ajá tí kì í gbó; àgbójù ajá là ń pè ní dìgbòlugi.
meaning: No person is without a flaw; unbounded flaws are what give people a bad reputation.

proverbs: Kò sí ìgbà tí a dá aṣọ tí a ó rílẹ̀ fi wọ́.
meaning: There will always be time to enjoy what one has worked for; one should not be unduly impatient.

proverbs: Kò sí ohun tí ń le tí kì í rọ̀.
meaning: Every problem eventually becomes solved somehow.

proverbs: Kò sí ohun tí sùúrù-ú sè tí kò jinná.
meaning: Forbearance overcomes all things.

proverbs: Kò sí ohun tó lọ sókè tí kò ní padà wá sílẹ̀.
meaning: One should not be too impatient in anticipating the inevitable.

proverbs: Kò sí ohun tó yára pa ẹni bí ọ̀rọ̀ àsọjù.
meaning: One should govern one’s mouth.

proverbs: Kọkọ-kọkọ ò jẹ́ ká mọ ẹni tí ọ̀ràn ń dùn.
meaning: Habitual overreaction defuses real alarms.

proverbs: Kọ́kọ́rọ́ àṣejù, ilẹ̀kùn ẹ̀tẹ́ la fi ń ṣí.
meaning: Excess brings disgrace.

proverbs: Kòkòrò tó jẹ̀fọ́ jàre ẹ̀fọ́; ìwòn lewéko ń dára mọ.
meaning: A person enticed to a crime is not as guilty as the person who did the enticing.

proverbs: Kùkùté kan kì í fọ́ni lépo lẹ́ẹ̀mejì.
meaning: The same disaster should not befall a person twice; one usually learns from experience.

proverbs: Kùn yún, kùn wá bí ikọ̀ eèrà .
meaning: Said of people who are too restless to stay still.

proverbs: Làákàyè baba ìwà; bí o ní sùúrù, ohun gbogbo lo ní.
meaning: Common sense and patience are the chief qualities one must have.

proverbs: Làálàá tó ròkè, ilẹ̀ ní ń bọ̀.
meaning: No difficulty is without its end.

proverbs: Labalábá kì í bá wọn n ájà ẹlẹ́gùn-ún; aṣọ-ọ ẹ̀ á fàya.
meaning: One should know one’s limitations and act accordingly.

proverbs: Labalábá tó dìgbò lẹ̀gún, aṣọ ẹ̀ á fàya.
meaning: One should be wise enough to know one’s nemesis and avoid it.

proverbs: Lù mí pẹ́ , lù mí pẹ́ làpọ́n fi ń lu ọmọ ẹ̀ pa.
meaning: People not used to caring for delicate articles soon destroy them by mishandling.

proverbs: Màá jẹ iṣu; màá jẹ èrú; ibi ayo ló mọ.
meaning: The greediest appetite will not survive satiation.

proverbs: Má bà á loògùn ẹ̀tẹ̀.
meaning: The best way out of trouble is not to get into it in the first place.

proverbs: Má bàá mi ṣeré tí kèrègbé fi gba okùn lọ́rùn.
meaning: Do not ask me to endanger myself needlessly.

proverbs: Má fi iyán ewùrà gbọ́n mi lọ́bẹ̀ lọ sóko ẹgàn.
meaning: Do not use up my meager resources on your way to a place of plenty.

proverbs: ‘‘Má fi okoò mi dá ọ̀nà,’’ ọjọ́ kan là ń kọ̀ ọ́.
meaning: Whoever does not take a stand to protest the violation of his or her rights will continue to have them violated.

proverbs: ‘‘Má fi tìrẹ kọ́ mi lọ́rùn’’ là ń dá fún apènà àti òwú.
meaning: Do not involve me in your problems as the weft thread got the shuttle entangled.

proverbs: Má fìkánjú jayé, awo ilé Alárá; má fi wàà-wàà joyè, awo Òkè Ìjerò; ayé kan ń bẹ lẹ́hìn, ó dùn bí ẹní ńlá oyin.
meaning: Whoever goes about life with patience will reap untold enjoyment from it.

proverbs: Má ṣe jáfara; àfara fírí ló pa Bíálà; ara yíyá ló pa Abídogun.
meaning: One should avoid extremes in all things.

proverbs: Mábàjẹ́ ò jẹ́ fi aṣọ ẹ̀ fún ọ̀lẹ bora.
meaning: Whoever values his or her property will not entrust it to worthless people.

proverbs: ‘‘Méè-wáyé-ẹjọ́’’ fọmọ ẹ̀ fọ́kọ mẹ́fà. Méèwáyéẹjọ́
meaning: If one wishes to avoid trouble, one should avoid actions certain to result in trouble.

proverbs: Méjì-i gbẹ̀du ò ṣé-é so kọ́.
meaning: Some propositions are simply too much for anyone to tackle.

proverbs: ‘‘N óò wọ́ ọ kágbó’’ ẹ̀hìn-in rẹ̀ ni yó fi lànà.
meaning: Whoever is determined to make trouble for others must be prepared to take some trouble himself.

proverbs: Nítorí ará ilé la ṣe ńdá ṣòkòtò ará oko dára.
meaning: One’s products are one’s advertisement, regardless of whether the recipient knows their quality.

proverbs: Nítorí-i ká lè simi la ṣe ń ṣe àì-simi.
meaning: One labors in the present to provide for one’s future.

proverbs: Nítorí-i ká má jìyà la ṣe ń yá Májìyà lọ́fà.
meaning: One should not suffer the misfortune one has done everything to avoid.

proverbs: Nítorí ọjọ́ tí ó bá máa dáràn la ṣe ń sọmọ lórúkọ.
meaning: Each individual has a name and is therefore an independent agent responsible for his or her own actions.

proverbs: Nítorí ọ̀la la ṣe ń ṣòní lóore.
meaning: What one sows determines what one reaps.

proverbs: Nítorí ọlọgbọ́n la ṣe ń dá ẹ̀wù aṣiwèrè kanlẹ̀.
meaning: One who cares about his or her reputation will perform obligations well even when the recipient has no power over him or her.

proverbs: Nǹkan mẹ́ta la kì í pè ní kékeré: a kì í pe iná ní kékeré; a kì í pe ìjà ní kékeré; a kì í pe àìsàn ní kékeré.
meaning: Attend to every potential problem early before it gets out of hand.

proverbs: O bá ẹfọ̀n lábàtà o yọ̀bẹ sí i; o mọ ibi ẹfọ̀n-ọ́n ti wá?
meaning: People should not lay claim to things whose procurement they know nothing about.

proverbs: Ó dé orí akáhín àkàràá deegun.
meaning: To the shiftless person even the easiest task is onerous.

proverbs: Ó dé ọwọ́ aláròóbọ̀ ó di níná.
meaning: A shopkeeper is a difficult person to obtain a good bargain from.

proverbs: O kò rí àkàṣù ò ń pata sẹ́fọ̀ọ́.
meaning: Said of a person too eagerly anticipating a favor that might not materialize

proverbs: O lọ sÍjẹ̀bú ẹ̀ẹ̀kan, o ru igbá àṣẹ bọ̀ wálé.
meaning: Said of a person on whom the impact of an experience is all out of proportion.

proverbs: Ò ń bá obìnrin ẹ jà ò ń kanrí mọ́nú; o máa nà á lóògùn ni?
meaning: One should moderate one’s response to annoyances.

proverbs: Ó ń bọ̀, ó ń bọ̀!’’ ẹ̀wọ̀n là ń so sílẹ̀ dè é.
meaning: For such a thing one would best prepare a snare. If the thought of something fills one with apprehension, one should plot to defeat it.

proverbs: Ó ní ibi tí tanpẹ́pẹ́ ń gbèjà ẹyìn mọ.
meaning: There is a limit to the help one can expect from others.

proverbs: Ó ní ohun tí àgbá jẹ tẹ́lẹ̀ ikùn kó tó sọ pé èyí yó òun.
meaning: The prudent person prepares himself or herself for all eventualities.

proverbs: Ó ní ohun tí àgbá jẹ tẹ́lẹ̀ ikùn kó tó sọ pé ìyà-á yó òun.
meaning: Even when one is prostrated by grief, one does not ignore one’s need to survive.

proverbs: Ó ní ohun tí ìbòsí ràn nínú ìjà.
meaning: No matter what help a person in trouble receives, he or she will still be in for some grief.

proverbs: Ó pẹ́ títí aboyún, oṣù mẹ́sàn-án.
meaning: Sooner rather than later, the day will arrive when one must fulfill one’s obligation or pay one’s debt.

proverbs: O rí àgbébọ̀ adìẹ lọ́jà ò ń ta geere sí i; ìba ṣe rere olúwa rẹ̀ ò jẹ́ tà á.
meaning: People should think carefully before they assume obligations.

proverbs: O só pa mí mo pọ́nnu lá, o bojúwẹ̀hìn mo dọ̀bálẹ̀, o tiwọ́ bọ̀gbẹ́ ; o f dè mí ni?
meaning: Said by a long-suffering person who has quietly taken a great deal of abuse, when the abuser persists in his or her ill treatment.

proverbs: O ṣíwó nílé o kò san, o dóko o ń ṣí ìkòkò ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ wò, o bímọ o sọ ọ́ ní Adéṣínà; bí ṣíṣí ò bá sìn lẹ́hìn rẹ, o kì í sìn lẹ́hìn-in ṣíṣí?
meaning: Obsession with anything is bad.

proverbs: O wà lọ́rùn ọ̀pẹ ò ḿbá Ọlọ́run ṣèlérí.
meaning: Said of a person who taunts more powerful adversaries even when he or she is in a vulnerable position.

proverbs: Obìnrin bẹẹrẹ: òṣì bẹẹrẹ.
meaning: Whoever adds wives to wives adds problems to problems.

proverbs: Obìnrin tó gégi nígbó Orò, ó gé àgémọ.
meaning: Whoever tempts a fate that is known to strike unfailingly has tempted her last.

proverbs: Òbò-ó ní ìtìjú ló mú òun sápamọ́ sábẹ́ inú, ṣùgbọ́n bí okó bá dé, òun á sínà fún un.
meaning: Modesty does not indicate a lack of ability or willingness to act decisively.

proverbs: Odídẹrẹ́ ní wọn ò lè tí ojú òun yan òun mọ́ ẹbọ; bí wọ́n bá ńdÍfá, òun a sá wọlé.
meaning: The smart person should always distance himself or herself from disaster.

proverbs: Odídẹrẹ́ ń wolé hóró-hóró bí ẹnipé yó kòó sílé; àgbìgbò n ọ̀wọ̀ràn ń wohò igi bí ẹnipé kò tibẹ̀ jáde.
meaning: Some people fail to appreciate their assets, while others envy them what they have

proverbs: Òfèèrèfé ò ṣé-é fẹ̀hín tì.
meaning: One should not trust in emptiness.

proverbs: Ogun àgbọ́tẹ́lẹ̀ kì í pa arọ.
meaning: One must take advantage of foreknowledge to protect oneself.

proverbs: Ohun à ń jẹ là ń tà; bí epo òyìnbó kọ́.
meaning: One must be selective about which of one’s just desserts one will accept.

proverbs: Ohun gbogbo, ìwọn ló dùn mọ.
meaning: One should observe moderation in all things.

proverbs: Ohun gbogbo kì í pẹ́ jọ olóhun lójú
meaning: A person always attaches excessive value to his or her possessions. Trust a person to exaggerate their value, especially when they are damaged or coveted by others.

proverbs: Ohun gbogbo kì í tó olè.
meaning: Greed and covetousness are the marks of a thief.

proverbs: Ohun gbogbo là ń diyelé; ṣùgbọ́n kò sẹ́ni tó moye ara-a rẹ̀; ẹ̀jẹ̀ ò fojú rere jáde.
meaning: People should not devalue their own lives by exposing themselves to unnecessary danger.

proverbs: Ohun tí a bá máa jẹ a kì í fi runmú.
meaning: Don’t sneer at what you will eventually embrace.

proverbs: Ohun tí à bá ṣe pẹ̀sẹ̀, ká má fi ṣe ìkánjú;bó pẹ́ títí ohun gbogbo a tó ọwọ́ ẹni.
meaning: One should not shirk present responsibilities in the pursuit of a distant goal.

proverbs: Ohun tí a bá tẹjúmọ́ kì í jóná.
meaning: Matters to which one devotes one’s undivided attention will not go awry.

proverbs: Ohun tí a fi ẹ̀sọ̀ mú kì í bàjẹ́ ; ohun tí a fagbára mú ní ń nini lára.
meaning: A gentle approach will accomplish much, whereas a forceful approach is likely to complicate matters.

proverbs: Ohun tí a fún ẹlẹ́mọ̀ṣọ́ ní ń ṣọ́.
meaning: One would best focus only on the task assigned.

proverbs: Ohun tí a ò pé yó dẹrù ní ń diṣẹ́ .
meaning: Matters that one considers of little significance have a way of becoming insoluble problems.

proverbs: Ohun tí a rí la fi ḿbọ párá ẹni; bí igi tíná ń bẹ lẹ́nu ẹ̀ kọ́.
meaning: Every seemingly sensible generalization has exceptions.

proverbs: Ohun tí ajá rí tó fi ń gbó ò tó èyí tí àgùntán fi ń ṣèran wò.
meaning: Some people make mountains out of other people’s molehills.

proverbs: Ohun tó bá wu olókùnrùn ní ń pa á.
meaning: Whatever one is addicted to is likely to prove one’s undoing.

proverbs: Ohun tó bá wu ọmọ-ọ́ jẹ kì í run ọmọ nínú.
meaning: One is always willing to endure sacrifices in order to have whatever one craves.

proverbs: Òjijì là ń rọ́mọ lọ́wọ́ alákẹdun.
meaning: One need not announce ahead of time what feat one will perform.

proverbs: Òjò kan kì í báni lábà ká jìjàdù ọ̀rọ̀-ọ́ sọ; bí ẹ̀gbọ́n bá sọ tán, àbúrò á sọ.
meaning: When there is a surfeit of a commodity, there is no sense in scrambling to get some of it.

proverbs: Òjò ń rọ̀, Orò ń ké; atọ́kùn àlùgbè tí ò láṣọ méjì a ṣe ògèdèm̀gbé sùn.
meaning: If one has not made provisions for rainy days, when they come one must suffer the attendant hardship.

proverbs: Ojú abẹ ò ṣé-é pọ́nlá.
meaning: Never engage in dangerous behavior.

proverbs: Ojú àwòdì kọ́ ladìẹ ń re àpáta.
meaning: One does not engage in culpable activity in the presence of those charged with upholding discipline.

proverbs: Ojú ìmàle ò kúrò lọ́tí, ó bímọ ẹ̀ ó sọ ọ́ ní Ìmórù-máhá-wá.
meaning: One’s addiction will always manifest itself, however much one might hide it. In a variant, the father names the child Lèmámù.

proverbs: Ojú kan làdá ń ní.
meaning: One should be true to one calling or relationship and not philander.

proverbs: Ojú kan náà lèwe ń bágbà.
meaning: Sooner or later the youth becomes an elder; patience is all.

proverbs: Ojú là ń gbó re ọ̀nà Ìbàdàn’’; ó fi ogún ọ̀kẹ̀ gbàdí.
meaning: One should take the necessary precautions when one embarks on a dangerous venture.

proverbs: Ojú ní ń kán ọkọlóbìnrin; àlè méjì á jà dandan.
meaning: One should not be overly anxious for results that are inevitable anyway.

proverbs: ‘‘Ojú ò f rakù’’ tó ta ajá ẹ̀ lókòó; ó ní bó bá jẹ́ bẹ́ẹ̀ ni wọ́n ńtà á wọn a máa tún ara-a wọn rí.
meaning: If someone sells you an item at a ridiculously low price, you may expect to see that person again soon.

proverbs: Ojú ológbò lèkúté ò gbọdọ̀ yan.
meaning: One cannot afford to be careless in the presence of powerful enemies.

proverbs: Ojú tí kì í wo iná, tí kì í wo òòrùn; ojú tí ń báni dalẹ́ kọ́.
meaning: From early indications, one can tell what friendships or possessions will prove lasting.

proverbs: Ojú tí yóò báni dalẹ́ kì í tàárọ̀ ṣepin.
meaning: Relationships that will last will not become onerous right at the start.

proverbs: Ojúkòkòrò baba ọ̀kánjúà.
meaning: The envious and the covetous are similar.

proverbs: Ojúlé ló bá wá; ẹ̀bùrú ló gbà lọ́; ó dÍfá fún àlejò tí ń fẹ́ obìnrin onílé.
meaning: Whoever abuses hospitality will depart in disgrace.

proverbs: Òkèlè gbò-ọ̀-gbò-ó fẹ ọmọ lójú toto.
meaning: A person who bites off more than he can chew will suffer in the process of trying.

proverbs: Òkèlè kan ní ń pa àgbà.
meaning: The smallest thing, if not accorded the proper attention, can be the death of even the most powerful person.

proverbs: Òketè baba ogun: bí a ṣígun, olúkúlùkù ní ń di òketè-e ẹ̀ lọ́wọ́.
meaning: For all tasks, adequate preparations are mandatory.

proverbs: Òkété tó bọ́ ìrù-ú mọ̀ pé ìpéjú ọjà ọrún òun ló sún.
meaning: One should take a near-disaster as a warning.

proverbs: Òkìpa ajá la fi ń bọ Ògún.
meaning: One should use material proper for the occasion.

proverbs: Òkò àbínújù kì í pẹyẹ.
meaning: Whatever one does in anger is likely to go awry.

proverbs: Oko ni gbégbé ń gbé.
meaning: Everything in its proper place.

proverbs: Òkò tí ẹyẹ́ bá rí kì í pẹyẹ.
meaning: If one sees danger approaching, one will take precautions.

proverbs: Òkóbó ò lè fi alátọ̀sí ṣẹ̀sín.
meaning: A person who has a blemish should not make fun of other people’s blemishes.

proverbs: Òkú àjànàkú là ń yọ ogbó sí; ta ní j yọ agada séerin?
meaning: One dares taunt a powerful adversary only when he has been neutralized.

proverbs: Okùn àgbò kì í gbèé dorí ìwo.
meaning: Seemingly minor difficulties soon become unmanageable problems.

proverbs: Olè kì í gbé gbẹ̀du.
meaning: One should not attempt a risky business one has no hope of pulling off.

proverbs: Olójútì logun ń pa.
meaning: Discretion and a thick skin are sometimes much better than valor.

proverbs: Olóògbé ò jẹ́wọ́; atannijẹ bí orun.
meaning: One can always feign sleep to avoid engaging in discussions.

proverbs: Olóòlà kì í kọ àfín.
meaning: There are some tasks that are beyond the scope of experts.

proverbs: Olórìṣá gbé ààjà sókè, wọ́n ní ire ni; bí ire ni, bí ibi ni, wọn ò mọ̀.
meaning: It is foolhardy to presume to know what is in other people’s minds.

proverbs: Omi là ń kọ́-ọ́ tẹ̀ ká tó tẹ iyanrìn.
meaning: One should attend to the most urgent matters first.

proverbs: Òní, adìẹẹ̀ mí ṣìwọ̀; ọ̀la, adìẹẹ̀ mí ṣìwọ̀; ọjọ́ kan la óò fẹ́ àìwọlé adìẹ kù.
meaning: Little errors, if not checked, will result in a major blunder.

proverbs: Òní, babá dákú; ọ̀la, babá dáku; ọjọ́ kan ni ikú yóò dá baba.
meaning: Frequent close calls with death will eventually lead to real death. Compare the foregoing and following entries

proverbs: Òní, ẹṣín dá baba; ọ̀la, ẹṣín dá baba; bí baba ò bá yé ẹṣin-ín gùn, ọjọ̀ kan lẹṣin óò dá baba pa.
meaning: One should take warning from little disasters.

proverbs: Onígbàjámọ̀ ń fárí fún ọ, ò ń fọwọ́ kàn án wò; èwo ló máa kù fún ọ níbẹ̀.
meaning: Once the end is clear, one should stop being anxious about developments.

proverbs: Onílé ń relé wọ́n ní oǹdè ń sá; oǹdè ò sá, ilé ẹ̀ ló lọ.
meaning: A strategic retreat to regroup is not the same as giving up the fight.

proverbs: Ònímónìí, ẹtú jìnfìn; ọ̀lamọ́la, ẹtú jìnfìn; ẹran mìíràn ò sí nígbó ni?
meaning: If the same person gets into trouble every time, the person needs to look to himself or herself.

proverbs: Onínúfùfù ní ń wá oúnjẹ fún oníwẹ́rẹ́wẹ́rẹ́
