meaning: The even-tempered person will always have the advantage of the hot-tempered person.

proverbs: Oníṣu ní ń mọ ibi iṣú gbé ta sí.
meaning: One should not presume to know more about an affair than the person most intimately involved.

proverbs: Onísùúrù ní ń ṣe ọkọ ọmọ Aláhúsá.
meaning: Patience overcomes all obstacles.

proverbs: Oókan ni wọ́n ń ta ẹṣin lọ́run; ẹni tí yó lọ ò wọ́n; ṣùgbọ́n ẹni tí yó bọ̀ ló kù.
meaning: Setting out on dangerous ventures is the easiest thing in the world, but their repercussions prove to be unspeakable.

proverbs: Oókan-án sọni dahun; eéjì-í sọni dàpà.
meaning: One who has little seems a miser; one who has plenty becomes careless with money.

proverbs: Ooré di ẹrẹ̀ lÁwẹ́ ; àwọn igúnnugún ṣoore wọ́n pá lórí.
meaning: One should be careful about doing favors, lest they come back to haunt one.

proverbs: Òòrẹ̀ ní ń ṣẹ́gi tí a ó fi wì í.
meaning: The incautious person will provide the instrument for his own undoing.

proverbs: Oore ọ̀fẹ́ gùn jùwàásù.
meaning: Said of people who are long-winded.

proverbs: Oore tí Agbé ṣe lỌ́fà, ó dagbe.
meaning: One should learn from Agbe’s example and be prudent in doing favors.

proverbs: Oore tí igúnnugún ṣe tó fi pá lórí, tí àkàlá ṣe tó fi yọ gẹ̀gẹ̀, a kì í ṣe irú ẹ̀.
meaning: One should not do favors that will result in one’s own ruin.

proverbs: Ooré pọ̀, a fìkà san án.
meaning: Too great a favor provokes enmity.

proverbs: Orí ejò ò ṣé-é họ imú.
meaning: Never expose yourself to unnecessary danger.

proverbs: Orin ní ńṣíwájú ọ̀tẹ̀.
meaning: People about to engage in a plot will first spar to sound one another out.

proverbs: Orin tí a kọ lánàá, tí a ò sùn, tí a ò wo, a kì í tún jí kọ ọ́ láàárọ̀.
meaning: Yesterday’s problems should be gone with yesterday.

proverbs: Òrìṣà kékeré ò ṣé-é há ní párá.
meaning: Some things may seem insignificant yet must not be taken lightly.

proverbs: Òròmọ-adìẹ ò màwòdì; ìyá ẹ̀ ló màṣá.
meaning: The young are neither as experienced nor as careful as the old.

proverbs: Òṣé ní ń ṣíwájú ẹkún; àbámọ̀ ní ń gbẹ̀hìn ọ̀ràn; gbogbo àgbà ìlú pé, wọn ò rí oògùn àbámọ̀ ṣe.
meaning: One can only regret an error once it has been committed; there is no undoing it.

proverbs: Oúnjẹ tí a ó jẹ pẹ́ , a kì í bu òkèlè-e rẹ̀ tóbi.
meaning: Wise husbandry is the medicine for lasting prosperity.

proverbs: Owó ò bá olè gbé.
meaning: A thief and money are incompatible neighbors; never trust a thief with money.

proverbs: Òwúyẹ́ ; a-ṣòro-ó-sọ bí ọ̀rọ̀.
meaning: The matter under reference is so delicate it almost does not bear speech.

proverbs: Oyún inú: a kì í kà á kún ọmọ-ọ tilẹ̀.
meaning: One should not treat anything hoped for as though it were already in hand.

proverbs: Ọ̀bánijà ní ń mọ ìjagun ẹni.
meaning: Only through close association does one know other people.

proverbs: Ọ̀bàrà gba kùm̀mọ̀; ó dÍfá fún a-láwìí-ì-gbọ́.
meaning: The obstinate person is asking for cudgel blows.

proverbs: Ọ̀bàyéjẹ́ , tí ń ru gángan wọ̀lú.
meaning: Apostrophe addressed to troublemakers

proverbs: ‘‘Ọbẹ̀ lọmú àgbà’’ ló pa onígbaǹso Ògòdò.
meaning: Addiction kills.

proverbs: Ọ̀bẹ ṣìlò-ó ń báni ṣeré a ní kò mú, bí eré bí eré ó ń pani lọ́wọ́.
meaning: Be careful not to underestimate people who do not advertise themselves; otherwise, they will have you prostrate before you know what is happening.

proverbs: Ọbẹ̀ tóo sè tílé fi jóná wàá sọ ọ́.
meaning: You must explain the unheard-of behavior that resulted in such a disaster.

proverbs: Ọ̀bẹlẹ̀wò bẹlẹ̀wò; bí ewúrẹ́ yó bàá dùbúlẹ̀ a bẹ ilẹ̀ ibẹ̀ wò.
meaning: Look well at the lay of the land before engaging in any new venture.

proverbs: Ọ̀bọ ni yo para ẹ̀.
meaning: Fools will bring their own undoing upon themselves.

proverbs: Ọ̀daràn ẹyẹ tí ń musàn.
meaning: Addressed to any person whose actions are likely to lead to some disaster.

proverbs: Ọ̀dárayá tí ńfi ẹ̀gbẹ́ na igi.
meaning: Said of a too-cheerful person whose excess energy is getting on others’ nerves.

proverbs: Ọdẹ a-fi-fìlà-pa-erin: ọjọ́ kan ni òkìkí-i rẹ̀ ń mọ.
meaning: Whoever promises to do the impossible enjoys fame only as long as it takes for the impossibility to be manifest.

proverbs: Ọ̀gá-a má fi ẹsẹ̀ yí ẹrẹ̀, gbogbo ara ní ń fi yí i.
meaning: Too much squeamishness is its own undoing.

proverbs: Ọ̀gán ìmàdò ò ṣéé kò lójú.
meaning: One would be wise to avoid dangerous people.

proverbs: Ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ ń bàjẹ́ ; a ní ó ń pọ́n.
meaning: It does not help to rationalize a brat’s behavior with silly explanations.

proverbs: Ọ̀gọ̀ ń gbé ọ̀gọ rù.
meaning: A person is cultivating the means to his or her own ruin.

proverbs: Ọ̀gbágbá wọlẹ̀, ó ku àtiyọ.
meaning: Some ventures that are easy at the start prove mightily intractable down the line.

proverbs: Ọgbọ́n àgbọ́njù ní ń pa òdù ọ̀yà.
meaning: Too much cleverness brings trouble.

proverbs: Ọgbọ́n àgbọ́njù ní ń sọ ẹni diwin; bí oògún bá pọ̀ lápọ̀jù a sọni di wèrè; bóbìnrín bá gbọ́n àgbọ́njù, péńpé laṣọ ọkọ ẹ̀ ń mọ.
meaning: People who are too cunning are headed for trouble; a man who marries too cunning a woman is headed for trouble.

proverbs: Ọgbọ́n ọdúnnìí, wèrè ẹ̀míì.
meaning: What seems wise now may appear like lunacy in hindsight.

proverbs: Ọgbọ́n pẹ̀lú-u sùúrù la fi ń mú erin wọ̀lú.
meaning: The most difficult tasks can be accomplished with wisdom and patience.

proverbs: Ọjọ́ tí a ó bàá nù, gágá lara ń yáni.
meaning: Disaster attends overenthusiasm.

proverbs: Ọjọ́ tí a to ọkà a ò to ti èkúté mọ́ ọ.
meaning: One hardly ever plans for trouble.

proverbs: Ọjọ́ tí àgbẹ̀ ṣíṣe-é bá di kíyèsílẹ̀, ká ṣíwọ́ oko ríro.
meaning: If the basic condition for a trade is interdicted, one should no longer engage in that trade.

proverbs: Ọjọ́ tí elétutu-ú bá máa fò, ìjàm̀pere kì í rìn.
meaning: Only cunning will deliver one’s prey into one’s hands.

proverbs: Ọ̀kánjúwà àgbẹ̀ tí ńgbin òwú sóko àkùrọ̀.
meaning: Greed sometimes makes people work against their own interests.

proverbs: Ọ̀kánjúwà baba àrùn.
meaning: There is no disease like greed.

proverbs: Ọ̀kánjúwà baba olè; àwòròǹṣoṣò-ó wo ohun olóhun má ṣẹ̀ẹ́jú.
meaning: Covetousness leads to stealing.

proverbs: Ọ̀kánjúwà èèyàn-án dé àwùjọ, ó wòkè yàn-yàn-àn-yàn.
meaning: The covetous person is always on the lookout for something.

proverbs: Ọ̀kánjúwà kì í mu ẹ̀jẹ̀ ẹlòmíràn; ẹ̀jẹ̀ ara ẹ̀ náà ní ń mu.
meaning: Greed recoils on the greedy.

proverbs: Ọ̀kánjúwà ò ṣéé fi wá nǹkan.
meaning: One should be patient in seeking one's fortune.

proverbs: Ọ̀kánjúwà ológbò tó jókòó sẹ́nu ọ̀nà: ṣé eku eléku ló fẹ́ pa jẹ?
meaning: Greedy people are never satisfied with what they have.

proverbs: Ọ̀kánjúwà Oníṣàngó ní ń sọ ọmọ-ọ rẹ̀ ní Bámgbóṣé; ìwọ̀n oṣé tí a lè gbé là ń gbé.
meaning: Avoid avarice.

proverbs: Ọ̀kánjúwà pẹ̀lú olè, déédé ni wọ́n jẹ́ .
meaning: Covetousness is as bad as stealing.

proverbs: Ọ̀kánjúwà-á bu òkèlè, ojù ẹ̀-ẹ̀ lami.
meaning: Greed has its pains also.

proverbs: Ọ̀kánjúwà-á pín ẹgbàafà nínú ẹgbàaje; ó ní kí wọ́n pín ẹgbàá kan tó kù, bóyá igbiwó tún lè kan òun.
meaning: Greed knows no limits.

proverbs: Ọ̀kẹ́rẹ́ gorí ìrókò, ojú ọd dá.
meaning: When affairs have gone out of one’s control, one should cease worrying.

proverbs: Ọkọ̀ ńjò, ọkọ̀ ńjò! Ìgbà tó bá rì, kò parí ná?
meaning: There is little one can do about a problem whose outcome is inevitable.

proverbs: Ọ̀kọ̀ọ̀kan lọwọ̀ ń yọ.
meaning: Huge problems usually build up gradually.

proverbs: Ọkùnrin tó fẹ́ òjòwú méjì sílé ò rẹ́ ni fi ṣọ́lé.
meaning: Jealousy is a terrible quality in a spouse.

proverbs: Ọ̀kùn-ún mọ̀nà tẹ́lẹ̀ kójú ẹ̀ tó fọ́.
meaning: The old knew how to live before they became frail.

proverbs: ‘‘ Ọ̀la ni mò ńlọ,’’ tí ńfi koto ṣe àmù.
meaning: Shortsighted people make little provision for the future.

proverbs: ‘‘Ọlá ò jẹ́ kí nríran’’; ọmọ Èwí Adó tí ń tanná rìn lọ́sàn-án.
meaning: One should not allow one’s good fortune to go to one’s head.

proverbs: Ọ̀làjà ní ń fi orí gbọgbẹ́ .
meaning: The peacemaker is likely to suffer for his pains.

proverbs: Ọlọ́dẹ kì í torí atẹ́gùn yìnbọn.
meaning: One should be deliberate and attentive in pursuing one’s profession.

proverbs: Ọlọ́gbọ́n bẹẹrẹ-ẹ́ pète ìgárá.
meaning: Too much cunning is like thievery.

proverbs: Ọmọ adìẹ́ fò, a ní ‘‘Ẹrán lọ àkẹ́ẹ̀!’’
meaning: Do not blow matters out of all credible proportion.

proverbs: Ọmọ inú ayò ò ṣéé bá bínú.
meaning: One should not blame one’s misfortune on innocent people.

proverbs: Ọmọ orogún ẹ-ẹ́ kú, o ní ẹní rí ẹ lọ́run ò purọ́; bí tì bá kú ńkọ́?
meaning: One should not go overboard in sharing other people’s sorrow.

proverbs: Ọmọdé bú ìrókò, ó bojú wẹ̀hìn; òòjọ́ ní ń jà?
meaning: The fact that there has been no repercussion for a misdeed does not mean one is home free; repercussions may be delayed.

proverbs: Ọmọdé jí ti ojú orun wá, ó ní ‘‘Àkàrà kéjìkéjì’’; wọ́n ti ń mú u kẹ́ẹ̀ kó tó jí, ì ká ká níkẹ̀?
meaning: Never misuse what those before you made available to you by their wise husbandry.

proverbs: Ọmọrí odó pani lọ́tọ̀, ká tó wí pé ká kùn ún lóògùn.
meaning: Overkill is pointless; if a situation is dangerous enough as it is, one should not aggravate it by acting provocatively.

proverbs: Ọ̀mùtí ò mu agbè já.
meaning: There is a limit to the pleasure a drunk can get from a bottle.

proverbs: Ọ̀nà ẹ̀bùrú dá ọwọ́ olúwa-a rẹ̀ tẹlẹ̀.
meaning: There are perils to taking paths one is not familiar with.

proverbs: Ọ̀nà ìgbàlẹ̀ a máa já sọ́run.
meaning: People who do the forbidden may pay dearly for their temerity.

proverbs: Ọ̀nà là ń ṣì mọ̀nà; bí a ò bá ṣubú, a kì í mọ ẹrù-ú dì.
meaning: Errors and failures are opportunities to learn.

proverbs: Ọ̀nà ni yó mùú olè; ahéré ni yó mùú olóko.
meaning: When the habitual wrongdoer comes to grief, it will be in the course of his wrong doing.

proverbs: Ọ̀nà ọ̀fun, ọ̀nà ọ̀run: méjèèjì bákannáà ni wọ́n rí.
meaning: One’s throat may lead to one’s death

proverbs: Ọ̀pá àgbéléjìká, a-tẹ̀hìn-lójú.
meaning: Said of people who pay no attention to their future.

proverbs: Ọ̀pọ̀ oògùn ní ń ru ọmọ gàle-gàle.
meaning: A person who lacks moderation is like someone overpowered by bad medicine.

proverbs: Ọ̀pọ̀lọ́ lejò ń bùjẹ, tí à ń wí pé ilẹ̀-ẹ́ rorò?
meaning: Do not make too much of insignificant events.

proverbs: Ọ̀ràn kì í ỳ lórí alábaun.
meaning: Said of people who are invariably the source of problems.

proverbs: Ọ̀ràn ńlá-ńlá ní ń bá àpá; ọ̀ràn ṣẹ́kú ṣẹ́kú ní ń bá oṣè.
meaning: Different people have different levels of vulnerability.

proverbs: Ọ̀ràn ò dun gbọ̀ọ̀rọ̀; a dá a láàárọ̀, ó yọ lálẹ́.
meaning: Said of people who are unimpressed by correction or punishment.

proverbs: Ọ̀ràn ọ̀gẹ̀dẹ̀ ò tó ohun tí à ń yọ àdá sí.
meaning: Do not make too much of a minor crisis.

proverbs: Ọ̀ràn ọkà-á ní ìba; ayé ní òṣùwọ̀n.
meaning: To everything there is a proper limit.

proverbs: Ọ̀rọ̀ lọmọ etí ń jẹ.
meaning: People who misbehave must endure tongue lashing.

proverbs: Ọ̀rọ̀ ò pọ̀, àkàwé-e rẹ̀ ló pọ̀.
meaning: Creating a problem is easy; explaining it is not quite as easy.

proverbs: Ọ̀rọ̀ púpọ̀ ò kún agbọ̀n; irọ́ ní ń mú wá.
meaning: Brevity is wise in discussions; wordiness leads to invention.

proverbs: Ọ̀rọ̀ tí a dì ní gbòdògì: bo déwée kókò yó fàya.
meaning: If delicate matters are handled carelessly, the result will be the opposite of what was desired.

proverbs: Ọ̀rọ̀ tí ò ní ohùn fífọ̀, dídákẹ́ ló yẹ .
meaning: Matters that should not be mentioned should be left unbroached.

proverbs: Ọ̀ṣọ́ oníbùjé ò pé isán; ọ̀ṣọ́ onínàbì ò ju ọdún lọ.
meaning: Fast living plays havoc with people’s looks.

proverbs: Ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ là ń tẹ ẹrẹ̀; ọ̀tọ̀ọ̀tọ̀ là ń tẹ eruku.
meaning: With great care, one can extricate oneself safely from any problem.

proverbs: Ọ̀wọ́n yúnlé, ọ̀pọ̀-ọ́ yúnjà.
meaning: If one overprices one’s goods, one will find no takers.

proverbs: Ọwọ́-ọ baba lẹ wò, ẹ ò wo ẹsẹ̀-ẹ baba.
meaning: People who do not pay attention to details are likely to go astray.

proverbs: Pala-pálà kì í ṣe ẹran àjẹgbé; ẹ ṣáà máa mu àgúnmu.
meaning: One pays for one’s indiscretions by and by.

proverbs: Pápá tó ní òun ó jòó wọ odò, ọ̀rọ̀ ló fẹ́ẹ́ gbọ́.
meaning: Abstain from actions that will provoke others’ ire.

proverbs: Paramọ́lẹ̀-ẹ́ kọ ọ̀ràn àfojúdi.
meaning: Certain situations are not to be taken lightly, lest they result in painful repercussions.

proverbs: Pẹ̀lẹ́ -pẹ̀lẹ́ lejò-ó fi ń gun àgbọn.
meaning: Dangerous and difficult tasks should be attempted with care and patience.

proverbs: Pẹ̀tẹ̀pẹ́tẹ̀ ọ̀rọ̀, a-ta-síni-lára-má-wọ̀n-ọ́n.
meaning: Injury once spoken cannot be recalled.

proverbs: Pípẹ́ ni yó pẹ̀ẹ́, agbọ̀n á bo adìẹ.
meaning: One may put it off a while, but one cannot avoid one’s fate.

proverbs: Pípẹ́ ni yó pẹ̀ẹ́, akólòlò á pe baba.
meaning: With perseverance the most difficult task will be accomplished.

proverbs: Pípẹ́ ni yó pẹ̀ẹ́, akọ̀pẹ yó wàá sílẹ̀.
meaning: With patience, what one desires will eventually happen.

proverbs: Pípẹ́ ni yó pẹ̀ẹ́, amòòkùn yó jàáde nínú odò.
meaning: If one is patient, what is bound to happen will eventually happen.

proverbs: Pípẹ́ ni yó pẹ̀ẹ́, èké ò mú rá.
meaning: Truth will unfailingly triumph in the end.

proverbs: Pípẹ́ ni yó pẹ̀ẹ́, ẹní lọ sódò á bọ̀ wálé.
meaning: There is no journey that does not end sometime.

proverbs: Pípẹ́ ni yó pẹ́ẹ́, Ọ̀rúnmìlà yó jẹ àgbàdo dandan.
meaning: What one deserves will unfailingly come one’s way in the end.

proverbs: Rò ó kóo tó ṣe é; ó sàn ju kóo ṣé kóo tó rò ó.
meaning: Plan ahead

proverbs: Rọra dì, ká lè bá ọ sá.
meaning: A person who wants other people’s help must lighten his or her baggage.

proverbs: Sà á bí olóògùn-ún ti wí.
meaning: Always follow instructions, and do not presume to know better than your instructor.

proverbs: Sùúrù loògùn ayé.
meaning: Patience solves all problems.

proverbs: Sùúrù-ú lérè.
meaning: Patience is a useful quality to cultivate.

proverbs: Ṣàǹgbákó ró, a ní kò róo re, Ṣàǹgbàkù-ú gbè é lẹ́sẹ̀.
meaning: Do not choose to do things that others before you have been condemned for doing.

proverbs: Ṣe-ká-rí-mi, alájá tó so ẹ̀gi mọ́rùn.
meaning: Do not go to too great lengths to call people’s attention to yourself.

proverbs: ‘‘Ṣé kí n fìdí hẹ?’’ làfòmọ́ fi ń di onílé.
meaning: Give people an inch, and they are likely to take several miles.

proverbs: Ṣe-ǹ-ṣe dìwọ̀fà, bó ṣe é yó dẹrú-u wọn.
meaning: One should desist from pursuits that have proved unprofitable.

proverbs: Ṣe-ǹ-ṣe ewúrẹ́ làgùntàn ń fiyè sí.
meaning: One would be wise to learn from the behavior and plight of fools.

proverbs: ‘‘Ta á sí i’’ kì í báni wá ọfà.
meaning: People are ever eager to goad one to action but never to help one carry out the task.

proverbs: Ta ní rán Abẹ́lù wọ ọkọ̀, tó ní ọkọ̀ọ́ ri òun?
meaning: People who get into trouble by their own actions should complain to no one.

proverbs: ‘‘Tàná là ń jà lé lórí’’ ló pa Baálẹ̀ẹ Kòmọ̀kan.
meaning: It is wise to let the past alone.

proverbs: Tantabùlù, aṣòróówọ̀ bí ẹ̀wù àṣejù.
meaning: Disgrace is not a pleasant thing to live with.

proverbs: Tìjà tìjà ní ń ṣe ará Ọ̀pọ́ndá.
meaning: Said of people who are always out for a fight.

proverbs: Tọ̀sán tọ̀sán ní ń pọ́n ìtalẹ̀ lójú; bílẹ̀-ẹ́ bá ṣú yó di olóńjẹ.
meaning: Patience will bring what one lacks.

proverbs: Wàrà ò sí lónìí, wàrà-á wà lọ́la.
meaning: Today’s want will be followed by tomorrow’s plenty.

proverbs: Wẹ́rẹ́ wẹ́rẹ́ nikán ń jẹlé.
meaning: Inconspicuous and imperceptible problems in time become huge disasters.

proverbs: Wíwò-ó tó ìran.
meaning: One would do well just to watch spectacles and avoid becoming part of them.

proverbs: ‘‘Wó ilé ẹ kí n bá ọ kọ’’: ẹrù ikán kan ní ń pa fúnni.
meaning: Never trust people who goad you into trouble with promises of help down the road.

proverbs: Sùúrù ò lópin.
meaning: One must never tire of exercising patience.

proverbs: Wọ̀bìà-á yó tán, ó pe ẹgbẹ́ ẹ̀ wá.
meaning: The freeloader  always seeks opportunities to take as much as possible from his or her benefactor.

proverbs: Wọ́n ní, ‘‘Ìbàrìbá, ọmọ ẹ-ẹ́ jalè.’’ Ó ní ‘‘A gbọ́ tolè tó jà; èwo lokùn ọrùn-un ẹ̀?’’
meaning: Punishment should fit the offense, not be disproportionate.

proverbs: Wọ́n purọ́ fún ọ, o ò gbà; o lè dé ìdí òótọ́?
meaning: Since one can seldom be sure what the truth is, one would save oneself a great deal of grief by not always insisting on it.

proverbs: Wọ́n torí ajá ń lóṣòó lọ fowó rọ̀bọ.
meaning: One should not pass up something useful for something useless simply because the latter looks better.

proverbs: Yíyọ́ ẹkùn, tojo kọ́; ohun tí yó jẹ ní ń wá.
meaning: Do not mistake people’s gentle nature for spinelessness.

proverbs: Yọkọlú-yọkọlú, kò ha tán bí? Ìyàwó gbọ́kọ ṣánlẹ̀, ọkọ́ yọké.
meaning: Said of braggarts who have been taken down a few notches.

proverbs: A hán ìkokò lọ́wọ́ ọ̀tún, a hán ìkokò lẹ́sẹ̀ òsì; ó ku ẹni tí yóò kò ó lójú.
meaning: Inflicting such injuries on the hyena is no victory; it only makes the animal more dangerous.

proverbs: A kì í dá ẹ̀rù okó ń lá ba arúgbó.
meaning: A person who has seen everything is not easily frightened.

proverbs: A kì í dùbúlẹ̀ ṣubú.
meaning: Hunger cannot make one faint and fall if one goes to sleep.

proverbs: A kì í fi ojoojúmọ́ rí olè jà kó dà bí-i tọwọ́ ẹni.
meaning: Self-sufficiency is far better than fortunate opportunism.

proverbs: A kì í fi ojú olójú ṣòwò ká jèrè.
meaning: There is nothing like attending to one’s business oneself.

proverbs: A kì í fi ojúbọ́rọ́ gba ọmọ lọ́wọ́ èkùrọ́.
meaning: It takes effort to accomplish a good end.

proverbs: A kì í gbọ́ ‘‘gbì’’ ìràwé.
meaning: Incantatory assertion that an accident will not befall the subject.

proverbs: A kì í mọ ibi tí à ń lọ kí ọrùn ó wọ ẹni.
meaning: If one knows the size of the task, one should regulate one’s effort accordingly.

proverbs: A kì í sọ pé ọjà-á nígbà; bó bá nígbà, kíníṣe tí wọ́n tún ń ná a?
meaning: Any time is a good time to trade.

proverbs: A kì í ṣe ọ̀jẹ̀ ṣe ojú tì mí; konko lojú alágbe.
meaning: One must assume the attitude one’s trade demands.

proverbs: A kì í ṣe ọ̀tẹ̀ eranko gán-ń-gán; bí a bá he ìgbín àdá là ń nà á.
meaning: Give your all to every enterprise you embark upon.

proverbs: A kì í walẹ̀ fún adìẹ jẹ.
meaning: Each person is responsible for his or her own welfare.

proverbs: À ń pa ẹ̀kukù, ẹ̀kukù ń rúwé; à ń yan nínú aṣẹro, aṣẹro ń dàgbà; à ń kébòsí Ògún, ara Ògún ń le.
meaning: Because the two plants are hardy and virtually indestructible, and Ògún is the formidable god of metals and war, the proverb bespeaks resilience and invulnerability.

proverbs: À ń pòyì ká apá, apá ò ká apá; à ń pòyì ká oṣè, apá ò ká oṣè; à ń pòyì ká kàǹga, kò ṣé bínú kó sí.
meaning: The three items listed are formidable in their different ways and have nothing to fear from people.

proverbs: ‘‘A ò mọ̀yí Ọlọ́run yó ṣe’’ kò jẹ́ ká bínú kú.
meaning: Often it is hope that keeps people going.

proverbs: A pa ẹmọ́ lóko ilá, a jù ú sí ọ̀kẹ́ ìlasa; ilé ẹmọ́ lẹmọ́ lọ.
meaning: The resourceful person will find a way to adapt to any situation.

proverbs: Ààrẹ àgòrò tó bá gbójú, tòun tolúwa-a rẹ̀ lẹgbẹ́ra.
meaning: Audaciousness will get one one’s way.

proverbs: Abẹ́rẹ́ á lọ kí ọ̀nà okùn tó dí.
meaning: Unlike the thread’s, the passage of the needle through the cloth is ver smooth.

proverbs: Abẹ̀wẹ̀ ń wá ọ̀tá fúnra ẹ̀.
meaning: It is best to be self-sufficient.

proverbs: Abiyamọ ọ̀tá àgàn; ẹní ń ṣiṣẹ́ ọ̀tá ọ̀lẹ.
meaning: The mother incurs the envy of a barren woman; the hard worker incurs the hatred of the idler.

proverbs: Aboyún bí, ìhá tù ú.
meaning: Relief comes in time to the persevering sufferer.

proverbs: Àdán tó sùn sídìí ọsàn ò rí he, áḿbọ̀sì oódẹ tó ní òún jí dé.
meaning: The more persistent person will surely be rewarded before the less persistent.

proverbs: Adékànḿbí ò du oyè; ó bèèrè ni.
meaning: One should not be coy in demanding one’s rights.

proverbs: Adùn ní ń gbẹ̀hìn ewúro.
meaning: Sweetness and pleasure come after exertion.

proverbs: Adùn-ún tán lára aṣọ ogóje; a nà án han ẹni méje; a bẹ̀ ẹ́ wò a rí iná méje; ó di ọjọ̀ keje ó fàya.
meaning: One gets what one pays for.

proverbs: A-fàkàrà-jẹ̀kọ́ ò mọ iyì ọbẹ̀.
meaning: Whoever leads a sheltered life misses out on some great experiences.

proverbs: Afẹ́fẹ́ kì í fẹ́ kí omi inú àgbọn dànù.
meaning: Certain people are not susceptible to certain disasters.

proverbs: Àfẹjútoto ò mọ ọkùnrin.
meaning: Action is more persuasive than appearance.

proverbs: Àfẹ́ká là ń fẹ́ iná.
meaning: One should apply one’s best effort to any task.

proverbs: Agẹmọ ò ṣé-é jẹ lẹ́nu.
meaning: Certain propositions are beyond the pale.

proverbs: Àgùdà ò jẹ lábẹ̀-ẹ Gẹ̀ẹ́sì.
meaning: An assertion of nondependence on a supposedly higher authority.

proverbs: Àgbà tí kò tó ọmọdé-é rán níṣ ní ń sọ pé kó bu omi wá ká jọ mu.
meaning: One who is sure of his or her authority does not need to sweeten orders with incentives.

proverbs: Àgbàbọ́ ò di tẹni.
meaning: There is nothing like having one’s own.

proverbs: Àgbàbọ̀-ọ ṣòkòtò, bí kò fúnni lẹ́sẹ̀ a ṣoni; rẹ́mú-rẹ́mú ni ohun ẹni ń báni mu.
meaning: Borrowed articles are never like one’s own.

proverbs: Àgbàká lèéfí ń gba igbó.
meaning: Whatever is worth doing is worth doing diligently and thoroughly.

proverbs: Àgbàká lẹsẹ̀ ń gba ọ̀nà.
meaning: Indulge not in half measures.

proverbs: Àgbaǹgbá ṣe bẹ́ẹ̀, ó làwo lórí san-san.
meaning: Perseverance overcomes all difficulties.

proverbs: Àgbàrá kọ́ ni yó gbèé omi lọ.
meaning: The upstart cannot prevail against the well-established person.

proverbs: Àgbàtán ni gẹ̀gẹ̀ ń gba ọ̀fun.
meaning: One cannot stop matters from running their course.

proverbs: Àgbẹ̀ gbóko róṣù.
meaning: The conscientious farmer spends long periods on the farm; persistence is the key to success.

proverbs: Àgbinsínú legbin ń gbin; àkùnsínú lẹkùn ń kùn; hùn hùn hùn ẹlẹ́dẹ̀ inú ẹlẹ́dẹ̀ ní ń gbé.
meaning: People may grumble, but they dare not voice their complaints openly.

proverbs: Agbójúlógún fi ara-a rẹ̀ fóṣì ta.
meaning: One should secure one’s own living.

proverbs: Àgbólà ni tàgbọ̀nrín; ọjọ́ tí àgbọ̀nrín bá gbó ni ọjọ̀ ikú-u rẹ̀ ń yẹ̀.
meaning: Every reverse portends good fortune in the end.

proverbs: Àìdúró là ń pè níjó.
meaning: Continuous striving deserves praise, whatever the outcome.

proverbs: Àìtó ehín-ín ká ni à ń fọwọ́ bò ó.
meaning: One should not be reticient in asserting oneself.

proverbs: Ajá ilé ò mọdẹ-ẹ́ ṣe.
meaning: Pampering kills initiative.

proverbs: Àjà kì í jìn mọ́ ológbò lẹ́sẹ̀.
meaning: Some people are immune to certain perils.

proverbs: Ajá tó máa rún ọkà á láyà; ológbò to máa jẹ àkèré á ki ojú bọ omi.
meaning: It takes a great effort to accomplish a great feat.

proverbs: Ajá wéré-wéré ní ń pa ikún.
meaning: The world belongs to the quick.

proverbs: Ajá wo ẹyẹ láwòmọ́jú.
meaning: Against adversaries beyond one’s powers, one must be satisfied with futile gestures.

proverbs: Ajé sọ ọmọ nù bí òkò.
meaning: The search for wealth takes one into distant lands.

proverbs: Àjẹgbé nigún ń jẹbọ.
meaning: Some people can engage in daring and dangerous behavior with impunity.

proverbs: Ajìnfìn, má ta ojú ilé; ọ̀pọ̀lọ̀ jìnfìn má ta ojú àtijáde.
meaning: Certain predicaments one does not get out of in a hurry.

proverbs: A-jókò-ó-kunkun ò jẹ́ kí a-jókòó-jẹ́jẹ́ ó jókòo.
meaning: The meek will not inherit the earth.

proverbs: Àjùmọ̀bí ò kan ti àrùn; kí alápá mú apá-a rẹ̀ kó le.
meaning: Relatives will not bear your disease for you.

proverbs: A-ká-ìgbá-tà-á náwó ikú.
meaning: Whoever engages in a dangerous venture more than earns his or her pay.

proverbs: Àkànṣe lọfà ìmàdò; jagan oró ò ran èse.
meaning: Certain tasks call for deliberate and extraordinary efforts.

proverbs: Àkèekèé ní òún kúrò ní kòkòrò-o kí nìyí?
meaning: Stature and importance are not always commensurate; some people should not be underestimated.

proverbs: Àkèekèé rìn tapó-tapó.
meaning: The stalwart is never unprepared to answer a call.

proverbs: Akíkanjú-kankan, ogun ní ń lọ; abùwàwà, ọjà ní ń ná; àkànní òbúkọ, bó bá tòṣì a máa rí jẹ.
meaning: Proper application of one’s talent makes one prosper.

proverbs: Àkótán ni gẹ̀gẹ̀ ńkó ọ̀fun.
meaning: Calamities give no quarter.

proverbs: Àkùkọ-ọ́ kọ, ọ̀lẹ́ pòṣé.
meaning: The coming of the morning is an annoyance to the lazy person.

proverbs: Alágẹmọ-ọ́ ti bímọ-ọ rẹ̀ ná; àìmọ̀-ọ́jó kù sọ́wọ́-ọ rẹ̀.
meaning: A parent has done his or her part by having a child; the child’s fortunes are the child’s responsibility.

proverbs: Alágbàró ò yege; aláṣọ á gbà á bó dọ̀la.
meaning: There is nothing like having one’s own.

proverbs: Alákatam̀pò ojú ò lè ta ẹran pa.
meaning: Even the most vicious of looks cannot kill.

proverbs: Aláǹgbá tó já látorí ìrókò tí kò fẹsẹ̀ ṣẹ́, ó ní b nìkan ò yìn un òun ó yinra òun.
meaning: One should be self-confident enough not to need validation by others.

proverbs: Alára ní ń gbára-á ga; bádí bá máa wọ̀ọ̀dẹ̀ a bẹ̀rẹ̀.
meaning: One should sound one’s own trumpet and not be unduly humble.

proverbs: A-lèjà-má-lè-jà-pẹ́: ẹlẹgb ojo.
meaning: Ability to start a fight is nothing like the ability to see it through.

proverbs: Àlejò orí ni kókó.
meaning: One should learn to live with afflictions.

proverbs: Apá lará; ìgbọ̀nwọ́ niyèkan.
meaning: Even more reliable than one’s relatives and siblings are one’s own resources.

proverbs: Àpáàdì-í gbóko kò rà.
meaning: Resilience is a fortunate quality to have.

proverbs: Àpagbé lOrò ń pagi.
meaning: When unanswerable disaster befalls a person, there is neither recourse nor response.

proverbs: Apárí ní ń fojú di abẹ.
meaning: The bald person has no use for razors.

proverbs: Apẹ́ẹ́jẹ kì í jẹ ìbàjẹ́ .
meaning: Those who are patient will have the best of things.

proverbs: Àpọntán kò wí pé kí odò má sun.
meaning: If one’s resources are limitless, some use will not exhaust them.

proverbs: Ara kì í wúwo kí alára má lè gbe.
meaning: Whatever others might feel, a person is never put off by himself or his own habits.

proverbs: Ara-à mí gba òtútù, ó gba ọ̀nini.
meaning: I am long-suffering.

proverbs: Àràbà ńlá fojú di àáké.
meaning: It takes a mighty person to defy a powerful force.

proverbs: Àríṣe làríkà.
meaning: Whoever accomplishes something worthwhile has a story to tell.

proverbs: Ariwo àjìjà ní ń dọ́run.
meaning: One’s enemies may be clamorous, but all they are capable of is noise.

proverbs: Àro-ó pẹ́ lóko, kò tún mọ ìlù-ú lù.
meaning: If one neglects one’s specialty long enough, one becomes incompetent at it.

proverbs: Asúrétete ní ń wojú ọjọ́.
meaning: When one has important tasks at hand, one pays particular attention to impinging conditions.

proverbs: Àṣá ò gbádìẹ níkọ̀kọ̀; gbangba làṣá ń gbádìẹ.
meaning: What one dare do, one does openly.

proverbs: Àṣá ò lè balẹ̀ kó gbéwúrẹ́.
meaning: Whoever attempts the impossible deceives himself or herself.

proverbs: Àṣá wo ahun títí; àwòdí wo ahun títí; idì baba àṣá, kí ló lè fi ahun ṣe?
meaning: When the prey’s defenses are impenetrable, the predator can only glare.

proverbs: Àṣá wo ìgbín kọ̀rọ̀; ìkaraun-un rẹ̀ ò jẹ́ kó gbé e.
meaning: This is a more mundane version of the previous entry.

proverbs: Àṣá wọ̀bọ kò rọ́wọ́ gbé e.
meaning: A monkey is no prey to a kite.

proverbs: Àṣírí ìkokò, ajá kọ́ ni yó tùú u.
meaning: The stalwart’s comeuppance will not happen at the hands of a no-account person.

proverbs: Àtẹ́lẹwọ́ ẹni kì í tanni.
meaning: One’s trust is best placed in one’s own resources.

proverbs: Àyè kì í há adìẹ kó má dèé ìdí àba-a rẹ̀.
meaning: No obstacle should keep one from one’s duty.

proverbs: Bí a bá ńpa èpo oṣè, ṣe ní ń máaá sanra sí i.
meaning: The more a certain person is misused, the more successful he or she becomes

proverbs: Bí a kò bá jìyà tó kún agbọ̀n; a ò lè jẹ oore tó kún ahá.
meaning: Suffering precedes pleasures.

proverbs: Bí a kò bá ṣe bí ẹlẹ́dẹ̀ lọ́nà Ìkòròdú, a ò lè ṣe bí Adégbọrọ̀ lọ́jà ọba.
meaning: Before one can live in luxury, one must soil one’s hands with work.

proverbs: Bí ebí bá ń pa ọ̀lẹ, à jẹ́ kó kú.
meaning: Shiftless people deserve no sympathy.

proverbs: Bí ẹkẹ́-ẹ tálákà ò tó lówùúrọ̀, á tó lálẹ́.
meaning: The things one rejects when the choice is abundant will become acceptable when there is no choice.

proverbs: Bí ẹnìkan ò kíni ‘‘Kú-ù-jokòó,’’ kíkí Ọlọ́run-ún ju ti igba èèyàn lọ.
meaning: Being snubbed by people matters nothing, as long as God does not snub you.

proverbs: Bí ẹrú yó bàá jẹ ìfun, ibi ẹ̀dọ̀ ní-í tí ń bẹ̀rẹ̀.
meaning: One must endure unpleasantness before achieving one’s ends.

proverbs: Bí ẹ̀yá bá dẹkùn, ẹran ní ń pajẹ.
meaning: When the child becomes an adult, he adopts adult ways.

proverbs: Bí ìbí bá tẹ̀, bí ìbí bá wọ́, oníkálukú a máa ṣe baba nílé ara-a rẹ̀.
meaning: In difficult times, each person has the solace and security of his own home.

proverbs: Bí ilẹ̀-ẹ́ bá mọ́, ojú orun lọ̀lẹ ń wà.
meaning: Lazy people will not rouse themselves to do an honest day’s work.

proverbs: Bí iná kò bá tán láṣọ, ẹ̀jẹ̀ kì í tán léèékánná.
meaning: If the causes of one’s problems are not removed, the problems will persist.

proverbs: Bí ìṣẹ́ bá ń ṣẹ́ ọ̀dọ́ láṣẹ̀ẹ́jù, kó lọ sígbó erin: bó bá pa erin ìṣẹ́-ẹ rẹ̀ a tán; bí erín bá pá a, ìṣẹ́-ẹ rẹ̀ a tán.
meaning: People in desperate straits should resort to desperate remedies; whatever the outcome, they will be no worse off than before.

proverbs: Bí iwájú ò bá ṣeé lọ sí, ẹ̀hìn a ṣeé padà sí.
meaning: If a goal proves impossible of achievement, one can at least abandon it.

proverbs: Bí màlúù-ú tó màlúù, ọ̀pá kan ni Fúlàní fi ń dà wọ́n.
meaning: The good worker needs no elaborate tools.

proverbs: ‘‘Bí mo lè kú ma kú’’ lọmọkùrín fi ń lágbára; ‘‘N ò lè wáá kú’’ lọmọkùnrín fi ń lẹ.
meaning: Daring makes the man; caution unmakes the man.

proverbs: Bí ó pẹ́ títí, akólòlò á pe baba.
meaning: With perseverance, the most difficult task will eventually be accomplished.

proverbs: Bí ó pẹ́ títí, àlejò á di onílé.
meaning: Persistence leads to success.

proverbs: Bí ó ti wuni là ń ṣe ìmàle ẹni; bó wu Lèmámù a fẹlẹ́dẹ̀ jẹ sààrì.
meaning: One lives one’s life as one sees fit.

proverbs: Bí Ògún ẹní bá dánilójú,àfigbárí.
meaning: If one is sure of one’s position, one confidently swears by anything.

proverbs: Bí ojú kò pọ́nni bí osùn, a kì í he ohun pupa bí idẹ.
meaning: Unless one endures some hardship, one does not reap great benefits.

proverbs: Bí ojú owó ẹni ò yóni, ènì ò lè yóni.
meaning: A person who cannot survive on his main occupation cannot survive on his sideline.

proverbs: Bí ojúmọ́ mọ́ lékèélékèé a yalé ẹlẹ́fun, agbe a yalé aláró, àlùkò a yalé olósùn.
meaning: Diligent people never dally in pursuing their trade.

proverbs: Bí ọwọ́ kò sin ilẹ̀, tí kò sin ẹnu, ayo ní ń jẹ́ .
meaning: If one keeps at a task, it will eventually be accomplished.

proverbs: Bí Ṣàǹgó bá ń pa àràbà, tó ń pa ìrókò, bíi tigi ńlá kọ́.
meaning: A boast that the person being referred to is mightier than even the mightiest other person around.

proverbs: Dàńdógó kì í ṣe wù ọmọdé.
meaning: Certain feats are beyond certain people.

proverbs: Dídán là ń dán ọ̀ràn wò; bí olówó ẹní kú, à lọ ṣúpó.
meaning: One should attempt even the impossible.

proverbs: Dídán lẹyẹlé ń dán kú.
meaning: Either an observation that a person’s reputation cannot be tarnished or a wish that it never become tarnished.

proverbs: Díẹ̀-díẹ̀ leku ń jawọ.
meaning: With slow and steady application, even a difficult task will be done.

proverbs: Díẹ̀-díẹ̀ lẹyẹ ń mu ọsàn.
meaning: Easy does it.

proverbs: Díẹ̀-díẹ̀ ní ń tánṣẹ́ .
meaning: The biggest task is accomplished with gradual and steady attention.

proverbs: Dùndún fọ̀ràn gbogbo ṣàpamọ́ra.
meaning: It is best to be stoically resilient.

proverbs: Ebè kan ṣoṣo àkùrọ́ kúrò ní ‘‘Mo fẹ́rẹ̀ẹ́ ṣíwọ́.’’
meaning: The first step is not nearly the completion of a long journey.

proverbs: Ebi ni yó kọ̀ọ́ wèrè lọ́gbọ́n.
meaning: Even an imbecile must heed hunger.

proverbs: Ebí ń pa ejò, ahún ń yan.
meaning: If one is invulnerable, one may strut.

proverbs: Ebi ò jẹ́ ká pa ọwọ́ mọ́; ebí ṣẹnú papala.
meaning: One must work in order to eat.

proverbs: Èdì kì í mú ọjọ́ kó má là.
meaning: What is inevitable will come to pass, willy-nilly.

proverbs: Èébú kì í so.
meaning: Insult ignored is insult defused.

proverbs: Eégún tí ń jẹ orí ẹṣin, orí àgbò ò lè kò ó láyà.
meaning: A person who has faced down serious challenges will not be defeated by a slight inconvenience.

proverbs: Èèwọ̀ ni tọwọ̀; a kì í figi ọwọ̀ dáná.
meaning: Come what may, a threatening or threatened disaster will not happen.

proverbs: Èèyàn ìbáà kúrú, ìbáà búrẹ́wà, gbèsè ò sí, ìtìjú ò sí.
meaning: As long as one is debt-free, other details of one’s personal circumstances are of little consequence.

proverbs: Èkó ilá gba ara ẹ̀ lọ́wọ́ ọ̀bẹ.
meaning: At some point, one outgrows some dangers.

proverbs: Èminrin ń jẹni, ò tó ìyà.
meaning: Whatever one’s problems, they can always be worse.

proverbs: Èpè ìbínú ò pa odì.
meaning: One gets only psychological satisfaction from cursing one’s enemy.

proverbs: Èpè ìlasa kì í ja àgbọ̀nrín.
meaning: One cannot be at risk for what one cannot help doing.

proverbs: Èpò ìbúlẹ̀ kì í pa irẹ́ .
meaning: A puny person is no threat to a mighty person.

proverbs: Erín jẹ̀ jẹ̀ jẹ̀ kò fọwọ́ kọ́ aṣá; ẹfọ̀n-ọn jẹ̀ jẹ̀ jẹ̀ kò ki ẹsẹ̀ wọ pòòlò; ẹyẹ kékèké ń fò lókè wọn ò forí gbági.
meaning: Despite the ubiquitousness of danger, one can be safe.

proverbs: Èṣì ò rọ́ba dádé; Ògúnṣọṣẹ́ ò róòrùn wẹ̀wù ẹ̀jẹ̀; òdòdó ò róòrùn pọ́n; ilé ọmọ lọmọ́ ti pọ́n wá.
meaning: Native genius needs no external cultivation.

proverbs: Eṣinṣín ń pọntí; ekòló ń ṣú ọ̀lẹ̀lẹ̀; kantí-kantí ní ká wá nǹkan dí agbè l nu kí ǹkankan má kòó sí i.
meaning: The idler seeks to find more work for those already fully and usefully employed.

proverbs: Eṣú jẹ oko tán eṣú lọ; eṣú lọ Wata, ilé-e rẹ̀.
meaning: When one’s task is completed, one returns to one’s home. Or, the marauder has done his damage and has gone back where he came from.

proverbs: Ewu iná kì í pa àwòdì.
meaning: The bird is beyond any harm the fire might do.

proverbs: Ewúrẹ́ ń ṣọdún; àgùtán gbàlù sẹ́hìn; òbúkọ-ọ́ ní ká sin òun lọ sílé àna òun.
meaning: A person who has made no investment should not expect to reap the benefits of the venture.

proverbs: Ewúrẹ́ ò lè rí ewé ọdán òkè fi ṣe nǹkan.
meaning: Certain people are beyond the reach of other people’s machinations.

proverbs: Ewúro ò fi tojo korò.
meaning: One does what one must, regardless of the actions or wishes of others.

proverbs: Ẹbọ jíjẹ kì í pa igún.
meaning: One cannot be hurt by one’s natural calling.

proverbs: Ẹgbẹ̀rún eèrà ò lè gbé ṣúgà; wọ́n ó kàn tò yí i ká lásán ni.
meaning: Some tasks are beyond certain people.

proverbs: Ẹgbẹ̀rún ẹja ò lè dẹ́rù pa odò.
meaning: It is futile to attempt to overwhelm an invincible person.

proverbs: Ẹ̀hìn ológbò kì í balẹ̀.
meaning: One’s opponent in a fight will never succeed in throwing one.

proverbs: Ẹjọ́ ẹlẹ́jọ́, lọ́yà ń rò ó, áḿbọ̀ǹtorí ẹjọ́ ara-a rẹ̀.
meaning: One who is conscientious on behalf of others can be expected 18. This is a reference to the cat’s ability to right itself and land on its feet, however much one tries to drop it on its back. The saying is most often used by wrestlers as an incantation to prevent their opponents from throwing them. to be even more conscientious on his or her own behalf.

proverbs: Ẹlẹ́mùn-ún ò mú eégún.
meaning: Certain people are beyond anyone’s control.

proverbs: Ẹ̀lukú tí kò ní èlè lẹgbẹ́-ẹ rẹ̀ ń ṣá pa.
meaning: Whoever goes into a contest less prepared than his or her adversary is in for trouble.

proverbs: Ẹ̀lúlùú ní kàkà kí òun má dun ọbẹ̀, òun á rúnwọ rúnsẹ̀ sí i.
meaning: One vows that even up to the cost of one’s life, one will give everything one has to achieve an end.

proverbs: Ẹní bá ń jẹ òbúkọ tó gbójú, yó jẹ àgùtàn tó yọ̀wo.
meaning: A person known for daring deeds can always be expected to defy custom; one cannot cure people of ingrained habits.

proverbs: Ẹní bá ń ṣiṣẹ́ kì í ṣọ̀lẹ; bórí bá túnniṣe a kì í tẹ́ bọ̀rọ̀.
meaning: Diligence in one’s pursuit will certainly result in prosperity.

proverbs: Ẹní bá yẹ ọ̀nà Ìjẹ̀bú tì ni yó yẹ̀ ẹ́ tán.
meaning: The shirker will sooner or later be forced to do his or her duty; one should do a thing efficiently, not halfheartedly.

proverbs: Ẹni èèyàn ò kí kó yọ̀; ẹni Ọlọ́run ò kí kó ṣọ́ra.
meaning: God’s favor is preferable to that of other people.

proverbs: Ẹní gbani láya ò ní kírú ẹni má rà.
meaning: A person who injures you cannot stop you from pursuing your destiny.

proverbs: Ẹní máa jẹ oyin inú àpáta kìí wo ẹnu àáké.
meaning: One should be prepared to make the sacrifices necessary to achieve a worthy goal.

proverbs: Ẹní máa jẹun kunkun a tìlẹ̀kùn kun-kun.
meaning: To prevent intrusion into one’s affairs, one should keep them well guarded.

proverbs: Ẹní máa rí àtisùn akàn á pẹ́ létí isà.
meaning: Whoever seeks the impossible will wait forever.

proverbs: Ẹní máa rí àtisùn-un pẹ́pẹ́yẹ á jẹ gbèsè àdín.
meaning: Whoever awaits the impossible will wait forever.

proverbs: Ẹni ọ̀lẹ́ pa-á re ọ̀run òṣì; ẹni iṣ pa-á re ọ̀run ẹ̀yẹ.
meaning: Better to die on one’s feet than to give in to reverses.

proverbs: Ẹni tí à ń bọ́ ò mọ̀ pé ìyàn-án mú.
meaning: A person who has no responsibilities does not appreciate the efforts of those who do.

proverbs: Ẹni tí eégún ńlé kó máa rọ́jú; bó ti ń rẹ ará ayé, bẹ́ẹ̀ ní ń rẹ ará ọ̀run.
meaning: Perseverance solves all problems.

proverbs: Ẹni tí iṣẹ́ ń pa-á yá ju ẹni tí ìṣẹ́ ń pa.
meaning: Better to succumb to overwork or occupational hazards than to succumb to poverty.

proverbs: Ẹni tí kíkí-i rẹ̀ ò yóni, àìkí-i rẹ̀ ò lè pani lébi.
meaning: A person whose benevolence has little effect on one’s fortune cannot affect one with malevolence.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ńgbẹ́lẹ̀ ní ńsìnkú; ẹni tí ńsunkún ariwo ló ńpa.
meaning: Tangible help is better than useless sympathetic gestures.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ó bá ní ìtara ló ní àtètèbá.
meaning: Industry ensures success.

proverbs: Ẹni tó bá ń jẹ lábẹ́-ẹ Jẹ́gẹ́dẹ́ ló ń pè é nÍgi Àràbà.
meaning: Only those beholden to a person are compelled to flatter him or her

proverbs: Ẹni tí ó bá pẹ́ lẹ́hìn ni à ń yọ́ omi ọbẹ̀ dè.
meaning: Timeliness earns one the best choice, tardiness the worst.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ó bá wo ojú ìyàwó ní ń mọ̀ pé ìyàwó ń sunkún.
meaning: It is futile to seek sympathy when no one is paying attention.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ó bẹ Ìgè Àdùbí níṣẹ́, ara-a rẹ̀ ló bẹ̀; Ìgè Àdùbí ò níí jẹ́, bẹ́ẹ̀ni kò níí kọ̀.
meaning: One should expect little from a spoiled child.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ó fò sókè-é bí ijó lórí.
meaning: Nothing more can be expected from a person who has given the ultimate effort.

proverbs: Ẹni tí ó forí sọlẹ̀-ẹ́ gbìyànjú ikú.
meaning: One should acknowledge people’s sincere efforts.
